inhuman, savage, POxy. 1681.6 (iii A. D.).
without pain: Act., not giving pain, Hsch., EM 97.43. Adv. -ως ib. 44. Cf. ἀνήνιος.
call to mind, v.l. in X.Eph. 1.11.
redistribution, Eur. Fr. 748.
relapse, ἐς στάσιν J. BJ 5.6.1.
return to the path, S. Ichn. 160.
up-hill, opp. κάταντα (q. v.), Il. 23.116.
without a struggle, Th. 4.92; ἀ. εὔνοια unchallenged, i.e. unalloyed goodwill, Id. 2.45; ἀ. γέρας ἔλαχεν without having to strive for it, Ph. 1.646. Adv. -τως Plu. Lat.viv. 2.1128b.

children.label: II
children.definition: irresistible, Ph. 1.454, al., Plu. Phoc. 14; ἐρώτημα Polem. Call. 50.

children.label: III
children.definition: without a rival, incomparable, Ph. 2.6, al.
not to be exchanged, Gloss.
suppressed apodosis in a conditional sentence, Anon. Fig p.157 S.
without apodosis: τὸ ἀ. hypothetical proposition wanting the consequent clause, Sch. Ar. Pl. 469.

up-hill, steep, opp. κατάντης, χωρίον Hdt. 2.29; πεδία Hp. Aër. 19; ὁδός, ἀνάβασις, Pl. R. 364d, 515e; πρὸς ἄναντες ἐλαύνειν, opp. κατὰ πρανοῦς, X. Eq. 3.7, cf. Pl. Phdr. 247b; πρὸς τὸ ἄ. τῶν πολιτειῶν in the ascending scale of our constitutions, Id. R. 568c; πρὸς ὑψηλὰ καὶ ἀνάντη Id. Lg. 732c.
what one dares not face, Plu. Adul. 2.67b: metaph., irrefragable, διαίρεσις Procl. in Alc. p.201 C.
not to be contradicted, Olymp. in Phlb. p.247 S.; αἵρεσις Simp. in Epict. p.7 D., al.

children.label: II
children.definition: without contrary or opposite, Dam. Pr. 26, Anon. in Cat. 23.21.
undisputed, PHib. 95.13; incontestable, Cic. QF 2.8.1, Luc. Eun. 13; not to be opposed δεήσεις J. AJ 19.1.4. Adv. -τως Aen.Tact. 31.9, Str. 13.3.6, Luc. Cal. 6.
insensible to, ἀλγηδόνων Dsc. Eup. 1.12.

not to be opposed, Plb. 6.7.7, 28.13.4; undeniable, Act. Ap. 19.36; λόγοι S.E. M. 8.160. Adv. -τως without opposition, by consent, Plb. 22.8.11; incontrovertibly, OGI 335.138 (Pergam.), Aët. 15.15; without gainsaying, Act. Ap. 10.29.
giving no resistance, S.E. M. 9.411.
not answering, Cic. Att. 15.13.2.
unanswered, Cic. Att. 6.1.23, PRyl. 78.30 (ii A. D.).
draw up or out, ποταμοὺς ἀ. κοχλίαις Str. 3.2.9: metaph., exhaust, go patiently through, πόνους D.H. 8.51; συμφοράς D.Chr. 12.51.
not winnowed or bruised, dub. in S. Fr. 294.

definition: ἄναξ [ ᾰ], ἄνακτος (cf. Ἄνακες), ὁ, rarely fem. ὦ ἄνα for ἄνασσα, Pi. P. 12.4, cf. A. Fr. 342: ( ϝάναξ IG 4.236 ( Corinth), etc., cf. ϝάνακες 4.564 ( Argos)):—

children.definition: lord, master,

ἄγουσι δὲ δῶρα Ἄνακτι Il. 1.390, al.; ὁ Πύθιος ἄναξ A. Ag. 509; ἄναξ Ἄπολλον ib. 513, Eu. 85, etc.; ὦναξ Ἄπ. S. OT 80; ὦναξ without Ἄπολλον, Hdt. 1.159, 4.150, al.; of Zeus, Hom. only in voc., Ζεῦ ἄνα Il. 3.351, 16.233; Ζεὺς ἄναξ A. Pers. 762; ἄναξ ἀνάκτων . . Ζεῦ Id. Supp. 524; μὰ τὸν Δία τὸν Ἄνακτα D. 35.40; Poseidon, A. Th. 130; ὦ δέσποτʼ ἄναξ, of Ἀήρ, Ar. Nu. 264; of Apollo Ἀγυιεύς, Id. V. 875; ὦναξ δέσποτα, of Πλοῦτος, Id. Pl. 748; esp. of the Dioscuri, cf. Ἄνακες, Ἄνακοι; of all the gods, πάντων ἀνάκτων . . κοινοβωμίαν A. Supp. 222, cf. Pi. O. 10(11).49.—The irreg. voc. ἄνα (q. v.) is never addressed save to gods; ὦναξ is freq. in Trag. and Com.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄναξ ἀνδρῶν Ἀ. Il. 1.442, al. (so Euphetes 15.532, while Ortilochos is called πολέεσσʼ ἄνδρεσσιν ἄνακτα 5.546):—also as a title of rank, e.g. of Teiresias, Od. 11.144, 151, S. OT 284; of the sons or brothers of kings ( υἱεῖς τοῦ βασιλέως καὶ οἱ ἀδελφοὶ καλοῦνται ἄνακτες Arist. Fr. 526, cf. Isoc. 9.72, Clearch. 25, and so of Creon, S. OT 85, cf. 911), and esp. of kings, as Xerxes, A. Pers. 5, Darius, ib. 787, cf. Ag. 42, E. Ph. 17, Or. 349, etc.; βασιλῆι ἄνακτι lord king, Od. 20.194; of the emperors, θεοὶ ἄνακτες IG 14.2012A2, 4.1475 (Epid.).

data.quote: υἱεῖς τοῦ βασιλέως καὶ οἱ ἀδελφοὶ καλοῦνται ἄνακτες

children.label: III
children.definition: master of the house, οἴκοιο ἄναξ Od. 1.397; ἀμφὶ ἄνακτα κύνες 10.216; as denoting the relation of master to slave, freq. in Od.; ἄναξ, θεοὺς γὰρ δεσπότας καλεῖν χρεών E. Hipp. 88; of the Cyclops, as owner of flocks, Od. 9.440.

data.quote: ἄναξ, θεοὺς γὰρ δεσπότας καλεῖν χρεών

children.label: IV
children.definition: κώπης, ναῶν ἄνακτες lords of the oar, of ships, A. Pers. 378, 383; πύλης ἄ. θυρωρέ, of a porter, S. Fr. 775; ἄ. ὅπλων E. IA 1260; ψευδῶν Id. Andr. 447; ὑπήνης Pl.Com. 122; κέντρων, of planets holding cardinal points, Man. 1.66.—Poet. word.
of Anaxagoras, διάκοσμος Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 37; τὸ Ἀ. the saying of A., Plu. QConv. 2.679a; οἱ Ἀ. Pl. Cra. 409b.

tear open, ἀ. λύπην Babr. 12.24, Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.23.4, Them. Or. 7.98c; τὰ -οντα φάρμακα Phld. Ir. p.60 W.(dub.):— Pass., of evils, break out afresh, Plb. 27.7.6; εἰς κάκωσιν ἀ. Plu. Cons.ux. 2.610d, cf. Dem. 17: but ἀναξανθεῖσαι τοὺς στομάχους, of those whose appetite is stimulated afresh, Alciphr. Fr. 6.18.
laceration, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.406.
hew smooth, polish, IG 7.3073.123 (Lebad.); part. contr. ἀναξῶν ib. 2(2).463.72:— Pass., λίθου ἀνεξεσμένου J. AJ 13.6.6.

definition: ἀναξηραίνω, fut. -ᾰνῶ: aor. ἀνέξηρᾱνα, Ion. -ηνα, Ep. subj. ἀγξηράνῃ:—

children.definition: dry up, ὡς δʼ ὅτʼ ὀπωρινὸς Βορέης . . ἀλωὴν αἶψʼ ἀγξηράνῃ Il. 21.347; τὰ ὑποζύγια ἀρδόμενα ἀνεξήρηνε [τὴν λίμνην] Hdt. 7.109:— Pass., Hp. Aër. 8, Phylarch. 50, Ph. 2.511, etc.

data.quote: ὡς δʼ ὅτʼ ὀπωρινὸς Βορέης . . ἀλωὴν αἶψʼ ἀγξηράνῃ

children.definition: consume, exhaust, οἶκον ἀ. ὀδόντες Call. Cer. 114.

children.label: II
children.definition: dry again, after bathing, in Pass., Hp. Acut. 65.
drying up, Thphr. HP 3.1.2.
fit for drying, Dsc. 1.7, Crito ap. Gal. 12.488, Plu. QConv. 2.624d.
Thphr. Fr. 171.12.
drying up, Sor. 2.10, Leonid. ap. Aët. 16.44, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.90.
command, behest, Pi. N. 8.10 (pl.).
lack of value: inferiority, Pl. Prt. 356a (s.v.l.).
lord of the sea, epith. of Poseidon, B. 19.8 [Dith. 6 Irigoin].
lord of the thunder, epith. of Zeus, B. 16.66 [Dith. 3 Irigoin]; cf. ἀργιβρέντας, βρένται.
S. Fr. 1010; cf. ἀνησιδώρα.
queen of song, epith. of Urania, B. 6.10.
inconsiderable, D.S. 31.9.
unworthy treatment, or rather, just indignation thereat, J. AJ 15.2.7, Hp. Ep. 17.
to be indignant at unworthy treatment, Str. 8.4.7 (v. l.), D.H. 4.11, J. AJ 15.3.2.
unworthy of credit, Eudem. ap. Simp. in Ph. 115.35, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 317.15.

definition: ἀνάξιος (A), ον, also α, ον freq. in Att.:

children.label: I
children.definition: unworthy, not deemed or held worthy; ἀνάξιον σοῦ too good for thee, S. Ph. 1009: also c. inf., ἀ. γὰρ πᾶσίν ἐστε δυστυχεῖν undeserving in the eyes of all to suffer, S. OC 1446; νικᾶν Pl. Prt. 356a.
worthless, despicable, Hdt. 7.9, S. Ph. 439, etc.; ἁπερεί τις ἔποικος ἀναξία Id. El. 189 (lyr.). Adv. -ίως Id. Aj. 1392, etc.
undeserving of evil, Id. Ant. 694, E. Heracl. 526, Th. 3.59.

children.label: II
children.definition: undeserved, ἀνάξια σφέων αὐτῶν πεπονθότες Hdt. 1.73, cf. 114, Lys. 21.25, Pl. Cri. 53e: also abs., ἀνάξια παθεῖν E. IA 852, al., Pl. Tht. 184a. Adv. -ίως, ἐφθάρησαν ἀ. ἑωυτῶν Hdt. 7.10.εʹ
unworthy, πολλὰ καὶ ἀ. ἐμοῦ Pl. Ap. 38e.
worthless, τὸ ἀ. ἀκερδές Id. Hipparch. 231e.
kingly, royal, Sch. Il. 23.630.
bringing up, raising up, Psalm.Solom. 18.6.
ruling the lyre, ἀναξιφόρμιγγες ὕμνοι Pi. O. 2.1.

definition: ἀναξυνόω, ( ξυνός) v.l. for ἀνακοινόομαι in X. HG 1.1.30 (ap. Suid.).

children.definition: shave again, τὸν τόπον Cleopatra ap. Gal. 12.404.
trousers worn by eastern nations, Hdt. 5.49, 7.61, X. An. 1.5.8; by the Scythians, Hdt. 1.71, cf. Hp. Aër. 22; by the Sacae, Hdt. 3.87, etc.: sg., Luc. Hist.Conscr. 19, Philostr. VA 1.25.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναξυρίς, ἡ, = ὀξαλίς, Dsc. 2.114, Sch. Nic. Th. 838. (Derived from ἀνασύρεσθαι by Eust. 22.8, but really Persian. Wrongly expl. as a head-covering by Poll. 7.58.)

scrape up or off, τὰ ἐν τῇ γῇ ὄντα [σημεῖα] ἀναξῦσαι Antipho 5.45:— Pass., ἀναξυομένης τῆς γῆς being scraped up by fishermen dredging, Arist. HA 569b7, cf. 603a23; ἀναξυσθέντες having the surface scraped off, Plu. Publ. 15; to be scraped down, Orib. Fr. 99.

data.quote: τὰ ἐν τῇ γῇ ὄντα [σημεῖα] ἀναξῦσαι

children.definition: educate afresh, S. Fr. 487, Ar. Eq. 1099.
anapaestic, D.H. Comp. 25, Heph. 8, Demetr. Eloc. 189, etc.
hammered, forged, κλείς IG 2.678B64, al., 11.161 A94 ( Delos, iii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: struck back, rebounding:—as Subst., anapaest (i. e. a dactyl reversed), D.H. Comp. 25, Heph. 8, etc.; ἀ. ἀπὸ μείζους dactyl, Aristid.Quint. 1.15.

anapaestic verse, Arist. Po. 1452b23, D.H. 1.25, etc.: in pl., of the Comic parabasis, Ar. Eq. 504, Pax 735, al.; ἀνάπαιστοι σύμπτυκτοι Pherecr. 79, cf. Sch.metr. Pi. O. 4.1; ἀνάπαιστόν τι something in anapaestic metre, Aeschin. 1.158: ἀνάπαιστα, τά, anapaestic verses, Alciphr. 3.43; esp. of ribald or satirical songs, D.C. 66.8, Plu. Per. 33.
smiter, i.e. smithʼs hammer, Hsch.
not reclaimable, χρήματα Ἀρχ. Δελτ. 6.100 ( Methymna, ii B. C.).
drive back, in Pass., Eust. 587.18: metaph., ῥυθμοὶ ἔμμετροί τε καὶ ἀναπαίοντες, = ἀνάπαιστοι, Philostr. VS 2.20.3.
retrieve by contest, τὰ σφάλματα J. BJ 4.1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. τὰς ὑποσχέσεις retract, Sch. Od. 8.567.
overthrow, cancel, μέρισιν PLond. 2.394.12 (late).
dance, Ath. 14.631b.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναπάλαι χειρῶν, a form of exercise, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 2.33.
back again, ἰέναι Pl. Plt. 269d, cf. Phdr. 264a, al.; ἐπὶ τὸ πέρας ἢ ἀ. Arist. EN 1095b1; ἀ. στραφῆναι Id. Cael. 285a8, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: over again, = ἔμπαλιν, Pl. Tht. 192d.

children.label: III
children.definition: contrariwise, on the opposite side, Hp. Coac. 321; ἀ. πορεύεσθαι proceed in reverse, i.e. wrong order, Pl. Ti. 82c; ἀ. τιθέναι Arist. APr. 37b11, etc.; ἀ. ἐστιν ἡμῖν ἢ τοῖς ἄλλοις in the opposite way to . . , Thphr. HP 8.3.5; τοῖς πολλοῖς . . καὶ τοῖς ἀ. (i. e. τοῖς ὀλίγοις) Teles p. 15.9 H.

children.label: IV
children.definition: inversely; ὁ ἀ. λόγος the inverse ratio Euc. 5 Def. 13; ἀ. ἔχειν Arist. Cael. 273b32.
conversely, An.Ox. 4.325.
to be brought back again to the same spot, of a bandage, Hp. Fract. 4.
irremovable, αἰσχύνη Jul. ad Them. 265d (11).
inalienable, ἀγροί TAM 261b15 ( Lycia).

definition: ἀναπάλλω, poet. ἀμπάλλω, Ep. aor. part. ἀμπεπαλών:—

children.definition: swing to and fro, ἀμπεπαλὼν προΐει δολιχόσκιον ἔγχος Il. 3.355, etc.; ἀμπάλλειν κῶλα, i.e. dance, Ar. Ra. 1358; ἀνέπηλεν ἐπὶ θήρᾳ . . μαινάδας urged them on, E. Ba. 1190; κλήρους εἰς ἄγγος ἐμβαλοῦσαι ἀνέπηλαν Ant.Lib. 10.3:— Med., αἳ . . αἰθέρα ἀμπάλλεσθε agitate it as you fly, E. Or. 322:— Pass., dart, spring or bound up, ὡς δʼ ὅθʼ ὑπὸ φρικὸς . . ἀναπάλλεται ἰχθύς . . ὣς πληγεὶς ἀνέπαλτο Il. 23.692, cf. Eun. Hist. p.239D., Agath. 3.16, 4.18:— Il. l.c. proves that the sync. aor. ἀνέπαλτο (also found in Il. 8.85, 20.424, cf. ἀνὰ δʼ ἔπαλτʼ ὀρθῷ ποδί Pi. O. 13.72, and metaph., νεῖκος ἀνέπαλτο B. 10.65) must be referred to this Verb (cf. ἔκπαλτο, ἐνέπαλτο, κατέπαλτο); but part. ἀνεπάλμενος is formed from ἀνεφάλλομαι in A.R. 2.825; those who, like Heyne, refer it to ἀνεφάλλομαι, write it ἀνεπᾶλτο (cf. ἐπᾶλτο): — aor. Med. ἀνεπήλατο Mosch. 2.109: aor. part. Pass. ἀναπαλείς Str. 8.6.21.

data.quote: ὡς δʼ ὅθʼ ὑπὸ φρικὸς . . ἀναπάλλεται ἰχθύς . . ὣς πληγεὶς ἀνέπαλτο

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναπάλλων (sc. σεισμός), ὁ, an earthquake with an upward movement, Arist. Mu. 396a8.
κατʼ ἄμπαλον μισθοῦν by auction, IG 9(2).205.15 (Thess.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναπάλη, Ath. 14.631d.
a flinging up, Arist. Mu. 396a9.
where one meets no one, Cic. Att. 9.1.3.
restoration of virginity, Sch. A. Ch. 71.
break treaties like the Parians, prov. in Ephor. 107.
incomplete, of verbal expression, Stoic. 2.58.
AP 7.343 (Reiske ἅμα πάσης).
scatter or shed upon, χάριν τινί Pi. O. 10(11).94.
strike, κεφαλὴν ἀνεπάταξε Men. Epit. 468.
ἀνεπάταξεν· ἐξ ὕπνου ἀνέβλεψε, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: strike up, ἀναπατάξασθαι· ἀνακρούσασθαι ᾆσμα, Id.
go up, go back, AB 397; of horses, jib, shy, Hippiatr. 26.
repose, rest, ὕπνον κἀνάπαυλαν ἤγαγεν S. Ph. 638; κατʼ ἀναπαύλας διῃρημένοι divided into reliefs, of workmen, Th. 2.75.
rest from a thing, κακῶν S. El. 873, cf. Ph. 878; πόνων Th. 2.38; τῆς σπουδῆς Pl. Phlb. 30e.

children.label: II
children.definition: resting-place, E. Hipp. 1137, Pl. Lg. 722c; inn, Ar. Ra. 113; ἀνάπαυλαι κατὰ τὴν ὁδόν Pl. Lg. 625b; εἰς ἀναπαύλας ἐκ κακῶν (where there is a play upon the first sense) Ar. Ra. 185, cf. 195.

definition: ἀναπαύλησις, εως, ἡ, = foreg., κακοῦ Orac. ap. Phleg. Mir. 2:—also ἀνά-παυλις (sic), Hsch.

children.definition: repose, rest, μερμηράων Hes. Th. 55; κακῶν ἄμπαυμα μεριμνέων Thgn. 343; μόχθων Lyr.Oxy. 9iii4; πλάτας E. Hyps.Fr. 3iii14.
resting-place, APl. 16.228 (Anyte); of a tomb, CIG 4623 ( Syria), cf. Epigr.Gr. 453.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: fallow land, PTeb. 115.3 (ii B. C.), PFay. 112.4 (i A. D.).
the state of such land, ἐν ἀναπαύματι or ἀναπαύμασι PTeb. 61a385 (ii B. C.), PLond. 3.1223.8 (ii A. D.), BGU 1092.16 (iv A. D.).
of or for fallow land, Wilcken Chrest. 377.11, al., BGU 860.11 (iii A. D.).
of or for rest, Eust. 1260.53, al.
repose, rest, Mimn. 12.2, Pi. N. 7.52, Hp. VM 11, X. Lac. 12.6: esp. relaxation, recreation, Pl. Ti. 59c, X. Cyr. 7.5.47.
rest from a thing, κακῶν Th. 4.20; πολέμου X. Hier. 2.11; κακῶν Epicur. Ep. 3p.61U.; λειτουργίας PFlor. 57.56.
cadence of a period, Hermog. Id. 1.1, al.

definition: ἀναπαυστήριος or ἀνα-παυτήριος, Ion. ἀμπ-, ον,

children.definition: of or for resting, θῶκοι Hdt. 1.181.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἀναπαυτήριον, τό, time of rest, οἱ θεοὶ τὴν νύκτα διδόασιν, κάλλιστον ἀ. X. Mem. 4.3.3.

data.quote: οἱ θεοὶ τὴν νύκτα διδόασιν, κάλλιστον ἀ.

children.definition: place of rest, Luc. Am. 18.
sound of trumpet for a halt, opp. τὸ ἀνακλητικόν, Poll. 4.86.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀναπαυστηρία, ἡ, prop for head of torsion-engine, Ph. Bel. 76.17, cf. Hero Bel. 89.6.
giving rest, Ptol. Tetr. 20.

definition: ἀναπαύω, poet. and Ion. ἀμπ-, fut. Med. ἀναπαύσομαι: aor. ἀνεπαυσάμην Att. and Hellenistic (but ἀνεπαύθημεν LXX La. 5.5): later, aor. Pass. ἀναπάη IG 14.158: fut. Pass. ἀναπαήσομαι v.l. Apoc. 14.13, al.: pres. Med. ἀναπάεται IG 14.1717, cf. PTeb. 264:—

children.definition: make to cease, stop or hinder from a thing, χειμῶνος . . ὅς ῥά τε ἔργων ἀνθρώπους ἀνέπαυσεν Il. 17.550; ἀ. τινὰ τοῦ πλάνου give him rest from wandering, S. OC 1113; τοὺς λειτουργοῦντας ἀ. (sc. τῶν ἀναλωμάτων) to relieve them from . . , D. 42.25, cf. 42.

data.quote: χειμῶνος . . ὅς ῥά τε ἔργων ἀνθρώπους ἀνέπαυσεν

children.definition: put an end to, βοήν S. Tr. 1262; more freq. rest, make to halt, ἀ. στράτευμα X. Cyr. 7.1.4; κατὰ μέρος τοὺς ναύτας ἀ. Id. HG 6.2.29; κάματον ἵππων ἀ. A. Fr. 192 (lyr.); σῶμα E. Hipp. 1353; εἴδωλον ἀ. ἐπὶ ἅμαξαν lay it in a reposing posture, Ael. VH 12.64, cf. NA 7.29: abs., ἀνάπαυσον give me rest, Luc. Tyr. 21.
bring to a close, τὸν λόγον Hermog. Id. 1.8.
Med., take rest, ἀναπαύοντες ἐν τῷ μέρει Th. 4.11; ἡσυχίαν εἶχε καὶ ἀνέπαυεν X. HG 5.1.21.
cause to lie fallow, PSI 400.10 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 105.3 (ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. and Pass., take rest, ἀναπαύου κακῶν take rest from . . , Cratin. 297; ἀπὸ ναυμαχίας ἀ. rest after a sea-fight, Th. 7.73; ἐκ μακρᾶς ὁδοῦ Pl. Criti. 106a; ἀπʼ ἄγρας κεκμακὼς ἀμπαύσεται [Πάν] Theoc. 1.17; esp. of troops, halt, rest, X. Cyr. 2.4.3, etc.; ἀναπεπ. τῶν εἰσφορῶν to be relieved from . . , Isoc. 8.20.
take oneʼs rest, sleep, Hdt. 1.12, 2.95, al., E. Hipp. 211, v.l. in Ar. Pl. 695, cf. Lys. 13.12, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: lie fallow, Pi. N. 6.11.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἀμπ. σὺν φιλίῃ ξυνῶς ἀλόχῳ Epigr.Gr. 520.5 ( Thessalonica); ὧδε ἀναπάεται IG 14.1717, cf. Call. Epigr. 15.1; ἀ. τοῦ βίου Heraclit. All. 68, Hdn. 3.15.2; ἀ. alone, die, Id. 1.4.7, cf. Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.110f; ἀ. τὸν βίον POxy. 1121.12 (iii A. D.).

children.label: d
children.definition: regain strength, dub. l. in X. Cyr. 6 1.11.
rest or settle upon an object, τὸ τοῦ Θεοῦ πνεῦμα ἐφʼ ὑμᾶς ἀναπαύεται 1 Ep.Pet. 4.14, cf. LXX Is. 11.2; of shadows, Iamb. Comm. Math. 8.

data.quote: τὸ τοῦ Θεοῦ πνεῦμα ἐφʼ ὑμᾶς ἀναπαύεται

children.definition: boil or bubble up, Hsch.
persuade, convince, X. Mem. 1.2.52, al.:— Pass., Th. 1.84.

persuade, move to do a thing, c. acc. pers. et inf., Hdt. 1.124, 156, etc.; foll. by Conj., ἀ. ὡς χρή . . Id. 1.123; ἀ. λόγῳ ὅκως . . 1.37: c. dupl. acc., ἀ. τινά τι persuade one of a thing, Ar. Nu. 77, cf. AP 9.438 ( Phil.).

seduce, mislead, τινά Hdt. 3.148, 5.66, etc.; ἀ. χρήμασι, δώροις, bribe, Ar. Pax 622, X. Cyr. 1.5.3; χρυσίον διδοὺς ἀναπείσεις ὅπως . . Ar. Eq. 473, cf. PMagd. 14.3, Act.Ap. 18.13:— Pass., ἀναπεπεισμένος bribed, Ar. V. 101.
to be hungry again, Lync. ap. Ath. 3.109e.
trial, proof, πλοίων Plb. 25.4.8, cf. Callix. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: exercises, -ρας ποιῶν τοῖς πληρώμασι Plb. 1.59.12.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀνάπειρα· ῥυθμὸς αὐλητικός, Hsch.

try or attempt again: generally, make a trial, essay, τοῖς σκάφεσι Plb. 25.4.9; ἀναπειρᾶσθαι ναῦν make trial of a new ship, prove her, D. 51.5; also of the ship herself, πάντες ἑωρᾶθʼ ὑμεῖς ἀναπειρωμένην τὴν ναῦν ibid.; esp. as a naval term, manœuvre, exercise, Hdt. 6.12, Th. 7.7, 12, 51.
pierce through, fix on a spit, σπλάγχνα δʼ ἄρʼ ἀμπείραντες Il. 2.426; ἵνʼ ἀναπείρω τὰς κίχλας Ar. Ach. 1007; ὅταν ἐπὶ τὸν ὀβελίσκον ἀναπαρῇ Arist. Mir. 835a18.

children.label: II
children.definition: impale, ἐπὶ ξύλου ἀ. Hdt. 4.103:— Pass., ἀποθανεῖν ἀναπαρείς Id. 4.94; μὴ . . τὸν πόδʼ ἀναπαρῶ Macho ap. Ath. 8.349c.

children.label: III
children.definition: pierce upwards, opp. καταπείρω, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.10.1.
persuasive, χαύνωσις Ar. Nu. 875.
dress stone, IG 7.4255.19 ( Oropus).

count again, count over, Pl. Ly. 222e; think over, ponder over, Id. Lg. 724b, Plu. Exil. 2.605a, Ath. 6.263b, al.; ἀ. ὅκωσπερ ὄναρ τὴν νοῦσον Aret. CA 2.3, etc.:— Act. later in same sense, Lyc. 9, 1470, AP 11.382.12 ( Agath.), Hld. 3.5, etc.

send up, κάτωθεν A. Ch. 382 (lyr.), cf. Ar. Th. 585; Ἁφαίστοιο κρουνοὺς ἀ. sends forth . . , Pi. P. 1.26; χθὼν ἠρινὰ φύλλʼ ἀ. ib. 9.46; παντοῖα φύματα Pl. Ti. 85c:— Med., send up from oneself, X. An. 1.1.5.
send up to higher ground, εἰς τὰς ἄκρας Id. Cyr. 7.5.34; esp. from the coast inland, into Central Asia, ἀ. ὡς βασιλέα Th. 2.67, cf. Isoc. 8.98; to the metropolis, εἰς τὴν Ῥώμην Plb. 1.7.12, etc.

remit, refer to higher authority, PHib. 1.57 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 7.7 (ii B. C.); ψήφισμα πρὸς βασιλέα OGI 329.51; τινὰ πρός τινα Ev.Luc. 23.7; τινά τινι Ep.Philem. 12; of a higher authority referring to delegates, BGU 613.4 (ii A. D.), cf. 19i20, PLond. 2.196.11 (ii A. D.); refer to a book, Gal. 18(2).663, etc.
trace up oneʼs pedigree, γένος εἴς τινα D.S. 4.83.
transmit, in Pass., τῶν κατʼ ὄψιν ἀναπεμπομένων Epicur. Nat. 11.7; αἰσθήσεων ἀναπεμπομένων Plot. 4.4.42.

children.label: II
children.definition: send back, Pi. I. 7(6).10: metaph., send back in discussion to something previously said, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 445.15.
refer, τὰ εἰς τὸ θεἰον -όμενα OGI 194, cf. D.S. 4.43; ascribe, τι ἐπί τι Dam. Pr. 37; τί τινι Corp.Herm. 18.12.
throw back the accent, of enclitics, Hdn.Gr. 2.828.
pf. part. Pass. of ἀναπετάννυμι, q. v. Adv. -νως explicitly, Plot. 5.1.8.

definition: ἀναπεπτωκότως, Adv. pf. part. of ἀναπίπτω,

children.definition: despondingly, Poll. 3.123.
digest again, f.l. in Arist. HA 565b23.

definition: ἀναπετάννυμι or ἀναπεταννύω X. An. 7.1.17 (cf. ἀναπίτνημι), poet. ἀμπ-; ἀναπετάω Luc. Cal. 21: fut. -πετάσω, Att. -πετῶ Men. Fr. 3 D.:—

children.definition: spread out, unfold, ἀνά θʼ ἱστία λευκὰ πέτασσαν Il. 1.480, etc.; ἀ. βόστρυχον E. Hipp. 202; τὰν ἐπʼ ὄσσοις ὀμπέτασον χάριν unfold, display, Sapph. 29; φάος ἀμπετάσας having shed light abroad, E. IA 34; ἀναπετάσαι τὰς πύλας throw wide the gates, Hdt. 3.146, cf. X. An. l.c.:— Pass., ἀναπεπταμέναι σανίδες, θύραι, Il. 12.122, Pi. N. 9.2; βλέφαρα ἀναπετάννυται X. Mem. 1.4.6; ἀλώπηξ ἀναπιτναμένη a fox sprawling on its back to await the eagleʼs swoop, Pi. I. 4(3).47: in pf. Pass., to be open, lie open, οἰκία πρὸς μεσημβρίαν -πέπταται lies open to the south, X. Oec. 9.4; αὐλὼν ἀναπέπταται πρὸς τὴν θάλατταν Plu. Fab. 6; freq. in pf. part., open, ἐν πελάγεϊ ἀ. ναυμαχήσεις Hdt. 8.60.αʹ; ἀ. ὄμματα X. Mem. 2.1.22; ἀ. πρὸς τὸ φῶς τὴν εἴσοδον ἔχουσα, of the cave, Pl. R. 514a; δίαιτα ἀ. in the open air, Plu. Per. 34: metaph., ἀ. παρρησία open, barefaced impudence, Pl. Phdr. 240e; ὄμμα ἀ. impudent, brazen, Zeno Stoic. 1.58; ἀ. τῇ ψυχῇ δέξασθαί τι Luc. Nigr. 4.
expansion, dilatation, πόρων Gal. 6.848, cf. Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.90.
expanded, wide open, ἀδένες Hp. Gland. 9; ὀφθαλμοί Aret. SA 1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: πέτομαι), A. Supp. 782 (in form ἀμπ-).

f, late ἀναπετάομαι v.l. in Gp. 2.5.12: fut. -πτήσομαι: aor. ἀνεπτόμην or ἀνεπτάμην, in Trag. also ἀνέπτην, 3 pl. ἀνέπτησαν Ant.Lib. 14.4:— fly up, fly away, ἢν . . ἀναπτῆσθε ἐς τὸν οὐρανόν Hdt. 4.132, cf. 5.55; οἰχήσονται ἀναπτόμενοι Antipho Fr. 58; αἰθερία δʼ ἀνέπτα E. Med. 440; ἀνʼ ὑγρὸν ἀμπταίην αἰθέρα Id. Ion 796; ἀναπέτομαι δὴ πρὸς Ὄλυμπον Anacr. 24 = Ar. Av. 1372, cf. 35, Lys. 774; εἰ . . πτηνὸς γενόμενος ἀνάπτοιτο Pl. Phd. 109e; εἰς τὸν οὐρανὸν ἀναπτήσῃ Id. Lg. 905a, cf. Aeschin. 3.209; hurry off, Luc. Alex. 30: metaph., ἀμπτάμενα φροῦδα πάντα κεῖται E. Andr. 1219.
to be on the wing, περιχαρὴς δʼ ἀνεπτάμαν S. Aj. 693; ἀνέπταν φόβῳ Id. Ant. 1307.—Cf. ἀνίπταμαι.
inquiry, Charito 3.4.

definition: ἀναπεφλασμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀναφλάω, q.v.

children.definition: transfix, fix on a spit, λαγῷʼ ἀναπηγνύασι Ar. Ec. 843.
impale, crucify, τινὰ ἐπὶ τοῦ ξύλου Alex. 222; τὸ σῶμα διὰ τριῶν σταυρῶν Plu. Art. 17.
pf. ἀναπέπηγα project sharply, of headlands, Philostr. VA 3.23.

definition: ἀναπηδάω, poet. ἀμπ-, fut. -ήσομαι Luc. Asin. 53:—

children.definition: leap up, start up, esp. in haste or fear, ἐκ λόχου ἀμπήδησε Il. 11.379; ἐκ τοῦ θρόνου Hdt. 3.155; ἀναπηδῶσιν πάντες ἐπʼ ἔργον jump up from bed, Ar. Av. 490, cf. X. Cyr. 1.4.2; ἀ. πρὸς τὸν πάππον jump up on his knees, ib. 1.3.9; start up to speak, ἀ. ἐν δήμῳ Cratin. 356, cf. Ar. Ec. 428; ἐπὶ τὸ βῆμα Aeschin. 3.173, cf. 1.71.
spring, Arist. HA 596b18.
swell up, Hp. Gland. 2.
outburst, αἵματος Eust. 680.23.
leaping up, ἐκ τῆς κλίνης Hp. Morb.Sacr. 1.
ἀ. τῆς καρδίας palpitation of the heart, opp. σφύξις, Arist. Resp. 480a13.

definition: ἀναπηλέω, aor. part. -ήσας dub. sens. in h.Merc. 41.

children.definition: unwind, reel off, of the thread of a silk wormʼs cocoon, Arist. HA 551b14; τὸ τῆς πέρκης κύημα ἀ. οἱ ἁλιεῖς ib. 568a24.
lameness, mutilation, Cratin. 168, Arist. Rh. 1386a11; of the crocodileʼs tongue, stunted development, Id. PA 660b26.
with maimed life, Phryn.Com. 4D.
to be maimed, Pl. Plt. 310e, Arist. Pr. 960b37:— Act., prob. l. in Plu. Isid. 2.373d.

maimed, mutilated, Hermipp. 35, Lys. 24.13, Pl. Cri. 53a, etc.; ψυχὴ ἀ. πρὸς ἀλήθειαν Id. R. 535d; ἀνάπηρα θύειν Id. Alc. 2.149a, cf. Arist. PA 773a13, al. Adv. -ρως Zonar. (Sts. spelt ἀνάπειρος in codd., LXX To. 14.2, Ev.Luc. 14.13, 21, cf. Phryn. PS p.13 B.)
incompletely, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.107.
Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 56.7.
spring up, ooze out, Thphr. CP 6.4.1.
send forth water, Plu. Aem. 14.
press back, Hp. Art. 41.

children.label: II
children.definition: force upwards, Hero Spir. 1.10.

children.label: III
children.definition: apply, press upon, Androm. ap. Gal. 12.945, cf. Asclep. ib. 986.
pressure, Glaucias ap. Erot. s.v. ἀνοκώχησις.
trap-door on the stage, Poll. 4.127, 132.
= foreg., πρὸς τόπον Hero Spir. 1.28.
reduction of hernia, Heliod. (?) ap. Orib. 50.42.6.
fill up, πίθον Epigr. ap. Luc. Dips. 6: but mostly,

accomplish what is destined, as always in Hom., πότμον ἀναπλήσαντες having filled up the full measure of their fate, Il. 11.263; αἴ κε θάνῃς καὶ μοῖραν ἀναπλήσῃς βιότοιο 4.170; ἀναπλῆσαι οἶτον, κακά, ἄλγεα, κήδεα, ib. 8.465, 15.132, Od. 5.302, 13.307 (v.l.), cf. Hdt. 5.4, 6.12, 9.87, etc.

data.quote: αἴ κε θάνῃς καὶ μοῖραν ἀναπλήσῃς βιότοιο

children.label: II
children.definition: fill full of a thing, καὶ ξυντυχών σʼ Ὑπέρβολος δικῶν ἀναπλήσει Ar. Ach. 847, cf. Nu. 1023, Pl. Phlb. 42a, D. 20.28.

data.quote: καὶ ξυντυχών σʼ Ὑπέρβολος δικῶν ἀναπλήσει

children.definition: defiling, infecting, ὡς πλείστους ἀναπλῆσαι αἰτιῶν Pl. Ap. 32c:— so in Pass., to be infected with disease, Th. 2.51; ἀ. τῆς τούτου [τοῦ σώματος] φύσεως Pl. Phd. 67a, cf. Iamb. Myst. 5.15.
blow, swell up, in Pass., Nic. Th. 179: aor. ἀνεπρήσθην Hp. Nat.Mul. 41.
drink up, suck in like a sponge, Hp. VM 22; absorb again, of suppurations which do not come to a head, Id. Art. 40; of extravasated blood, ib. 50, cf. Gal. 7.694.
sell again, Poll. 7.12:— Pass. in aor. 1 part. ἀναπραθείσης IPE 12.32A53.
fall back, A. Ag. 1599, E. Cyc. 410; lay oneself back, like rowers, Cratin. 345, X. Oec. 8.8; ἀ. ὑπτία Pl. Phdr. 254b, cf. e; of riders, ὑπτίους ἀναπεπτωκότας ἐλαύνειν X. Eq.Mag. 3.14.
fall back, give ground, Th. 1.70; flag, lose heart, D. 19.224; ταῖς σπουδαῖς (vulg. σπονδ-) ἀναπεπτωκέναι D.H. 5.53.

children.label: b
children.definition: pf. part. ἀναπεπτωκώς lifeless, of style, σχῆμα ἀ. Aristid. Rh. 2p.518S., al.
to be given up, ἀνεπεπτώκει τὰ τῆς ἐξόδου D. 21.163.
ἀ. ἀπʼ οἴκων to be banished from oneʼs house, Poet. ap. Athenagoras pro Christo 22 [25].
recline at meals, like ἀνάκειμαι, Alex. 293, Com.Adesp. 638, PPar. 51.4, Ev.Marc. 6.40, Luc. Asin. 23.

children.label: b
children.definition: take to oneʼs bed in sickness, PMag.Leid.V. 11.1.
recoil, of the arms of torsion-engines, Hero Bel. 100.2.
cover over again with pitch, Gp. 6.8.3.
ἀναπετάννυμι, inf. -πιτνάμεν Pi. O. 6.27.
cause to spirt out, Hero Aut. 13.1.
spirting out, Hero Aut. 4.3; cf. ἀναπυτίζω.
remodelling, new formation, σαρκῶν Hp. Off. 24; adjustment, ib. 15; simply, modelling, shaping, Hp. Hebd. ap. Ph. 1.29.
shape, form, model, τὰ ἀ. τῶν σωμάτων D.S. 2.56.

children.label: II
children.definition: representation, imagination, Str. 11.14.12; ἀ. τῆς διανοίας S.E. M. 8.354.
correlative term, Ascl. in Metaph. 331.30.
building of castles in the air, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.113d.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. διανοίας Metrod. Herc. 831.4, S.E. M. 7.223, Mich. in PN 9.21.

form anew, remodel, restore a broken nose, Hp. Mochl. 2; rebuild, οἰκίδια PHal. 1.183 (iii B. C.): metaph., ἀ. ταύτας [τὰς ἑταίρας] Alex. 98.5:— Med., ἀναπλάσασθαι οἰκίην rebuild oneʼs house, Hdt. 8.109.

model, mould, fashion, τῆς Αἰδοῦς . . τἄγαλμʼ ἀ. Ar. Nu. 995, cf. AP 7.410 ( Diosc.), al.; τὰ μέλη τοῦ παιδός Pl. Alc. 1.121d: metaph., τοῖς ψηφίσμασιν ἀ. [Ἀλέξανδρον] Demad. 11; make up, τροχίσκους Dsc. 1.8, al.

ἀ. διπλάσια τῆς ἀληθείας κακά invent, imagine them, Philem. 160, cf. Plb. 3.94.2, D.H. 1.53; πολλοὺς θεούς Ph. 2.262; αἰτίας Procop. Arc. 15; ἐπιστολήν ib. 12, Philostr. VA 7.35: abs., imagine vainly, Metrod. Herc. 831.14, cf. 17, Phld. D. 1.17:—also in Med., AP 9.710 ( Diosc.).
compose, λόγους D.H. Dem. 46.

children.label: II
children.definition: plaster up, ὑπὸ τοῖς ὄνυξι κηρὸν ἀναπεπλασμένος Ar. V. 108.
one must make up into shapes, Dsc. 5.88.
imaginative, Porph. Sent. 38, Procl. in Ti. 1.320 D.
that may be moulded, plastic, Gal. 18(1).670.
to be spread wide, Plu. Daed. 4 [Fr. 157 Sandbach].
Ep. for ἀναπλέω III, Nic. Th. 308.
enwreath, entwine, ὅρμοισι χέρας Pi. O. 2.74; ἀ. τὰς τρίχας Poll. 2.35:— Pass., IG 5(1).1390.22 ( Andania, i B. C., in form ἀμπλ-), ib. 5(2).514.10 ( Lycosura):— Med., braid oneʼs hair, Luc. Nav. 3.
ἀ. ῥυθμόν AP 11.64 ( Agath.).
ἀναπεπλεγμένοι closely engaged, Plu. Brut. 17.

definition: ἀνάπλεος, α, ον, Att. masc. and neut. ἀνάπλεως, ων, but fem. ἀναπλέα Pl. Phd. 83d:—pl., nom. masc. and fem. ἀνάπλεῳ Pl. Tht. 196e, Eub. 98.8, neut. ἀνάπλεα Arist. de An. 423a27: acc. masc. ἀνάπλεως Pl. R. 516e:—

children.definition: quite full of a thing, πτερῶν λέγουσι ἀνάπλεον εἶναι τὸν ἠέρα Hdt. 4.31; ἀ. ψιμυθίου Ar. Ec. 1072, cf. Eub. l.c.; σκότους ἀ. οἱ ὀφθαλμοί Pl. R. 516e, etc.

data.quote: πτερῶν λέγουσι ἀνάπλεον εἶναι τὸν ἠέρα

children.label: II
children.definition: infected, τοῦ σώματος ἀναπλέα [ἡ ψυχή] with the body, Id. Phd. 83d; αὐτὸ τὸ καλὸν μὴ ἀ. σαρκῶν Id. Smp. 211e; ἀ. ἐσμεν τοῦ μὴ καθαρῶς διαλέγεσθαι Id. Tht. 196e.

data.quote: αὐτὸ τὸ καλὸν μὴ ἀ. σαρκῶν
ἀ. ἐσμεν τοῦ μὴ καθαρῶς διαλέγεσθαι

children.definition: separation, splitting off, ὀστέου Hp. Coac. 234.

children.label: II
children.definition: mounting, rising, of food in vomiting, Archig. ap. Orib. 8.1.20.
sail upwards, go up-stream, στεινωπὸν ἀνεπλέομεν we sailed up the strait, Od. 12.234, cf. Hdt. 2.97, 4.89; sail up the Hellespont, X. HG 4.8.36:— Pass., ἀναπλεῖται ἐκ θαλάττης ὁ Πάδος Plb. 2.16.10.
put out to sea, ἐς Τροίην νήεσσιν ἀναπλεύσεσθαι Il. 11.22, cf. And. 1.76, Decr. ap. D. 18.184; ἀ. ἐπὶ τρόπαιον IG 2.471.28.
float up, rise to the surface, ναυάγιον ἀ. Arist. Pr. 932a1.
overflow, Ael. NA 10.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: sail back, Hdt. 1.78; of fish, swim back, Id. 2.93.
return from the stomach, for rumination, Ael. NA 2.54.

children.label: III
children.definition: become loose, split off, of bone-splinters, Hp. Fract. 24; ὀδόντες ἀναπλέουσι the teeth fall out, Id. Epid. 4.19, cf. ἀναπλείω; of chalk-stones, come away, Orib. Syn. 9.58.2.
to be full, Id. 13.22.
overflow, Philostr. Im. 1.31.
make overflow, ἀνεπλήμμῡρε θάλασσαν Q.S. 14.635.
fill up a void, Pl. Ti. 81b, cf. 78d; τὸ κεχηνὸς τῆς ἑρμηνείας, τοῦ ῥυθμοῦ, A.D. Synt. 266.22, Luc. Tim. 1:— Pass., to be filled up, Arist. Cael. 306b4.

make up, supply, εἴ τι ἐξέλιπον ἀ. Pl. Smp. 188e; τὴν ἔνδειαν Arist. Pol. 1318b22; τοὺς . . ἀμόρφους ἀνατληροῖ ἡ τοῦ λέγειν πιθανότης compensates them, Id. Fr. 101:— Med., δώματʼ ἀ. fill their houses, E. Hel. 907.
fill up the numbers of a body, τὴν βουλήν Plu. Publ. 11, cf. X. Vect. 4.24; ἀ. τὴν συνηγορίαν fill the place of advocate (left vacant by another), Plu. Crass. 3, cf. 1 Ep.Cor. 14.16.
pay in full, τὰς ὠνάς, of tax-farmers, PPar. 62.5.3 (ii B. C.):—in Med., get paid, receive, ἕως ἀνεπληρώσατο τὴν προῖκα D. 27.13.
use expletive particles, Demetr. Eloc. 58.
fulfil, ἀναπληροῦται ἡ προφητεία Ev.Matt. 13.14; of a task, perform, PPetr. 3p.104.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be restored to its former size or state, ἀνεπληρώθη ὁ ἥλιος, after an eclipse, Th. 2.28; ἀναπληρουμένης τῆς φύσεως being in process of restoration, Arist. EN 1153a2, cf. HA 548b18.
filling, Arist. Mir. 833b4; ἐρημίας Phalar. Ep. 98; λόγων Ph. 2.166.
filling up, means of filling up, τῆς ἐνδείας Arist. EN 1118b18; τοῦ λείποντος A.D. Synt. 250.18; τῶν κενουμένων τάξεων Ph. 2.382.
satisfying, τῆς ἐπιθυμίας Arist. Pol. 1267b4; satisfaction of the wants and appetites, Id. EN 1173b8.
restoration, τῆς κατὰ τὴν φύσιν αὐταρκείας Id. Pol. 1257a30, cf. Plu. Demetr. 45.
fulfilment, τοῦ ῥήματος τοῦ Κυρίου LXX 1 Es. 1.54.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass.) becoming full, overflowing, of the Nile, Thales ap. Ath. Epit. ad fin. lib. ii (vol. i p.278 Schw.).
one must fill up, supply, Plu. Cim. 2, Gp. 9.11.3.
filling up, Asp. in EN 24.3; δύναμις Dsc. 5.75; φάρμακα Gal. 14.763.
fit for filling up, and so, that which takes the shape of the vessel which it fills, fluid, Arist. PA 649b16, cf. GC 329b34, Pr. 939a31.
trot, prob. in Arat. 1108.
a braiding, χαίτης Philostr. VA 6.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: progression of notes ascending in the scale, opp. καταπλοκή, Ptol. Harm. 2.12.
sailing up-stream, Hdt. 2.4 and 8; ὁ ἀ. ἐκ τῆς θαλάττης, of a canal from the sea to an inland harbour, Pl. Criti. 115d, cf. 117e.
putting out to sea, Plb. 1.53.13, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: sailing back, return, Thphr. HP 4.7.3, cf. Str. 1.3.15.
unfold, open, ταρσὸν ἀναπλώσας Mosch. 2.60; τὰς θύρας Babr. 74.3:— Pass., of pods or flowers, Dsc. 2.159, 4.113.
cause to expand, τῷ -οῦν τὰ σώματα τὴν θερμότητα Anon. in Cat. 49.26.

children.label: II
children.definition: explain, unravel, Anon. in Tht. 23.6, Corp.Herm. 1.16, Procl. in Euc. p.4F.; ἀπορίαν Simp. in Ph. 441.11.

children.label: III
children.definition: simplify, μέχρι τοῦ ἑνός Dam. Pr. 5:—so in Pass., of compounds, to be resolved into simple elements, Ph. 1.433 (s. v. l.): pf. part. Pass. ἀνηπλωμένος open, shallow, λοπάδας PHolm. 11.17. Adv. -ως, q. v.
washing or rinsing out, Arist. Insomn. 460a17.
unfolding; explanation, Erot. Praef. p.9 N., Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 467.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: unfolding, evolution, ἡ τῶν λόγων ἐξέλιξις καὶ ἀ. Plot. 5.7.3; opp. συνείλησις, Iamb. Comm. Math. 12.

data.quote: ἡ τῶν λόγων ἐξέλιξις καὶ ἀ.

children.label: III
children.definition: simplification, Dam. Pr. 26, 70.
resting-place, Pi. N. 1.1.
recovery of breath: respite from, ὀλίγη δέ τʼ ἀνάπνευσις πολέμοιο Il. 11.801, 16.43.

children.label: II
children.definition: breathing in, ὕδατος, of fishes, Pl. Ti. 92b; inhalation, opp. ἔκπνευσις, Arist. HA 492b8.

of or for respiration, ὁ ἀ. τόπος the respiratory region, Arist. Sens. 445a27, Thphr. Sud. 38; τὰ μὴ ἀ. [ζῷα] Arist. Spir. 482a8; ἀ. δύναμις the power of breathing, M.Ant. 6.15; τὰ -κά respiratory organs, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.119.
without drawing breath, breathless, Hes. Th. 797 codd.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναπνευστός, όν, Pass., capable of being breathed, ὁ ἀήρ Arist. Top. 135a33.

definition: ἀναπνέω, Ep. impf. ἀμπνείεσκον A.R. 3.231: Ep. aor. imper. ἄμπνυε (v. infr.):—

children.definition: take breath, στῆθι καὶ ἄμπνυε Il. 22.222: more commonly c. gen., enjoy a respite, recover from, ἀνέπνευσαν κακότητος 11.382; ὥς κε . . ἀναπνεύσωσι πόνοιο 15.235; τῆς νόσου S. Aj. 274; ἀ. ἐκ τῆς ναυηγίης Hdt. 8.12; ἐκ καμάτων IG 14.14 (Syrac.); ἀνέπνευσα ἐκ σέθεν by the help I recovered, S. OT 1221: c. part., ἀ. τειρόμενοι Il. 16.42; ἐς τεῖχος ἀλέντες 21.534: abs., revive, X. An. 4.1.22, D. 18.195.
πυρεῖα ἀ. revive, burn up again, Thphr. HP 5.9.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: draw breath, ἀ. πάντα καὶ ἐκπνεῖ Emp. 100, cf. Pl. Phd. 112b, etc.; ἀ. πυκνά Hp. Mul. 2.203; gather breath before a race, Pi. N. 8.19: metaph., ἀ. οὐχ ἅπαντες ἐπὶ ἴσα ib. 7.5.
draw breath from, inhale, τὴν οἰκείαν ἀρχήν Dam. Pr. 8:— Pass., τὸν ἀναπνεόμενον ἀέρα Corn. ND 32.

children.label: III
children.definition: breathe forth, send forth, c. acc. cogn., ἀμπνεῦσαι καπνόν Pi. O. 8.36; πυρὸς σέλας ἀμπνείεσκον A.R. 3.231; ἀ. ὑάκινθον breathe hyacinth, Pherecr. 131.2: abs., exhale an odour, Thphr. Od. 69: impers., ἡδὺ ἀναπνεῖ τῶν φυτῶν Philostr. Her.Prooem. 2: metaph., ἀ. χρησμούς Id. VS 1.18.3.
ἀϋτμὴ ἀ. μυχοῖο A.R. 2.737

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἀ. τὸν ἵππον breathe the horse, Hld. 8.14.
one who restores breath to an athlete after a contest, BMus.Inscr. 1109 (ii A. D.) (dub. sens.).

recovery of breath, μόχθων ἀμπνοά rest from toils, Pi. O. 8.7, cf. E. IT 92, etc.; ἀμπνοὰν ἔστᾱσαν they recovered breath, took fresh courage, Pi. P. 4.199; ἀ. διδόναι, παρέχειν, E. Andr. 1137, Pl. Ti. 70d; λαμβάνειν Id. Phdr. 251e; ἀναπνοὴν ἔχει . . εἰπεῖν has breath enough to say, Men. 536.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: respiration, breathing, Pi. P. 3.57, Ar. Nu. 627, Pl. Ti. 33c, etc.; including εἰσπνοή and ἐκπνοή, Arist. Resp. 471a7; ἀμπνοὰς ἔχειν, = ἀναπνεῖν, breathe, live, S. Aj. 416; τὴν ἀ. ἀπολαβεῖν τινος strangle, Plu. Rom. 27; ὑπὸ τὴν ἀ. in a breath, Plb. 10.47.9.
inspiration, opp. ἐκπνοή, Pl. Ti. 78e, 79e, cf. Arist. Resp. 480b10.

children.label: III
children.definition: exhalation, Thphr. HP 6.2.4.

children.label: IV
children.definition: breathing organ, of the nose and mouth, D.S. 2.12, Luc. Nigr. 32.
air-hole, vent, Pl. Ti. 85a, 91b, Plu. Aem. 14.— Only sg. in Pi.; only pl. in Trag.

definition: ἀνάπνοια, ἡ, = foreg. ΙΙ.1, Ti. Locr. 101d, Arist. Pr. 962a26.

children.definition: affecting respiration, νόσος Ptol. Tetr. 87.
not capable of being lost, ἀγαθά S.E. P. 3.238, cf. Cleanth.Stoic. 1.129, Alex.Aphr. Quaest. 121.16.

not registered in the custom-house books, contraband, Poll. 9.31; ἀ. μέταλλα unregistered mines, Hyp. Eux. 34; not registered in the census, PLond. 2.260.29 (i A. D.); πρόβατα ἀ. BGU 338ii6 (ii A. D.).
not proved, undemonstrated, Lycurg. 129, Arist. EN 1143b12. Adv. -τως without proof, Plu. CG 10.

children.label: II
children.definition: indemonstrable, Pl. Def. 415b, Arist. APr. 53b2, 57b33, al.; ἀ. συλλογισμοί, of syllogisms, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.79, al. Adv. -τως S.E. P. 1.173, Gal. 17(2).160.
incapable of proof, Plu. Cor. 20.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., furnishing no proof, PPar. 15.3.62, cf. Stoic. 2.90.
not to be received, Sch. E. Ph. 527.
take responsibility for, θυσίαν Inscr.Magn. 61.56 (dub.).
untravelled, Ph. 2.11.
make to step back, call back and question, cross-examine, ἐπειρωτῶν τε καὶ ἀ. τὸν κήρυκα Hdt. 5.92.ζʹ; πολλάκις ἀνεπόδιζον τὸν γραμματέα Aeschin. 3.192, cf. Luc. Abd. 17:— Pass., Antipho Soph. 18.

data.quote: ἐπειρωτῶν τε καὶ ἀ. τὸν κήρυκα

children.definition: οὐδαμῇ ἄλλῃ ἀνεπόδισε ἑωυτόν in no other passage did he correct himself, retract what he before said, Hdt. 2.116.
deduct for retrograde motion, Vett.Val. 25.26.

children.label: II
children.definition: step back, return, ἐπὶ τὴν μονάδα Pythag. ap. Stob. 1.10.12 (corr. Heeren), LXX Si. 46.4, Luc. Nec. 7; εἰς τοὐπίσω Hdn. 5.6.7; ἀ. πρὸς . . revert, Chor. in Rh.Mus. 49.492; κύκλον ἀ. recur in a cycle, Hippod. ap. Stob. 4.34.71; of the retrograde motion of the planets, Theo Sm. p.147 H., Procl. Hyp. 5.72, etc.: metaph. of festivals which fall late in the calendar, Gem. 8.19.

going back, εἰς μονάδα, opp. προποδισμὸς ἀπὸ μονάδος, Moderat. ap. Stob. 1 Coroll. 8; of the retrograde motion of planets, Vett.Val. 226.1, Nicom. Ar. 1.5; in pl., opp. προποδισμοί, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 440.7; generally, reversal of planetʼs motion, Theo Sm. p.148H.

children.label: II
children.definition: calling back, recall, LXX Wi. 2.5.
one who drives back, Eust. 717.16.
in retardation, Vett.Val. 182.31; -κοὶ ἀστέρες Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.133.23.

not given back, not returned, ἀ. δόσις ἡ δωρεά Arist. Top. 125a18; ἀργύριον ἀ. δόντα not to be repaid, CIG (add.) 4278k ( Xanthus), cf. 4300 o ( Limyra), PTeb. 105.20 (ii B. C.), PRyl. 171.16 (i A. D.); σῖτον Inscr.Prien. 108.58.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸ ἀ., = ἀνανταπόδοτον, Sch. Ar. Av. 7, cf. Simp. in Ph. 45.11.
ἀ. ἐπὶ τὴν μονάδα Plu. 2.876f

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναποδόομαι grow fresh feet, of scorpions, Lyd. Mag. 1.42.
unavoidable, not to be escaped, Arist. Mu. 401b13, Plu. Superst. 2.166e, Alex.Aphr. Fat. 166.3; τὸ ἀ. Plot. 4.3.13.
Act., unable to run away, AB 392, Alb. Intr. 6.
not stored up, Hsch.
make up, prepare a medicine, Hp. Nat.Mul. 36; mix up, stir up, PHolm. 25.22, al.; μετʼ ἐλαίου Bilabel Ὀψαρτ. p.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: make fresh, vamp up, τὰ ἱμάτια Sch. Ar. Pl. 1063.
made up, wrought up, ἔκ τινος Ammon. Diff. 123.
variegate, Sch. Pi. O. 11(10).113 Böckh.
without ransom, only once in neut. (as Adv., acc. to Aristarch.) ἀνάποινον Il. 1.99.
wash out again, θαλάσσῃ PHolm. 20.6.
unanswered, ἀ. ἀποστέλλειν πρέσβεις Plb. 4.34.1, cf. Zeno Stoic. 1.64; ἀ. ἀπελθεῖν Plb. 22.10.13. Adv. ἀναποκρίτως, εἰπών Antipho 3.3.2.
Act., not answering, οἰμωγή Plb. 8.23.6.
roll about, of an engine on shipboard, Ath.Mech. 32.7.
non-enjoyment, Phld. D. 1.16.
not to be enjoyed, Plu. Vit. aer. al. 2.829d, Suav. 1104f.
Act., not enjoying, Phld. Mort. 13; ἡδονῶν Heph.Astr. 1.1, Hsch.
renew the war, Str. 17.3.15, Mon.Anc.Gr. 15.8.
move upwards in an orbit, opp. καταπολεύω, PMag.Par. 1.702.

turn up the ground again ( τρὶς ἀροτριᾶν τὴν γῆν, Hsch. s.v. ὡραπολεῖν): hence, go over again, repeat, ταὐτὰ τρὶς τετράκι τʼ ἀμπολεῖν Pi. N. 7.104; δὶς ταὐτὰ βούλει καὶ τρὶς ἀναπολεῖν μʼ ἔπη; S. Ph. 1238; ὅταν [ψυχὴ] αὖθις ταύτην ἀναπολήσῃ [μνήμην] Pl. Phlb. 34b, cf. Vett.Val. 242.20:— aor. 1 Pass., J. AJ 13.5.8.

data.quote: δὶς ταὐτὰ βούλει καὶ τρὶς ἀναπολεῖν μʼ ἔπη;

children.definition: repetition, A.D. Synt. 29.10, al., Plot. 2.9.12; reconsideration, recalling to mind, Id. 4.6.3, Hierocl. in CA 19p.461M.
one must recall to mind, M.Ant. 4.32.
inexcusable, Plb. 12.21.10, Ep.Rom. 1.20, 2.1; undefended, τινὰ ἐάσειν D.Chr. 2.39, cf. Eun. VS p.489 B.; without making a defence, D.H. 7.46.
not able to get loose, sessile, Arist. HA 599a15. Adv. -τως Gal. 12.8.

definition: ἀναπόμικτος, ον, f.l. for ἀνεπίμικτος, Thphr. CP 6.8.4.

children.definition: sending up, e.g. to the metropolis, Plb. 30.9.10.
ἀ. θησαυρῶν digging up of treasures, Luc. Alex. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: restoration, ἐπὶ τοὺς πεπρακότας Ph. 2.290.
reference, reduction, ἐπὶ γένος S.E. M. 10.274; reference to a book, Jul.Laod. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).246.
delegation of jurisdiction, PTeb. 489 (ii A. D.), BGU 19i1 (ii A. D.).
sent back, Luc. Luct. 10, D.C. 62.2; of slaves, τοῖς κυρίοις -ους ποιεῖν D.S. 14.96.
referred to a higher court, Luc. Eun. 12, D.C. 52.33, etc.
one that sends up or back, epith. of Hades, as sending up the shade of Darius, A. Pers. 650.

children.label: II
children.definition: distributor of bread to soldiers, POxy. 1115.2 (iii A. D.).
unwashen, Ar. Eq. 357, Phryn.Com. 3 D.

children.label: II
children.definition: = not to be washed out, Suid.
proceed up-stream, D.C. 75.9.
not liable to be rejected, free from blemish, PLond. 2.282.13 (i A. D.), etc.
inextinguishable, Hecat.Abd. 14.
swallowing up, of rivers, Olymp. in Mete. 218.12, al.
inseparable, τοῦ ἑνός Dam. Pr. 113. Adv. -τως Simp. in Epict. p.6 D.
unable to escape from, θανάτου Epigr.Gr. 526 ( Beroe): abs., without means of escape, POxy. 1469.5 (iii A. D.).
δεσπότης ἀ. from whom there is no escape, Plu. Superst. 2.166e (codd.).
inseparable, Porph. Sent. 40.
without permit, ἐξὸν ἐκπλεῖν ἀ. PGnom. 165 (ii A. D.).
not to be turned away, Sm. Jb. 9.13.
unfinished, Eust. 922.19.
unerring in its aim, ὄρεξις Arr. Epict. 2.8.29; of persons, 1.4.11, al. Adv., Comp. -ότερον 4.6.26.
absorbent, Ptol. Tetr. 18.
watering, dub. in PLond. 3.1177.187 (ii A. D.).
not to be cut off or severed, Arr. Epict. 1.1.24.
Il. Oxy. 1086.74 (fort. -τρεπτος).
not scarred over, Gal. 19.446.
bring back again, in aor. 1 Med. ἀναπηνεγκάμην PCair.Preis. 32.12 (ii A. D.).
exaction of a debt or penalty, δανείων D.H. 6.1; τοῦ ἀργυρίου IG 9(1).694.10 ( Corcyra).
retail dealing, Poll. 7.12.

exact, levy money or debts, Th. 8.107, Lys. 16.6; ἀ. τό τε κεφάλαιον καὶ τὸν τόκον IG 9(1). 694.58 ( Corcyra); demand back, of loans already repaid, OGI 669.20 (so in Med., of interest already paid, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.295d); ἀ. ὑπόσχεσιν exact the fulfilment of a promise, Th. 2.95, cf. Ar. Av. 1621; distrain upon, τὰ ἐμφανέα SIG 554.16 ( Thermon):— Med., exact for oneself, δίκας D.H. 6.19.

data.quote: ἀ. τό τε κεφάλαιον καὶ τὸν τόκον

children.definition: send up ambassadors, J. AJ 18.2.4.
let burst forth, δάκρυʼ ἀναπρήσας Il. 9.433, Od. 2.81.
sawing off, Hp. Ep. 22.
Suid.
one must attach, τὸν λόγον ἀπὸ τῶν φανερωτέρων Str. 1.3.10.
represent as winged, τὸν Ἔρωτα Men.Rh. p.337 S.
fly upwards, Ph. Fr. 59 H.
raise its feathers, of a bird: hence metaph., raise, set up, ὀρθίους ἐθείρας ἀνεπτέρωκα E. Hel. 633.

set on the wing, put on the tiptoe of expectation, excite, ἀναπτερώσας αὐτὴν οἴχεαι Hdt. 2.115, cf. Pl. Phdr. 255c; μῶν τι . . ἄγγελμʼ ἀνεπτέρωκε Δαναϊδῶν πόλιν; E. Or. 876; φόβος μʼ ἀναπτεροῖ Id. Supp. 89, cf. S. Fr. 355; ἀ. τινὰ χρηστοῖς λόγοις Ar. Av. 1449, cf. Men. Epit. 510: — Pass., to be in a state of eager expectation, ἀνεπτερώθης A. Ch. 228; ἀ. τὴν ψυχήν Cratin. 384; ἀνεπτέρωμαι κλύων Ar. Av. 434; ἀνεπτερωμένων τῶν Λακεδαιμονίων X. HG 3.4.2; ἀνεπτερωμένος θεᾶσθαι Id. Smp. 9.5; ἀναπτερωθεὶς ὑπό τινων ὡς . . being irritated by the remark of some, that . . , Id. HG 3.1.14.

data.quote: μῶν τι . . ἄγγελμʼ ἀνεπτέρωκε Δαναϊδῶν πόλιν;

children.label: II
children.definition: furnish with new wings, Ar. Lys. 669:— Pass., get new wings, Pl. Phdr. 249d.
clamour, λόγοι ἀναπτερώσεως clamorous words, LXX Si. 31.1, cf. Pr. 7.11.
excitable, fickle, χρῆμα ἡ νίκη Men.Prot. p.10 D.
raise the wings and fly away, Ael. NA 4.30: metaph., Phld. Vit. p.21J.
to be furnished with wings, Sch. Ar. Eq. 1341.
Phot. p.119 R.
upward flight, Hierocl. in CA 26p.478M.
scare exceedingly, Mosch. 2.23, Opp. C. 1.107, etc.:— Pass., to be scared, Plu. Pel. 16; to be in great excitement, Id. Mul.virt. 2.261a, etc.
not to be touched, impalpable, Arist. de An. 424a12.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναπτός, όν, ( ἀνάπτω) fastened on, φᾶρος Eust. 1774.15.
that may be opened, Arist. PA 683b15.
opening, gaping, τοῦ στόματος Arist. PA 602a29.
explanation, Id. Rh.Al. 1435b18, cf. Plu. Isid. 2.382d, Ath. 1.1a.
expectoration, Gal. 15.480, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.93; αἵματος Alex.Trall. 5.5; of fistulae, opening out, Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.23.6.

definition: ἀναπτύσσω, pf. inf. Pass. ἀνεπτύχθαι E. El. 357: aor. Pass. ἀνεπτύχθην Hp. Judic. 3, but -επτύγην Int. 48:—

children.definition: unfold the rolls on which books were written, open for reading, ἀ. τὸ βιβλίον Hdt. 1.125, cf. 48; δέλτων ἀναπτύσσοιμι γῆρυν E. Fr. 370: also ἀ. πύλας, κύτος, undo, open, E. IT 1286, Ion 39; χλαμύδα Plu. Demetr. 42; even χεῖλος Opp. H. 3.247; ἀναπτύξας χέρας with arms outspread, E. Hipp. 1190; σεισμοὶ -ξαντες τὴν ἁρμονίαν τῶν ὀρῶν Philostr. Im. 2.17:— Med., fold up, Arist. PA 664b27, al.

children.label: b
children.definition: cut open, of freshly killed animals, Pherecyd. 97 J., Philum. Ven. 17.3, PMag.Leid.V. 10.1, etc.

children.label: c
children.definition: ruminate, chew, Opp. H. 1.137.
unfold, disclose, πᾶν ἀ. πάθος A. Pers. 254, 294; πάντʼ ἀναπτύσσει χρόνος S. Fr. 301; ἀ. πρὸς φῶς Id. El. 639, cf. E. HF 1256; φρένα πρός τινα Id. Tr. 662: in later Prose, Porph. Antr. 4.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὴν φάλαγγα ἀ. fold back the phalanx, i.e. deepen it by countermarching from front to rear, X. Cyr. 7.5.3; conversely, τὸ κέρας ἀ. open out the wing, i.e. extend the line by countermarching from rear to front, X. An. 1.10.9, cf. Plu. Pel. 23, Arr. Tact. 9.5.
wide expanse of heaven! E. Ion 1445; νυκτός τε πηγὰς οὐρανοῦ τʼ ἀναπτυχάς S. Fr. 956; ἡλίου ἀναπτυχαί the sunʼs unclouded orb, E. Hipp. 601; ἀ. ἐλεύθεροι (sc. ὀμμάτων) El. 868.

data.quote: νυκτός τε πηγὰς οὐρανοῦ τʼ ἀναπτυχάς

children.definition: Arist. HA 528a14.
spit up or out, αἷμα Hp. Aph. 5.13; σίαλον Plb. 12.13.11: abs., sputter, ξηρὰ δʼ ἀναπτύει [ῡ] Nic. Al. 211; μυδῶσα κηκὶς . . ἔτυφε κἀνέπτῡε S. Ant. 1009:— Pass., Gal. 16.210.

make fast on or to, Hom. (only Od.), ἐκ δʼ αὐτοῦ [ἱστοῦ] πείρατʼ ἀνῆπτον Od. 12.179, cf. 51, 162; πρυμνήσιʼ ἀνάψαι 9.137: c. dat., γαίῃ A.R. 2.177; ἀ. τι πρός τι E. HF 1012:— Med., ἐκ τοῦδʼ ἀναψόμεσθα πρυμνήτην κάλων to him will we moor our bark, i.e. he shall be our protector, Id. Med. 770, etc.; θεοῖσι κῆδος ἀνάψασθαι form a close connexion with . . , Id. Tr. 845; χάριτας ἔς τινα ἀ. confer favours on . . , Id. Ph. 569; also, fasten to oneself, ἐπιστολὴν ἐκ τῶν δακτύλων ἀ. Din. 1.36; take in tow, ναῦν D.S. 13.19, Plu. Cam. 8; τὸ κράτος Ph. 1.474:— Pass., to be fastened or fasten oneself on to, cling to, c. gen., πέπλων E. HF 629: c. dat., κίοσιν ib. 1038 (prob., lyr.); have a thing fastened on one, περιβόλαιʼ ἀνήμμεθα ib. 549.
hang up in a temple, offer up, like ἀνατίθημι, πολλὰ δʼ ἀγάλματʼ ἀνῆψεν Od. 3.274, cf. Arist. Fr. 572, Lyc. 853, Philostr. VA 1.11, Tryph. 256.

fasten upon, attach to, μῶμον ἀνάψαι Od. 2.86; αἷμα ἀ. τινί a charge of bloodshed, dub. in E. Andr. 1196, cf. Ps.-Phoc. 70, etc.; κήδεʼ ἀνῆπταί τινι A.R. 2.245; ascribe, refer to, τοὺς λόγους εἰς ἀριθμοὺς ἀ. Arist. Metaph. 1078b22; ἀρχήν, αἰτίαν ἀ. εἰς τὸν Πύθιον Plu. Lyc. 6, etc.; χάριν ἀ. τινί ascribe a favour to him, Id. Ant. 46; τὴν χάριν εἰς Καίσαρα πάντων ἀνῆπτεν Id. Brut. 6; τοῖς ἐκ τοῦ θεοῦ τὴν εὐδαιμονίαν ἀνάψασι Porph. Abst. 2.3:— Med., attach oneself, πρὸς πολλούς Phld. Herc. 1457.8.

data.quote: ἀρχήν, αἰτίαν ἀ. εἰς τὸν Πύθιον
τὴν χάριν εἰς Καίσαρα πάντων ἀνῆπτεν
τοῖς ἐκ τοῦ θεοῦ τὴν εὐδαιμονίαν ἀνάψασι

children.label: II
children.definition: light up, kindle, λύχνα Hdt. 2.133; πῦρ E. Or. 1137; φῶς Pl. Ti. 39b; πυρὶ ἀ. δόμους E. Or. 1594: metaph., νέφος οἰμωγῆς ὡς τάχʼ ἀνάψει Id. Med. 107:— Pass., to be kindled, Zeno Stoic. 1.31, etc.
inflame with anger, Lib. Or. 68.35:— Pass., ib. 33.15, Ps.-Callisth. 3.22; excite emotionally, Phld. Po. 1425.20.
to be lighted up, Arist. Mir. 841a32.
falling back: metaph., slackness, Eust. 1406.8; of machines, recoil, Ph. Bel. 68.45, Hero Bel. 82.13; of style, lifelessness, Eust.ad D.P. 69.
reclining at meals, Aristeas 187, 203; generally, lying down, in pl., Onos. 10.11.
flat, of style, v.l. in Eust. ad D.P. 69.
inquire closely into, τὰς πάτρας αὐτῶν ἀνεπύθετο Hdt. 6.128; ἀνεπυνθάνετο τὸν ποιήσαντα Id. 8.90; ἀναπυθώμεθα τούσδε τίνες ποτὲ καὶ πόθεν ἔμολον Ar. Av. 403.

data.quote: ἀναπυθώμεθα τούσδε τίνες ποτὲ καὶ πόθεν ἔμολον

children.definition: ἀναπυνθανόμενος εὑρίσκω discover by inquiry, Hdt. 5.57; also, learn by inquiry, ἀ. ταῦτα πραττόμενα X. An. 5.7.1 codd.; ἀ. περί τινος Pl. Hp.Mi. 363b; ἀ. τί τινος ask of a person, Ar. Pax 693.
suffer from recurrence of fever, Gal. 16.649.
kindle, of fire, Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 31.
set on fire, Arist. Mu. 395a22 ( Pass.): intr., metaph., break out afresh, πάθη . . πάλιν ἀναπυρώσαντα Gal. 16.742.
make glaring, τὴν βαφὴν τὴν πορφύρας Poll. 1.49.
well-known, notorious, Od. 11.274, Hdt. 6.64, 66, etc.
spit up, spout up, Hero Spir. 1.28. (but see ἀναπιτύζω)

definition: ἀναπυτισμός, ὁ, Hero Aut. 4.3 (but see ἀναπιτυσμός).

children.definition: put up for sale again, PPetr. 3p.109 ( Pass.); sell again, Poll. 7.12:— Pass., prob. in CIG 2266.11 ( Delos).
lift up the cover, Hero Spir. 1 Praef., Crito ap. Gal. 12.732.
a drinking up, Erot. s.v. ἄμπωτις ( οἷον ἀ. τις οὖσα) s. v. l. Cf. ἀνάποσις.
Adj. ἀναπωτικός, ή, όν, Eust. 1719.44.

definition: ἄναρ ὄναρ (Cret.), Phot. p.119 R., Hsch.
ἀναρ-: when ἀνά is compd. with words beginning with ρ, the ρ is usually doubled, as in ἀναρραΐζω, etc., though in Poets and Ion. Greek it is sometimes single, as in sq.

children.definition: recall a curse, Callisth. ap. Suid., Poll. 5.130.

definition: ἀνάρβηλα τὰ μὴ ἐξεσμένα, ἄρβηλοι γὰρ τὰ δέρματα, Hsch.

children.definition: without shoes, unshod, E. Fr. 530.7.
want of cash, Stratt. 8 D.; ἡ τῆς ἀ. παραγραφή non numeratae pecuniae, Cod.Just. 4.21.16; ἡ τῆς προικὸς ἀ. Just. Nov. 100 Pr.: pl., ibid.
without silver: without money, Lys. Fr. 35, Pl. Lg. 679b.

children.label: II
children.definition: not bought with silver: incorruptible, Poll. 6.191.
want of vigour, Arist. Pr. 894b21.
not differentiated or articulated, Pl. Ti. 75a, Arist. HA 583b10, al.
without strength, nerveless, S. Tr. 1103, E. Or. 228.
without visible joints, like fat men, Hp. Aër. 19.

children.label: II
children.definition: inarticulate, ψόφοι Thphr. Sens. 41; ᾠδαί D.S. 3.17; ἀλαλαγμός Plu. Mar. 19, cf. Caes. 63; φθογγή Id. QConv. 2.613e, etc.; φθέγματα Epigr.Gr. 1003 ( Memnon). Adv. -ρως confusedly, Plu. Cons.ux. 2.611b.

children.label: III
children.definition: avoiding the use of the article, ἁρμονία D.H. Comp. 22.
reckon up, enumerate, D. 19.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: reconsider, Pl. Ax. 372a:— Act., D.C. 36.25.
numbering, Gal. 17(1).314, Simp. in Ph. 714.28.
not to be counted, countless, Pi. O. 7.25, Hdt. 1.126, 7.190, 211, al.; of time, immeasurable, S. Aj. 646.
unregarded, E. Ion 837, Hel. 1679.
ἀναρίθμιον· ἐχθρόν (opp. ἐναρίθμια· φίλα, συνήθη), Hsch.

without number, countless, Sapph. 44.10 L.-P., Pi. I. 5(4).50; κυμάτων ἀ. γέλασμα A. Pr. 90; πλῆθος ἀνάριθμοι Id. Pers. 40: c. gen., ἀ. ὧδε θρήνων without count or measure in lamentations, S. El. 232; μηνῶν ἀ. ( Herm. for μήλων) without count of months, Id. Aj. 604 (lyr.); ὧν πόλις ἀνάριθμος ὄλλυται by [the loss of] countless hosts of them . . , Id. OT 179; χρόνον . . ἡμερῶν ἀνήριθμον Id. Tr. 247.

children.label: II
children.definition: without number, i.e. having no assigned number, Plot. 6.6.11.

not numerable, Dam. Pr. 117. [ ἀνᾰρῑθμος Sapph. l.c., A. Pers. 40 (lyr.); ἀνᾰρῐθμος in E. Ba. 1335 (iamb.). S. has ἀνᾰρῐθμος in lyr., OT 167, 179, El. 232. S. also uses ἀνήρῐθμος in lyr., Aj. 604: Theoc. has ἀνᾱριθμος 15.45, but ἀνᾰριθμος 16.90.]
take no breakfast, v.l. in Hp. Acut. 28.
not having breakfasted, Eup. 68, Ar. Fr. 454, Gal. 15.562.
want of breakfast, Hp. Vict. 3.75 (pl.); prob. for ἀναρίστησις, ib. 4.90.
Hp. VM 11, Plb. 3.72.3; dinnerless, X. An. 1.10.19. Theoc. 15.147.
Ibyc. 22, Epich. 42, cf. 114, Herod. 11 ( ἀνηρ-). ( ῑ not ει acc. to Hdn.Gr. 2.475.)
not governed or subject, Th. 5.99; not submitting to be governed, βίος A. Eu. 526 (where Wieseler metri gr. ἀνάρχετος, on analogy of ἀπεύχετος), S. Fr. 30.
unequipped, AP 11.29 ( Autom.).
unfit, Zos. 1.29, Men.Prot. p.110 D., David in Porph. 132.23. Adv. -ίως AB 363.
without joints, of atoms, Gal. 1.416, cf. Heraclid.Pont. ap.eund. 19.244; ὄγκοι S.E. M. 10.318.
loose, of the groin, prob. l. in Philostr. Gym. 48.
not to fit or suit, τινί Pl. R. 462a; πρὸς ἄλληλα Id. Sph. 253a; of musical instruments, to be out of tune, Id. Grg. 482b (cj.).
discord, of musical sounds, Pl. Phd. 93c, 93e, al.: metaph., Dam. Pr. 341.

not fitting, of dress, X. Mem. 3.10.13; of sound, out of tune, Pl. Ti. 80a; opp. εὐάρμοστος, Tht. 178d: metaph. of the soul, Phd. 93c, cf. Smp. 206c; ἀ. τινί 206d; incongruous, μεταβολὴ ἀ. τοῖς θεοῖς Iamb. Myst. 3.27. Adv. -τως Pl. R. 590b.

children.label: II
children.definition: impracticable, Hdt. 3.80, Ar. Nu. 908.
unfitted, unprepared, πρός τι Th. 7.67.
unploughed, γῆ EM 175.36.
snatching up violently, A.R. 4.579, 1232.
recapture, E. Hel. 50 (pl.).

definition: ἀναρπάζω, fut. -άσω (v. infr. III) and -άξω, more freq. in Med. form -άσομαι (v. infr. III) aor. -ήρπασα and - αξα, in Hom. as suits the metre: aor. 2 Pass. ἀνηρπάγην D.S. 4.75, Plu. Pyrrh. 7:—

children.definition: snatch up, ἀνὰ δʼ ἥρπασε Παλλὰς Ἀθήνη (sc. τὸ ἔγχος) Il. 22.276, cf. Pi. P. 4.34; ἀ. τὰ ὅπλα X. An. 7.1.15; of the sun causing the earthʼs moisture to evaporate, Hp. Aër. 8, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.658b, Aristid. Or. 36(48).60.

children.label: II
children.definition: snatch away, carry off, ὅτε μιν . . ἀνήρπασε Φοῖβος Il. 9.564, cf. 16.437, Od. 4.515, 5.419; of slave-dealers, ἀλλά μʼ ἀνήρπαξαν Τάφιοι kidnapped me, 15.427, cf. X. An. 1.3.14, Aristid. 1.161J., etc.; ἀνήρπασέν ποτε . . Κέφαλον ἐς θεοὺς Ἕως E. Hipp. 454; ἀ. τοῖς ὄνυξιν, of an eagle, Ar. V. 17, cf. Epicr. 2.10:— Pass., φροῦδος ἀναρπασθείς S. El. 848 (lyr.), etc.; ὑπὸ τῆς εἱμαρμένης IG 12(7).51 ( Amorgos): in Prose, to be carried off to prison, δεῖ με ἀνηρπάσθαι D. 21.120, 124, cf. 10.18.

data.quote: ἀνήρπασέν ποτε . . Κέφαλον ἐς θεοὺς Ἕως

children.definition: rescue, Plu. Pyrrh. 16:— Pass., ib. 7.

children.label: III
children.definition: take by storm, ravage, σὺ . . ἀναρπάσεις δόμους; E. Ion 1303; of persons, ἀναρπασόμενος τοὺς Φωκέας take them by storm or at once, Hdt. 8.28, cf. 9.59:— Pass., ἀνήρπασται πόλις E. Ph. 1079, Hel. 751, D. 9.47; ἐκ μέσης τῆς Ἑλλάδος Aeschin. 3.133.

children.label: IV
children.definition: carry off, steal, πολλοὺς καὶ πολλὰ χρήματα ἔχομεν ἀνηρπακότες X. An. 1.3.14; τρία τάλαντα ἀνηρπάκασι D. 27.29; of regraters, buy up unfairly, ἀ. σῖτον Lys. 22.15.

data.quote: πολλοὺς καὶ πολλὰ χρήματα ἔχομεν ἀνηρπακότες

children.definition: one must wipe off, τοὺς ἱδρῶτας Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.92.

definition: ἀναρπαστός, όν, also ή, όν E. Hec. 207 (lyr.) :—

children.definition: snatched up, carried off, ἀ. γίγνεσθαι to be carried off, l.c., Pl. Phdr. 229c.
carried up the country, i. e. into Central Asia, ἀ. γίγνεσθαι πρὸς βασιλέα v.l. in X. Mem. 4.2.33.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. ποιεῖν τὸν βίον to give up his substance as plunder, Plb. 9.26.7, cf. Hdn. 7.3.3.
A. Pr. 6 (s. v. l.).
recover from a bad illness, Poll. 3.108, Hsch.
send gushing forth, πέτρα κρουνὸν ἀ. Arist. Mir. 841a22.
lift up by sewing, βλέφαρα Gal. Thras. 23.
shake up ingredients, Hippiatr. 128.
lifting by sewing up, of the eyelid, Leonid. ap. Aët. 7.71.
used in ἀναρραφή, σμιλίον Aët. 7.71
begin singing, προοίμιον Luc. JTr. 14.

definition: ἀναρρέζω, only aor. 1 ἀνέρεξα· ἔπραξα, Hsch.

children.definition: fly up, of scales, Theol.Ar. 29.
flow, stream back, Pl. Ti. 78d; of blood, IG 12(7).115 ( Amorgos); of smoke, Philostr. Im. 2.27.
break up, μή οἱ ὕπερθε γαῖαν ἀναρρήξειε Ποσειδάων Il. 20.63; ἀ. αὔλακας Hdt. 2.14; ἀ. τάφον dig a grave, E. Tr. 1153.

data.quote: μή οἱ ὕπερθε γαῖαν ἀναρρήξειε Ποσειδάων

children.definition: break through, break open, τεῖχος ἀναρρήξας Il. 7.461; οἴκων μυχούς E. Hec. 1040; ὑπόνομον Plb. 5.71.9; ἐργαστήρια Plu. Pel. 12:— Pass., νῆες ἀναρραγεῖσαι τὰς παρεξειρεσίας Th. 7.34.
tear open a carcase, of lions, Il. 18.582; of hounds, X. Cyn. 7.9; of Ajax, δίχα ἀνερρήγνυ was cleaving them asunder, S. Aj. 236.

children.label: II
children.definition: make to break forth, λόγον Pi. Fr. 180; ἔπη Ar. Eq. 626; νεῖκος Theoc. 22.172; πόλιν make it break out, excite greatly, Plu. Flam. 10, Mar. 35:— Pass., with pf. ἀνέρρωγα, burst forth, break, of sores, Hp. Fract. 11; of floods, Arist. Mete. 368a26; of volcanoes, Id. Mir. 846a9: metaph., of words, ἀνέρρωγεν τὸ φώνημα Pherecr. 10 D.; of persons, ἀναρρήγνυσθαι πρὸς ὀργήν, εἰς ἅπαν τόλμης, Plu. Brut. 18, Cic. 19.

children.label: III
children.definition: break or burst forth, δέδοιχʼ ὅπως μὴ . . ἀναρρήξει κακά S. OT 1075: esp. in pf. part. ἀνερρωγώς, of the mouth of carnivorous animals, with a wide gape, στόμα ἔχειν ἀνερρωγός Arist. HA 502a6, PA 696b34; of the animals themselves, τὰ καρχαρόδοντα πάντα ἀνερρωγότα ib. 662a27, cf. 30.—Pres. ἀναρρήττω, D.S. 17.58.

definition: ἀναρρηθῆναι, aor. inf. Pass. of ἀνειπεῖν, q. v.

children.definition: proclamation, Phryn. PS p.39 B.
breaking up, νεῶν Plu. Ant. 66 (pl.): αἱμάτων ἀ. haemorrhage from lungs, Hp. Prorrh. 2.7.
public proclamation, ἡ ἀ. τοῦ στεφάνου Aeschin. 3.32, D. 18.58.
root, implant in, θαλάσσῃ dub. in Nonn. D. 18.36.
nose-smart, Arist. Pr. 925a30, Speus. ap. Ath. 9.369b, prob. in Nic. Fr. 84.

children.label: III
children.definition: sternutative, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.79.

rekindle, τὸ θερμόν Arist. Fr. 233, cf. D.H. 1.59: metaph., στάσιν Id. 7.15, cf. Ph. 2.377; ἐπιθυμίαν Alciphr. 1.35; fan, Antiph. 202.16:— Pass., ἁνὴρ ἀναρριπίζεται Pherecr. 4 D.; πόλεμος ἀ. Jul. Or. 1.13b.
scatter to the winds, νίκης ἐλπίδα Nonn. D. 25.307.

definition: ἀναρρίπτω (also ἀναρριπτέω Od. 13.78, Hdt. 7.50, Th. 4.95, etc.),

children.definition: throw up, ἀ. ἅλα πηδῷ, i. e. row with might and main, Od. 7.328; without πηδῷ, οἱ δʼ ἅλα πάντες ἀνέρριψαν 10.130; of a boar tossing a dog, X. Cyn. 10.9; ἀ. τὴν κόνιν, of the bison, Arist. HA 630b5; ἀ. ὑπὲρ τὴν κεφαλήν Plu. Aem. 20.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. κίνδυνον, metaph. from dicing, stand the hazard of a thing, run a risk, Hdt. 7.50, Th. 4.85, 95; τὸν περὶ ὀστράκου κίνδυνον Plu. Nic. 11; τὸν ὑπὲρ τῆς ἡγεμονίας καὶ τοῦ σώματος κίνδυνον Id. Dem. 20; διὰ μιᾶς μάχης τὸν περὶ τῆς πατρίδος κύβον ἀ. Id. Brut. 40: with κίνδυνον omitted, ἐς ἅπαν τὸ ὑπάρχον ἀναρρίπτειν throw for oneʼs all, stake oneʼs all, Th. 5.103; ἀ. μάχην risk a battle, Plu. Caes. 40, etc.; also πρὸς ἕνα κίνδυνον τὸ πᾶν ἀ. Id. Arat. 5:— Pass., ἀνερρίφθω κύβος jacta sit alea, Men. 65, cf. Ar. Fr. 673, Plu. Caes. 32.

data.quote: τὸν ὑπὲρ τῆς ἡγεμονίας καὶ τοῦ σώματος κίνδυνον
διὰ μιᾶς μάχης τὸν περὶ τῆς πατρίδος κύβον ἀ.
πρὸς ἕνα κίνδυνον τὸ πᾶν ἀ.

children.label: III
children.definition: set in motion, stir up, στάσιν D.H. 10.17 codd. (prob. -ερρίπιζον).

definition: ἀναρριχάομαι, impf. ἀνερριχώμην Ar. Pax 70, Aristaenet. 1.20: fut. -ήσομαι Poll. 5.82: aor. ἀνερριχησάμην D.C. 43.21:—in Suid. and EM the augm. tenses are written ἀνηρρ-, cf. ἀρριχάομαι:—

children.definition: clamber up with the hands and feet, scramble up, ἀ. ὥσπερ οἱ πίθηκοι ἐπʼ ἄκρα τὰ δένδρα Hellanic. 197 J.; ἀ. εἰς οὐρανόν Ar. l.c.; also in late Prose, Philostr. Im. 2.28, Ael. NA 7.24, 10.29, Aristaenet. 1.3, Lib. Or. 18.238, etc.: rarely c. acc., τοὺς ἀναβασμοὺς τοῖς γόνασιν ἀ. D.C. l.c.; τὸν τοῖχον Aristaenet. 1.20 (s. v. l., < πρὸς> add. Pierson):—ridiculed as obsolete by Luc. Lex. 8.

data.quote: ἀ. ὥσπερ οἱ πίθηκοι ἐπʼ ἄκρα τὰ δένδρα

children.definition: clambering, swarming up, ἐπὶ τοὺς οἴκους Arist. Fr. 84.
throwing up, πετρῶν, of a volcano, Plu. Pyth. 2.398e, v.l. ib. Frig. 951c.
Nicoch. 6 D. ( ἀναρρόη acc. to Hdn. Gr. 1.305.)
dash up, of the sea, dub. cj. in Eup. 324.
back flow, reflux, Arist. Mir. 843a27, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.929e (of the moonʼs reflected light); θαλάσσης Thphr. Metaph. 29.

swallow back, suck down again, Χάρυβδις ἀναρροιβδεῖ μέλαν ὕδωρ Od. 12.104; τρὶς δʼ ἀναροιβδεῖ ib. 105, cf. 236:— Pass., Gal. Sect.Intr. 9; but in S. Fr. 440, throw up, as expl. by Phot. p.120 R., cf. Paul.Aeg. 3.10. (The spelling ἀναρρυβδ- has Ms. authority in Hom. and is supported by the assonance with Χάρυβδις, Od. ll. cc.; cf. καταρυβδήσας Hsch.)
a sucking down, Str. 1.2.36.
rush up, rush back, Plu. Sollert. 2.979e.

children.label: II
children.definition: hurtle in air, of arrows, Nonn. D. 29.289.

children.label: III
children.definition: discharge, οἱ καταπέλται τὰς λόγχας ἀ. J. BJ 3.7.9.
motion upwards, Hp. Hum. 1, cf. Epid. 2.1.6; elevation, Gal. 10.318.

tilted up, like one side of a balance, σχήματα Hp. Mochl. 35; κατάκλισις Gal. 18(2).60, cf. Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.1.2; of the motion of humours, with an upward tendency, Id. ap. eund. 5.28.3. Adv. -πως Pall. in Hp.Fract. 12.282 C.

children.label: II
children.definition: retrograde, ἀνάρροπον τιθέναι τὴν τῶν Ἀβάρων κατάβασιν Men.Prot. p.68 D.
upward flow, opp. κατάρρους, τοῦ αἵματος Hp. Ulc. 24.
Cratin. 7 D., Arist. Mete. 356b13, Placit. 3.5.2, Luc. VH 1.30; gulp down, D.C. 71.10.
noise of gulping, Hsch. s.v. ἀναροιβδεῖ (pl.).
sucking up through a tube, Sch. Opp. H. 4.462.
retire with a roar, of waves, Orph. A. 706.
reduce to order, Philostr. VA 2.22.
victim, Sch. Pl. Ti. 21b:—also ἀνάρυμα, AB 417.
rescuing, Phot. Bibl. p.2 B. (prob.); αἰχμαλώτων Just. Nov. 7.8, cf. 115.3.13: pl., ibid.
second day of festival Ἀπατούρια, Ar. Pax 890, ubi v. Sch., cf. AB 417.
draw the victimʼs head back so as to cut the throat, like Homerʼs αὐερύω: hence, sacrifice, Epich. 139, Pi. O. 13.81, Eup. 395.
Med., aor. ἀνερρυσάμην, draw back, rescue, ψυχὴν ἀ. παθέων from . . , Hp. Ep. 23; ἀ. πόλεις Iamb. VP 7.33; ἀ. ἧτταν repair a defeat, D.H. 5.46 codd.:— Pass., ἀνερρύσθησαν Just. Nov. 115.3.13.
strengthen afresh, Plu. QConv. 2.694d, etc.:— Pass., regain strength, ἀναρρωσθέντες Th. 7.46, Plu. Profect. 2.75c, etc.
Act., τὴν γονὴν ἀναρρώννυσι Pherecyd. 33 J.; νοσήσας ἀνέρρωσε Plu. Pomp. 57, cf. Apophth.reg. 2.182b.
rush back, ἀναρρώσασθαι ὀπίσσω Orph. A. 1257.
recovery, τῶν κεκμηκότων Simp. in Ph. 5.1, cf. Philum. ap. Aët. 5.123, Hsch. s.v. ἀναστατηρίαι.

definition: ἀνάρσιος, ον, also α, ον S. Tr. 641 (lyr.): ( ἄρσιος):—

children.definition: incongruous: hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: hostile, implacable, δυσμενέες καὶ ἀνάρσιοι Il. 24.365, Od. 14.85; ὅσʼ ἀνάρσιοι ἄνδρες ἐδηλήσαντʼ ἐπὶ χέρσου ib. 10.459, 11.401, etc.; ἦσθʼ ἀνάρσιος (vulg. ἦλθες), of Apollo, A. Ag. 511; ἀνάρσιοι enemies, S. Tr. 853 (lyr.); ἀ. καναχά, opp. θεία μοῦσα, ib. 641 (lyr.), cf. Theoc. 17.101.

children.label: II
children.definition: untoward, strange, ἀ. πρήγματα πεπονθέναι Hdt. 1.114, cf. 9.37; οὐδὲν ἀ. πρῆγμα συνηνείχθη 3.10, 5.89, 90; δεινόν τε καὶ ἀ. ἐποιέετο [τὸ πρῆγμα] 9.110.— Ep., Ion., and (rarely) Trag.
hang to or upon, ὀνάρταις ( Aeol. pres. part.) χέρρας ὐμ ἐμμάτων Alc. Supp. 4.21; λαιμὸν ἀ. μελάθρῳ A.R. 3.789; hang up, ἑαυτόν Plu. VOrat. 2.841a; τὸ ζῆν ib. Par.min. 314b:—but mostly,

attach to, make dependent upon, δήμῳ . . μήτε πᾶν ἀναρτήσῃς κράτος E. Fr. 626.1; ἀ. ἑαυτὸν εἰς δῆμον D. Ep. 3.23; ἐς θεοὺς ἀ. τι leave it depending upon them, E. Ph. 705; Rhet., ἀ. τι τῇ ὑποστάσει Aristid. Rh. 1p.480S.
keep in suspense, Alciphr. 1.22; uplift, ταῖς ὑποσχέσεσι Lib. Decl. 33.26.
suspend, i.e. withhold, c. dat., τὸ σιτηρέσιόν τινι Just. Nov. 88.2.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be hung up, παραδείγματα ἀνηρτημένους as examples, Pl. Grg. 525c.

depend upon, ἔκ τινος Id. Ion 533e: metaph., ἐλπίσιν ἐξ ἐλπίδων ἀναρτωμένους clinging to one hope after another, D. 19.18; ἀνηρτῆσθαι εἰς . . to be referred or referable to . . , τὰ ἁμαρτήματα . . εἰς θεὸν ἀνηρτημένα τιμωρόν Pl. Lg. 729e; τὰ ἄλλα πάντα εἰς τὴν ψυχὴν ἀ. Id. Men. 88e; ὅτῳ ἀνδρὶ εἰς ἑαυτὸν ἀνήρτηται πάντα Id. Mx. 247e; ἀνηρτημένοι ταῖς ὄψεσιν πρός τινα hanging on one with their eyes, Plu. Oth. 3; ταῖς ἐπιθυμίαις εἴς τι Id. Bruta anim. 2.989d; ἀνηρτημένοι ταῖς ψυχαῖς in suspense, D.S. 33.5.

data.quote: τὰ ἁμαρτήματα . . εἰς θεὸν ἀνηρτημένα τιμωρόν
τὰ ἄλλα πάντα εἰς τὴν ψυχὴν ἀ.
ὅτῳ ἀνδρὶ εἰς ἑαυτὸν ἀνήρτηται πάντα

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., also with pf. Pass., = Act., D.H. 11.46: hence, attach to oneself, make dependent upon one, τινά X. Cyr. 1.4.1; subdue, ib. 1.1.5.

definition: ἀναρτέομαι, Ion. Verb, used only in pf. Pass. (cf. ἀρτέομαι),

children.definition: to be ready, prepared to do, c. inf., ἀναρτημένου σεῦ χρηστὰ ἔργα ποιέειν Hdt. 1.90; ἀναρτημένος ἔρδειν τινὰ κακῶς 6.88; ἀνάρτημαι ἐπʼ αὐτοὺς στρατεύεσθαι 7.8.γ.
suspension, Thphr. Lass. 10, Sor. 2.85; crucifixion, Suid.: metaph., ἡ κατὰ τὴν ὑπόστασιν ἀ. Aristid. Rh. 1p.480S.; ἡ εἰς νοῦν ἀ. Procl. Inst. 202.
suspension, = withholding, χορηγίας ἄρτων Just. Nov. 88 tit.
uneven, odd, Pl. Phd. 104e, al.
at odds with one, hostile, Plu. An.procr. 2.1030a.
unseasoned, of food, Phld. Mus. p.53 K., Diogenian. 2.12, Sm. Jb. 6.6; ἀ. βίος cj. Coraës in Ath. 12.511d.

definition: ἀναρυγή, corrupt for ἀνορυγή (q. v.), PRyl. 95.8.

children.definition: drawing of water, Plu. Frig. 2.951c (pl.).

definition: ἀναρυστῆρα ἐν ᾧ ὁ οἶνος ἀνιμᾶται, Hsch.

children.definition: draw as from a well, Plu. Frig. 2.949f: metaph., ἀ. θριάμβους Cratin. 36.
bring back to old ways, πόλιν AP 7.707 ( Diosc.).
lack of a leader, ἀναρχίης ἐούσης since there was no commander, Hdt. 9.23; οὐκ ἐρεῖτʼ ἀ. A. Supp. 906.

children.label: II
children.definition: lawlessness, anarchy, δημόθρους ἀναρχία Id. Ag. 883, cf. Th. 6.72; ἀ. καὶ ἀνομία Pl. R. 575a; opp. ἐλευθερία, 560e; ἀ. καὶ ἀταξία Arist. Pol. 1302b29; ἀ. δούλων καὶ γυναικῶν their independence, ib. 1319b28.

children.label: III
children.definition: a year during which there was no archon, X. HG 2.3.1, Arist. Ath. 13.1.

children.label: IV
children.definition: not holding office, Arr. Epict. 3.20.17.
without head or chief, Il. 2.703; ναυτικὸν στράτευμʼ ἄ. E. IA 914, cf. Hec. 607; ἄ. ζῷα, opp. τὰ ὑφʼ ἡγεμόνα ὄντα, Arist. HA 488a11: τὸ ἄ., = ἀναρχία, A. Eu. 696.
ἔτος ἄ. a year without any regular magistrates, GDI 5635 ( Teos).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., holding no office or magistracy, prob. l. Arr. Epict. 4.6.3.

children.label: b
children.definition: not qualified to hold office, (Max.Tyr. 21.5 ( Sup., s. v. l.).

children.label: III
children.definition: without beginning, Parm. 8.27, Ocell. 1.2, S.E. M. 7.312; κύκλος ἄ. καὶ ἀτελεύτητος Procl. Inst. 146; ἄ. δίκη PLips. 33 ii 5 (iv A. D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: without first principles, S.E. M. 1.180.
shake up, stir up, Luc. Astr. 29; τὴν ὀσφῦν Alciphr. 1.39.
a mine that is reopened and worked, after having been closed, IG 2.780, 1078 b.
Adj., in sense of ἀνὰ σάρκα, τοὺς ἀνάσαρκας ὕδρωπας Gal. 14.275.
load up, pile up, pf. part. Pass. ἀνασεσαγμένος Plb. 12.25h. 2; cf. ἀνασάσσει· luxatur, Gloss. Philox.
quench, damp, ὁρμάς Plu. Aet. phys. 2.917d.
draw back with a hawser, A.R. 1.391: metaph., hold in check, φλόγα v.l. in Ar. Fr. 561; τὴν ὄρεξιν AP 9.687.
draw off the right road, E. Hipp. 237; draw away, c. gen., τινὰ χάρμης Nonn. D. 39.355.
phallum agitans, Hippon. 111.
shaking up and down, esp. for the purpose of threatening, ὅπλων Dexipp. p.182 D.; χειρός Lib. Or. 18.189.
threatening gestures, D.H. 6.62.
exciting, τοῦ ὄχλου Eust. 211.7.

definition: ἀνασείω, poet. ἀνασσείω, Ep. impf. ἀνασσείασκε h.Ap. 403:—

children.definition: shake back, ἀνασείοντά τε κόμας E. Ba. 240; swing to and fro, brandish, αἰγίδα Hes. Sc. 344; ἀ. τὰς χεῖρας wave the hands, Th. 4.38; ἀ. φοινικίδας Lys. 6.51.
brandish at one, threaten with, εἰσαγγελίαν D. 25.47; βοὴν Ar. Ach. 347 ( παρὰ προσδοκίαν).
shake out, ὑδρίαν IG 2.104a36 (iv B. C.); πάντα κάλων shake out every reef, Ph. 1.327, al.; ἀ. τὰ ἱστία Philostr. VA 6.12, cf. VS 2.32; πάσας τὰς ἡνίας Poll. 1.214; τὴν χλαμύδα Philostr. Im. 1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: stir up, τὰ πλήθη Phld. Rh. 2.290 S., cf. D.H. 8.81, D.S. 13.91, Ev.Marc. 15.11, Ev.Luc. 23.5:— Pass., to be incited, encouraged, c. inf., PTeb. 28.20 (ii B. C.).

definition: ἀνασεύομαι, Pass., only aor., αἷμα . . ἀνέσσυτο the blood

children.definition: sprang forth, spouted up, Il. 11.458.

make up what is wanting by adding weight, compensate for, τὴν μεταβολήν Hp. Acut. 29, cf. Ar. Fr. 743; αἱ γενέσεις ἀ. τὰς φθοράς Arist. ap. Stob. 1.34.2 (where in Mu. 397b3 codd. give ἐπαναστέλλουσι).
wasting disease, Mon.Ant. 24.167.
breathe with difficulty, Q.S. 4.244, cf. Opp. H. 5.212 (where it may be trans.).
wear the hair bristling up, Hsch.

definition: ἀνασιλλοκομάω, = foreg., dub. l. Plu. Crass. 24.
ἀνάσιλλος (cf. Hdn. Gr. 2.446) or ἀνά-σῑλος, ον,

children.definition: with hair brushed up on the forehead as the Parthians wore it, τῷ ἀνασίλλῳ κομᾶν Plu. Crass. 24; restored by Sylburg in Arist. Phgn. 809b24, 812b35, cf. PGrenf. 1.10.11 (iii B. C.).
Poll. 2.73.
snub-nosed, Ar. Ec. 940.
turned up at end, ὀδόντες ἀ., of the elephantʼs tusks, Arist. HA 501b33; ἀ. πλοῖα Id. Pr. 932a18; of a horseʼs neck, curved up, Simon Eq. 6.
turn up the nose, sniff, esp. of male animals following the females, Hsch.
loading with wheat, πλοίων PTeb. 486 (ii A. D.).
hop or skip up, Q.S. 8.321.
scrape up, Hsch., Zen. 1.27:— Med., clean out the ears, Pl.Com. 148.

children.label: II
children.definition: ransack, τὴν ὅλην οἰκουμένην PMag.Par. 1.186.
dig up, in Pass., f.l. for foreg., Pl.Com. 148.
dig up, πλοῦτον Str. 9.3.8; τύπον Plu. Thes. 36; ὅλην πόλιν Pomp. 62:— Pass., Arist. Mir. 835b22, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.924c.
extirpate, of plants, Thphr. HP 3.18.5 (prob. l.); raze to the ground, of buildings, Plb. 16.1.6, IG 12(2).526a4 ( Eresus).
βεβρωμένα καὶ ἀνεσκαμμένα Archig. ap. Aët. 16.106(96).
digging up, Str. 9.3.8.
dissipate, χροιήν Hp. Liqu. 1; scatter abroad, Plu. Pyrrh. 22:— Pass., v.l. in Polyaen. 1.40.2.
one must consider, Thphr. CP 6.13.2.
Plu. Def.orac. 2.438d, Gal. 8.352.

pack up the baggage ( τὰ σκεύη), and so, carry away, remove, τὴν ἀγορὰν εἴσω X. An. 6.2.8, etc.; ἀ. τοὺς Ἀθηναίους ἐκ θαλάττης divert them from naval enterprise, Philostr. VS 1.17.3, cf. 1.25.7:— in Med., break up camp, march away, Th. 1.18; κατεσκευάζετο καὶ πάλιν ἀ. X. Cyr. 8.5.2, etc.
dismantle a place, Th. 4.116:—in Med., dismantle oneʼs house or city, Id. 1.18.
waste, ravage, X. Cyr. 6.2.25 ( Pass.); ἀ. τὰς συνθήκας break them, Plb. 9.31.6:—in Med., τάφον Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.578f.
Pass., to be bankrupt, τῆς τραπέζης ἀνασκευασθείσης D. 33.9, cf. 49.68; οἱ ἀνεσκευασμένοι τῶν τραπεζιτῶν broken bankers, ibid.: metaph., ἀνεσκευάσμεθα E. El. 602.
demolish opponentʼs arguments, definitions, etc., opp. κατασκευάζειν, Arist. APr. 43a2, cf. Rh. 1401b4, Str. 1.2.18, Polystr. p.24 W.
reverse a decision or judgement, Vett.Val. 283.23 ( Pass.): metaph., ἀ. ψυχάς disturb, opp. οἰκοδομέω, Act.Ap. 15.24, cf. 9.31.
remove, νόσον Sor. 2.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: build again, remodel, Str. 16.1.5:—also in Med., build, οἴκους J. BJ 6.5.2.
upsetting, reversal, πραγμάτων Vett.Val. 228.27 (pl.).
one must demolish, Theon Prog. 5, Aphth. Prog. 5.
destructive, in Logic, ἀ. τόποι Arist. Top. 152b37. Adv. -κῶς destructively, by way of refutation, Id. APr. 52a38.
destructive of, ἀλλήλων S.E. M. 8.196.

children.label: II
children.definition: restorative, curative, Sor. 2.50, Dsc. 1.33. Adv. -κῶς Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.30.17.
pulling down: suppression of desires, Arr. Epict. 4.1.175.

refutation of arguments, S.E. M. 6.4, cf. Quint. Inst. 2.4.18, Hermog. Prog. 5; ὁ κατʼ -ὴν τρόπος negative mood, proof by denial or argument from non-existence, Phld. Sign. 31, al.; removal, cure, πυρετῶν Dsc. 3.137; ἰσχιάδος Archig. ap. Aët. 12.1.
subversion, πραγμάτων Vett.Val. 2.7, al. (pl.).
not free from blemish, IG 5(2).3.6 ( Tegea, iv B. C.).
want of practice or exercise, Eus.Mynd. 39, Muson. Fr. 4p.15H., Poll. 1.159.
unpractised, unexercised, X. Cyr. 8.8.24, Plb. 1.61.4, Onos. 10.3, Plu. Cam. 18, etc. Adv. -τως Id. Cons.Apoll. 2.112e.

definition: ἀνασκινδαλεύω or ἀνασκινδῠλεύω, = Att. ἀνασχινδυλεύω, Hsch., EM 100.51, Phryn. PS p.48 B.

children.definition: leap, skip with joy, D.S. 19.55; but of wounded horses, ὑπʼ ὀδύνης Plu. Crass. 25; ἀνεσκιρτηκότες τὴν ὄψιν, of athletes, Philostr. Gym. 39: pf. part. Pass. ἀνεσκιρτημένος Eup. 22.

definition: ἀνασκολοπίζω:— Pass., with fut. Med. -σκολοπιοῦμαι (in pass. sense) Hdt. 3.132, 4.43, but Pass. -σκολοπισθήσομαι Luc. Prom. 7: aor. -εσκολοπίσθην ib. 2, 10: pf. -εσκολόπισμαι Id. Peregr. 13:—

children.definition: fix on a pole or stake, impale, Hdt. 1.128, 3.159, al.; in 9.78 it is used convertibly with ἀνασταυρόω, a sin Ph. 1.237, 687, Luc. Peregr. 11.
impaling, Sch. A. Pr. 7, Eust. 1136.54.

definition: ἀνασκοπέω, c. fut. -σκέψομαι, aor. ἀνεσκεψάμην: (cf. ἀνασκέπτομαι):—

children.definition: look at narrowly, examine well, πάντʼ ἀνασκόπει καλῶς Ar. Th. 666, cf. Th. 1.132, etc.:—also in Med., ἀνασκοπουμένοις Ar. Ec. 827.

children.label: II
children.definition: look back at, reckon up, X. Vect. 5.11 (nisi leg. ἐπανα-).
consideration, Timo 61.
to be at heat again, Com.Adesp. 930.
consume as by fire, of disease, Aret. SD 1.1.

scare and make to start up: generally, rouse, ἄγραν Pl. Ly. 206a; τοὺς ἀκροωμένους Plu. Aud. 2.44d; τινὰ πρὸς ὀργήν Chor.p.206 B.: — Pass., ἀνασεσοβημένος τὴν κόμην with ruffled hair, Luc. Tim. 54; κόμη ἀνασεσοβημένη Id. JTr. 30.
tear up, ῥίζας E. Ba. 1104.

definition: ἀνασπάς <φυ>τὸν ἀνεσπασμένον, Hsch. ( ἀνασπάσιον· ἀ. cod.; cf. παρασπάς).

children.definition: drawing back, Hp. Art. 48; tearing up, τῆς γῆς Thphr. CP 5.4.7; ἀ. θυρῶν breaking open, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.97.
uprooted plant, σελίνου Eust. 679.34.
fitted for drawing up: τὸ ἀ., a machine for raising a portcullis, App. BC 4.78.

drawn up, Ar. V. 382: but mostly, dragged up the country, of tribes compelled to emigrate into Central Asia, ἀνασπαστοὺς ποιῆσαι τοὺς Παίονας ἐς τὴν Ἀσίην Hdt. 5.12; τούτους ἐξ Αἰγύπτου ἀ. ἐποίησαν παρὰ βασιλέα Id. 4.204, cf. 6.9, 32; τοὺς ἀ. κατοικίζειν Id. 3.93; εὐθὺς ἀ. removing hastily, Plb. 2.53.5.

data.quote: ἀνασπαστοὺς ποιῆσαι τοὺς Παίονας ἐς τὴν Ἀσίην
τούτους ἐξ Αἰγύπτου ἀ. ἐποίησαν παρὰ βασιλέα

children.definition: drawn back, opened from inside, S. Ant. 1186.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., οἱ ἀ. (sc. ἱμάντες) latchets, Ath. 12. 543f.
draw, pull up, σπυρίδα Hdt. 5.16, cf. 4.154; βύβλον ἐκ τῶν ἑλέων Id. 2.92:— Pass., BGU 1041.8 (iii A.D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: draw a ship up on land, Pi. P. 4.27, Hdt. 7.188, Th. 4.9.
draw, suck up greedily, ὅταν αἷμʼ ἀνασπάσῃ κόνις A. Eu. 647; ἀ. ὑγρόν Hp. VM 22; ἀ. ποτόν, τροφήν, Arist. HA 495a26, PA 661a19; ὕδωρ ἀ. draw water, Th. 4.97.
draw back, τὴν χεῖρα Ar. Pl. 691:—so in Med., ἐκ χροὸς ἔγχος ἀνεσπάσατʼ Il. 13.574.

tear up, pull down, τὰ ἀγάλματα ἐκ τῶν βάθρων Hdt. 5.86; τὴν σκηνήν Id. 7.119; τὸ σταύρωμα Th. 6.100; τύμβους E. Med. 1381, cf. Ba. 949; δένδρα Arist. HA 497b29, al.; τὰς σανιδας τῆς γεφύρας Plb. 2.5.5; πυλίδας Id. 5.39.4, etc.

ἀνασπᾶν λόγους, in S. Aj. 302, draw forth words, utter wild, incoherent words; ἀνασπῶντʼ αὐτοπρέμνοις τοῖς λόγοισιν Ar. Ra. 903:—the phrase may be expl. from Pl. Tht. 180a ( ὥσπερ ἐκ φαρέτρας ῥηματίσκια . . ἀνασπῶντες) and Men. 429 ( πόθεν . . τούτους ἀνεσπάκασιν οὗτοι τοὺς λόγους;); so ἀ. γνωμίδιον Ar. Fr. 49D.

τὰς ὀφρῦς ἀνασπᾶν pucker the eyebrows, and so put on a grave important air, τὰς ὀφρῦς ἀνεσπακὼς ὥσπερ τι δεινὸν ἀγγελῶν Id. Ach. 1069, cf. Alex. 16, D. 19.314; ἔβλεψε νᾶπυ καὶ τὰ μέτωπʼ ἀνέσπασεν Ar. Eq. 631; μέχρι νεφέων τὴν ὀφρὺν ἀ. Philem. 174, cf. X. Smp. 3.10; οἱ τὰς ὀφρῦς ἀνεσπασμένοι πρὸς τὸν κρόταφον Arist. Phgn. 812b27.

data.quote: τὰς ὀφρῦς ἀνεσπακὼς ὥσπερ τι δεινὸν ἀγγελῶν
ἔβλεψε νᾶπυ καὶ τὰ μέτωπʼ ἀνέσπασεν
οἱ τὰς ὀφρῦς ἀνεσπασμένοι πρὸς τὸν κρόταφον

children.label: II
children.definition: retract, ὁ στόμαχος αὐτὸς ἑαυτὸν ἀ. Hp. Superf. 22, Steril. 217.

children.label: III
children.definition: carry away from home, Luc. Tox. 28 codd.
without a shield, Nonn. D. 30.18, 36.262.
sponge clean, sponge well, τὸ ἕλκος Hp. Ulc. 4; soak up drugs, ἀνασπογγίσας εἰρίῳ . . πρόσθες Id. Nat.Mul. 32, cf. 74.

definition: ἄνασσα ( ϝάνασσα Inscr.Cypr. 101 H., al.), ἡ, fem. of ἄναξ,

children.definition: queen, lady, addressed to goddesses, Od. 3.380, 6.175; esp. in Att. to Athena, A. Eu. 228, 235, 443, etc.
Od. 6.149, etc.—Common in Poetry from Pi. downwds.; rare in Prose, as Isoc. 9.72, Arist. Fr. 526: c. dat., ἐνέροισιν A.R. 3.862.
ἄνασσα πράγους καὶ βουλεύματος authoress of this deed, E. Fr. 704; ὀργίων Ar. Ra. 387.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., royal, ἀ. βουλή, of the Roman Senate, IG 14.1389i34.
rushing upwards, of air, Hp. Mul. 2.124, cf. Hsch.

definition: ἀνάσσω [ᾰ], impf. ἤνασσον Od. 11.276, Dor. ἄνασσον [ᾱ] Pi. O. 6.34, Ep. ἄνασσον [ᾰ] Il. 1.252, Aeol. 3 sg. ἐάνασσε Alc. 64: fut. ἀνάξω Il. 20.180: Ep. aor. ἄναξα Hes. Th. 837:—rare in Med. and Pass., v. infr.: ( ϝανάσσω, cf. ἄναξ):—

children.definition: pres., to be lord, master, of gods and human rulers: in Hom. mostly c. dat., νήσοισι καὶ Ἄργεϊ to be lord, hold sway in . ., Il. 2.108; κτήμασι, κτεάτεσσι, Od. 1.117, 4.93: also c. gen., Ἀργείων, πεδίοιο ἀ. to be lord of . ., Il. 10.33, Od. 4.602, cf. Pi. l.c., E. Andr. 22, etc.: with dat. pers. added, ἐλπόμενον Τρώεσσι ἀνάξειν . . τιμῆς τῆς Πριάμου to be master of Priamʼs sovereignty among the Trojans, Il. 20.180; γῆς ἀνάσσει βαρβάροισι βάρβαρος E. IT 31; πάντων μὲν κρατέειν ἐθέλειν, πάντεσσι δʼ ἀνάσσειν, πᾶσι δὲ σημαίνειν Il. 1.288: with Prep., μετʼ ἀθανάτοισι ib. 4.61, cf. 23.471; ἐν Βονδείῳ 16.572; ἐν Φαίηξι Od. 7.62; παρὰ τὸν Ἀχέροντα S. El. 184; ὑπὸ γαίας ib. 841: with neut. Adj., Ζεῦ πάντʼ ἀνάσσων Id. OT 904: in Hom. freq. with ἶφι, Τενέδοιό τε ἶφι ἀνάσσεις Il. 1.38, al.: abs., τῶν ἀνασσόντων the kings, S. Ph. 6:— Med. once in Hom., τρὶς ἀνάξασθαι γένεʼ ἀνδρῶν to have been king for three generations, Od. 3.245:— Pass., to be ruled, ἀνάσσονται δʼ ἐμοὶ αὐτῷ 4.177.

data.quote: πάντων μὲν κρατέειν ἐθέλειν, πάντεσσι δʼ ἀνάσσειν, πᾶσι δὲ σημαίνειν

children.label: II
children.definition: κώπης ἀνάσσων E. Fr. 705; ὄχων ἀνάσσουσʼ Hel. 1040; στρατηγίας IT 17; πηδήματος ἀνάσσων lord of the leap, dub. in A. Pers. 96; ἃ τῶν νυκτιπόλων ἐφόδων ἀνάσσεις, of Persephone, E. Ion 1049 (lyr.):— Pass., παρʼ ὅτῳ σκῆπτρον ἀνάσσεται is held as lord, S. Ph. 140 (lyr.).
standing up, Il. 9.671, 23.469.
make trickle forth, Opp. C. 4.324.
reduction of diet, prob. for ἀνάστασις in Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 5.129 (pl.).
fitted for checking, λύπης Ael. VH 7.3; θεραπεία Gal. 12.664.
sob, Anacr. 43.4. (Etym. dub.; cf. ἀσταλύζω.)

definition: ἀνάσταμα, ατος, τό, dub. sens. in PPetr. 3p.291.
ἀναστάς, f.l. for παστάς in A.R. 1.789.

children.label: I
children.definition: Act., ( ἀνίστημι) making to stand or rise up, raising up the dead, ἀνδρὸς δʼ ἐπειδὰν αἷμʼ ἀνασπάσῃ κόνις . . οὔτις ἔστʼ ἀ. A. Eu. 648; ἔλαβον . . ἐξ ἀναστάσεως τοὺς νεκροὺς αὐτῶν Ep.Hebr. 11.35.

data.quote: ἀνδρὸς δʼ ἐπειδὰν αἷμʼ ἀνασπάσῃ κόνις . . οὔτις ἔστʼ ἀ.
ἔλαβον . . ἐξ ἀναστάσεως τοὺς νεκροὺς αὐτῶν

children.definition: making to rise and leave their place, removal, as of suppliants, ἀ. ἐκ τοῦ ἱεροῦ Th. 1.133; ἀ. τῆς Ἰωνίας removal of the Greeks from Ionia [for safety], Hdt. 9.106: mostly in bad sense, desolation, ἅλωσιν Ἰλίου τʼ ἀνάστασιν A. Ages. 589; πόλεων ἀ. Id. Pers. 107, cf. E. Tr. 364; τῆς πατρίδος D. 1.5; disturbance, Hp. Decent. 3 (pl.).
setting up, erection, τειχῶν D. 20.72; τροπαίου Plu. Herod. 2.873a; εἰκόνος GDI 3505.20 ( Cnidus), cf. IPE 12.34.8 ( Olbia), Arr. An. 4.11.2; οἰκοδομημάτων Luc. Phal. 1.3 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀνίσταμαι) standing or rising up, πόδες ἀναστάσεως χάριν Arist. Spir. 485a18, cf. Id. Fr. 156.
