rising and moving off, removal, στρατεύματος Th. 7.75, cf. 2.14.
rising up, ἐξ ὕπνου S. Ph. 276.

children.label: b
children.definition: Hp. Epid. 6.7.1: hence, motions, Id. Coac. 605, Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.6.2.

children.label: c
children.definition: rising again after a fall, Ev.Luc. 2.34.

children.label: d
children.definition: rising from the dead, Τυνδάρεω Luc. Salt. 45; εἰς ἀνάστασιν [fort. βλέποντες] IGRom. 4.743 ( Eumeneia, iii A.D.): freq. in N.T., Ev.Matt. 22.23, al.; ἀ. νεκρῶν Act.Ap. 23.6; ἀ. ζωῆς, κρίσεως Ev.Jo. 5.29; ἀπὸ σώματος ἀ. Plot. 3.6.6.
carry off, or perh. seduce, POxy. 1836 (vi A.D.).
destroyer, A. Th. 1020, Ch. 303.
sacrifice on oneʼs recovery, Hsch. (cod. -ιαι).
made to rise up and depart, driven from oneʼs house and home, ἀ. ποιεῖν τινας, ἀ. γίγνεσθαι, Hdt. 1.76, 177, 7.118, Isoc. 4.108, S. OC 429, Tr. 39.

ruined, laid waste, Hdt. 1.155, 178, And. 1.108, etc.; ἀ. δορὶ χώρα S. Tr. 240; δόμους τιθέναι ἀ. Id. Ant. 673; ἀ. ποιεῖν τὰ χωρία Th. 8.24; οἴκους ἀ. γεγενημένους Isoc. 6.66, cf. Alex. 1 D., Men. Inc. 2.30 Körte.
upset, Pl. Sph. 252a.
driven from, deprived of a thing, Χαρίτων Plu. QConv. 2.613b.
unstable, Olymp. in Mete. 141.28.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἀνάστᾰτος, ὁ, a kind of light bread at Athens, prob. in Ath. 3.114a, Paus.Gr. Fr. 94.

unsettle, upset, [ τὴν γῆν] LXX Da. 7.23; τὴν οἰκουμένην Act.Ap. 17.6, cf. 21.38, PMag.Par. 1.2244; of the mind, Ep.Gal. 5.12; ἀναστατοῖ με he upsets me, POxy. 119.10 (ii/iii A.D.); destroy, Asp. in EN 61.28; drive out, BGU 1079.20 (i A.D.):— Pass., ἀναστατωθῆναι Harp. s.v. ἀνεσκευάσατο : ἀναστατοῦ ἐς τὰ ὄρη Aq. Ps. 10(11).1.
unsettling, Heph.Astr. 2.32, Eust. 81.41.
destruction, Poll. 3.91.
impale, Ctes. Fr. 29.59 ( Pass.).

definition: ἀνασταυρόω, = foreg., Hdt. 3.125, 6.30, al.; identical with ἀνασκολοπίζω, 9.78:— Pass., Th. 1.110, Pl. Grg. 473c.

children.label: II
children.definition: affix to a cross, crucify, Plb. 1.11.5, al., Plu. Fab. 6, al.
crucify afresh, Ep.Hebr. 6.6.
crucifixion, X.Eph. 4.2.
shoot up with ears, A.R. 4.271, Procl. H. 5.10: metaph., κατὰ ὦλκας ἀ. Γίγαντες A.R. 3.1054; trans., cause to spring up, φυταλίην δρακόντων Nonn. D. 25.199.
tread under foot, AP 7.544.
lacking in wit, Aristod. ap. Ath. 13.585b.
with a high prow, ναῦς Plb. 16.3.8.
go up, ἐπὶ γαῖαν Opp. H. 1.422; ascend, κολώνην ib. 4.65.

send up, raise, νέφεα Arat. 417:— Med., gird or tuck up oneʼs clothes, νεβρίδας ἀνεστείλαντο E. Ba. 696; ἀναστέλλεσθʼ ἄνω τὰ χιτώνια Ar. Ec. 268: abs., ἀναστειλαμένη Artem. 4.44:— Pass., ἀνεσταλμένῳ τῷ χιτῶνι with oneʼs frock girt up, Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.178c.

children.label: II
children.definition: draw back, e.g. the flesh in a surgical operation, Hp. VC 14; push back or up, τὰς ῥίζας [τῶν ὄρχεων] Arist. HA 632a17:— Pass., to be turned up, of the foot, Hp. Mochl. 24.
open, στόμια μεμυκότα Ph. 1.278, al.

repulse, check an assault, E. IT 1378, Th. 6.70, X. An. 5.4.23: generally, οἱ ἄνεμοι ἀ. τὰ νέφη Arist. Pr. 943a35, cf. Epicur. Ep. 2p.51U.; φόβος ἀ. τινά Ael. NA 5.54: Medic., check a discharge, etc., Leonid. ap. Aët. 16.40, cf. Sor. 2.9:— Med., suppress oneʼs inclinations, dissemble, Plb. 9.22.9:— Pass., Th. 3.98, Phld. Ir. p.82 W.: c. gen., ἀ. τοῦ . . to be restrained from . ., Ael. NA 8.10; ἀνεστάλησαν τὴν ὁρμήν VH 6.14.
remove, make away with, γῆν D.S. 17.82; τὰ ἐμποδών Ph. 1.407.
lay aside, Dam. Pr. 400.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., renounce, refuse, ἀναστέλλεσθαι τροφήν Ael. NA 11.14.
Hdt. 1.86, 6.80, Ev.Marc. 8.12: c. acc. cogn., τοῖά μοι ἀ. ἐχθοδοπά such bitter words didst thou groan forth, S. Aj. 930.

children.label: II
children.definition: groan for, lament, A. Ch. 335, E. HF 118 (lyr.).
groan oft and loudly, wail aloud, Il. 10.9.
groan aloud over, bemoan, bewail aloud, Il. 23.211:—so in Med., 18.315, 355.
groan aloud, A. Ag. 546, 1286, S. Tr. 939.

children.label: II
children.definition: bemoan, c. acc., Archil. 9.8, E. IT 551.
not marked by stars, of positions in the heavens, Hipparch. 1.7.21, 1.8.1.

definition: ἀνάστερος, ον, poet. for ἄναστρος, Arat. 349, Man. 4.528.

children.definition: crown, wreath, τὸν σὸν κρᾶτα E. Fr. 243; ἀ. στεφάνοισι ib. 362.48; στόρνῃσιν Call. Hec. Fr. 260.15 Pf. [updated ref.]:— Pass., ἀνέστεμμαι κάρα φύλλοις I have my head wreathed with leaves, E. Hipp. 806; but also δάφνας κλῶνας ἀναστέφεται Epigr.Gr. 786.
set up as or on a monument, Lyc. 883, Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1033e.
setting up of a monument, Ptol.Heph. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.147B.

height, Thphr. HP 9.9.5; of animals, D.S. 5.17 (pl.); τὸ τῆς ἡλικίας ἀ. J. AJ 2.9.6; ἀ. βασιλικόν royal majesty, D.S. 19.92; ἀ. τραγικόν D.Chr. 18.7 (prob.l.); ἡ ψυχὴ γαῦρόν τι ἀ. λαμβάνουσα Longin. 7.2 (prob.).

data.quote: ἡ ψυχὴ γαῦρόν τι ἀ. λαμβάνουσα

children.definition: protuberance, prominence, Simp. in Cael. 480.15.
high ground, in pl., Str. 2.3.2, D.S. 2.14, etc.
erection, building, Epict. Gnom. 62 (pl.): metaph., structure, φιλοσοφίας Phld. Herc. 1457.10.
eruption, φλυκταινῶν Lyd. Ost. 35:—also ἀνάστεμα, LXX Ju. 9.10.al.
set up firmly, AP 7.321.
resolve matter into its elements, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.188, cf. Ph. 1.501, 477 ( Pass.), Gal. 1.508.
dissolution, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.79, Lyd. Mens. 4.26, cf. 40; of the body, Gal. 7.251.
dissolvent, Steph. in Hp. 1.132D.
putting back, τῆς κόμης Plu. Pomp. 2.
opening up of a fistula, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.60.

furnish with a mouth, open up; τάφρον clear out a trench, X. Cyr. 7.5.15; τὰς Νείλου διώρυγας Plb. 5.62.4, cf. S.E. M. 5.59; ταῦτα τῶν ἡδυσμάτων ἀ. τᾀσθητήρια Diph. 18.6: ἀ. μήτραν Dsc. 1.19:— Med., φάρυγος ἀναστόμου τὸ χεῖλος open your gullet wide, E. Cyc. 357:— Pass., τραυλὴ μέν ἐστιν, ἀλλʼ ἀνεστομωμένη with mouth wide-opened, loud-talking, Call.Com. 19; also, to be opened, dilated, ἀ. οἱ πόροι Arist. HA 581b19, GA 751a2; ἰχῶρες ἀναστομωθείσης τῆς σαρκὸς ἐξέρρεον Memn. 2.
opening into another, κατὰ στενοπόρους αὐχένας ἀνεστομωμένος Arist. Mu. 303a22; ὁ Ἀράβιος κόλπος ἀνεστόμωται εἰς τὸν . . Ὠκεανόν D.S. 3.38, cf. Ph. 2.475, Hld. 1.29.

data.quote: ὁ Ἀράβιος κόλπος ἀνεστόμωται εἰς τὸν . . Ὠκεανόν

children.definition: outlet, opening, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.590f, Gal. 11.750; inosculation, Id. UP 6.17.
patency, Cels. 4.5, Gal. 7.31.

opening up or keeping open, ἕλκους Ruf. Fr. 118, cf. Procl. in Alc. p.119C. (pl.); αἱμορροίδων Dsc. 1.58; τὰ εἰς ἀ. βρώματα appetizing foods (cf. ἀναστομόω 1), Ath. 4.132f; ἀ. καὶ δῆξις, of manures, Thphr. CP 3.17.6.
one must open, of piles, Gal. 17(2).287.
proper for opening, τῆς ὑστέρης Hp. Nat.Mul. 109.

definition: ἀναστομωτικός, ή, όν, = foreg., Dsc. 1.4, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.25.2.
ἀναστομωτός, όν, of an abscess, prob. f.l. for ἀστόμωτος, Gal. 18(2).795.

children.definition: Orph. A. 1287:—also ἀνα-στοναχίζω, Q.S. 2.634 (s. v. l.).
not eating the ναστός (q. v.), Orac. ap. Paus. 8.42.6.
lighten, Ph. 2.204.
enlist again, App. BC 3.66:— Med., serve again, of soldiers, D.C. 41.35.
decamping, Plb. 6.40.1.

definition: ἀνάστρεμμα, ατος, τό, f.l. for ἀνάβλεμμα in X. Cyn. 4.4.

children.definition: one must invert, τι Isoc. 5.132.
one must write with anastrophe, Hdn.Gr. 1.481, etc.

definition: ἀναστρέφω, poet. ἀνστρέφω, pf. ἀνέστροφα v.l. in Theognet. 1.8, 3 pl. ἀνέστροφαν Cerc. Fr. 17.30:—

children.definition: turn upside down, μήπως . . δίφρους ἀνστρέψειαν might upset them, Il. 23.436; ὁ θεὸς πάντʼ ἀ. πάλιν E. Supp. 331; ἀ. γένος Ar. Av. 1240; τὴν ζοήν Cerc. l.c.; ἀ. καρδίαν upset the stomach, i.e. cause sickness, Th. 2.49; reverse, A. Pers. 333, Ar. Pl. 779:— Pass., fut. ἀναστραφήσεσθαι τὰ τῆς Ἑλλάδος πράγματα Isoc. 5.64: pf. ἀνεστράφθαι τῆς πολιτείας Id. 6.66 codd.; ὄρος ἀνεστραμμένον ἐν τῇ ζητήσει turned up by digging, Hdt. 6.47, cf. X. Oec. 16.12.
invert order of words or statements, Demetr. Eloc. 11, al., Hermog. Id. 1.11:—also in Pass., with ref. to ἐπαναστροφή (q. v.), ib. 12.

children.label: II
children.definition: turn back, Com.Adesp. 22.73D.; bring back, τινὰ ἐξ Ἅιδου S. Ph. 449, cf. E. Hipp. 1228; ἀ. δίκην τινί Id. Ba. 793; ὄμμʼ ἀ. κύκλῳ to roll it about, Id. Hel. 1557.
turn back, retire, Hdt. 1.80, etc.; esp. in part., ἀναστρέψας ἀπήλαυνεν X. An. 1.4.5, etc.; but also, rally, of troops, Th. 4.43, X. HG 6.2.21, cf. B.ΙΙΙ.1:— ἀναστρέφον, τό, v. ἀνακυκλικός.

children.label: III
children.definition: write with anastrophe, as πέρι for περί, Hdn.Gr. 2.52,66:— Pass., 1.481, al.
ἀναστρέψαντι convertendo, Euc. 5.19 Cor.; so in Logic, οἱ ἀντιστρέφοντες οὐχ οἱ ἀναστρέφοντες ἀλλήλοις λόγοι συναληθεύονται Gal. 11.465.

data.quote: οἱ ἀντιστρέφοντες οὐχ οἱ ἀναστρέφοντες ἀλλήλοις λόγοι συναληθεύονται

children.label: B
children.definition: Pass., v. supr. A.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: dwell in a place, ἀλλά τινʼ ἄλλην γαῖαν ἀναστρέφομαι go to a place and dwell there, Od. 13.326, cf. Call. Lav.Pall. 76, Aet. 1.1.6 [Fr. 178.6 Pf.](so ἀναστρέφειν πόδα ἐν γῇ E. Hipp. 1176); ἀναστρέφεσθαι ἐν Ἀργει Id. Tr. 993; ἐν φανερῷ, ἐν μέσῳ, go about in public, X. HG 6.4.16, Pl. R. 558a; ἀ. ταύτῃ Th. 8.94; ἐν εὐφροσύναις X. Ag. 9.4; ἐν τοῖς ἤθεσι Pl. Lg. 865e; ἀ. ἐν ξυμμαχίᾳ continue in an alliance, X. HG 7.3.2; ἀ. ἐν γεωργίᾳ to be engaged in . ., Id. Oec. 5.13; ἐπὶ κυνηγεσίαις Plb. 32.15.9; ἀ. ἔν τινι dwell upon, in writing, Apollon. Cit. 2: generally, conduct oneself, behave, ὡς δεσπότης X. An. 2.5.14; οὑτωσί Arist. EN 1103b20; θρασέως, ἀχαρίστως καὶ ἀσεβῶς εἴς τινα, Plb. 1.9.7, 23.17.10; ἐν ταῖς ἀρχαῖς ὁσίως IG 12(7).233 ( Amorgos); ὡς τὰ παιδία Epict. Ench. 29.3; πῶς δεῖ ἐν οἴκῳ θεοῦ ἀ. 1 Ep.Ti. 3.15.

data.quote: πῶς δεῖ ἐν οἴκῳ θεοῦ ἀ.

children.definition: revolve, like the sun in the heavens, X. Mem. 4.3.8.

children.label: III
children.definition: face about, rally, Id. An. 1.10.12, HG 6.2.20, etc.
to be reversed or inverted, ἐμοὶ τοῦτʼ ἀνέστραπται Id. Hier. 4.5, cf. Cyr. 8.8.13, Arist. Mech. 854a10.
return, Pl. Plt. 271a; retreat, Arist. HA 621b34.
ignorant of astronomy, Str. 2.1.19.
carrying no planet, σφαῖρα Thphr. Fr. 31, 32, cf. Eratosth. Cat. 22; without σφαῖρα, Jul. Or. 4.148a; starless, νύξ ib. 153c.
reversely, Hsch.
turning upside down, upsetting, overthrow, E. Fr. 301 (pl.); μοῖραν εἰς ἀ. δίδωσι, = ἀναστρέφει, Id. Andr. 1007; disorder, confusion, Posidipp. 26.22.

turning back, return, S. Ant. 226; πολλὰς ἀ. ποιούμενος, of a hunter, making many casts backward, X. Cyn. 6.25; wheeling round, of a horse, Id. Eq.Mag. 3.14; of soldiers in battle, whether to flee or rally, Id. Cyr. 5.4.8; μηκέτι δοῦναι αὐτοῖς ἀ. time to rally, Id. HG 4.3.6, cf. Ages. 2.3; esp. of the reversal of a wheeling movement, Ascl. Tact. 10.6, Ael. Tact. 25.7, Arr. Tact. 21.4; of a ship, Th. 2.89; ἐξ ἀ. turning back, Plb. 4.54.4; κατʼ ἀναστροφήν conversely, S.E. M. 7.430.
throwing back of the accent, as in Prepositions after their case, A.D. Synt. 308.15, etc.
repetition of words which close one sentence at the beginning of another, Hermog. Id. 1.12, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: inversion of the natural order, A.D. Synt. 71.18, Phoeb. Fig. 1.4, etc.; τῆς τάξεως Theon Prog. 4.
conversion of a ratio, ἀ. λόγου Euc. 5 Def. 16; κατʼ ἀναστροφήν Papp. 1002.25.

children.label: II
children.definition: dwelling in a place, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.216a.
abode, haunt, δαιμόνων ἀναστροφή A. Eu. 23.

mode of life, behaviour, Plb. 4.82.1, D.L. 9.64; -φὴν ποιεῖσθαι IG 2.477b12, cf. SIG 491.5, LXX To. 4.14, Ep.Gal. 1.13, Ep.Eph. 4.22, al.; ἀ. πολιτική PGiss. 40ii29 (iii A.D.); ἐξημερωμένης -φῆς civilized life, Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.19.
delay, respite, time for doing a thing, Plb. 1.66.3, al., D.S. 10.5.
occupation, concern, περί τι τὰν ἀ. ἔχειν Archyt. 1, cf. Phld. Po. 5.1425.6.
return, way back, Arist. HA 631a26, cf. Pr. 940b23.
recourse, ἀ. λαμβάνειν πρός τι Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.112c.

definition: ἀναστροφία, Ep. ἀναστροφίη, ἡ, = foreg., Man. 4.312.

children.definition: converse, of mathematical proportions, Papp. 210.15, al.
hinge, καλυπτῆρας ἐξ ἀ. hinged lids IG 7.3498 ( Oropus).
conversely, vice versa, Stoic. 2.71, Iamb. VP 26.118.
spread with coverings, Lyd. Mag. 1.18 ( Pass.).

definition: ἀναστρωπή, ἡ, word coined by Pl. Cra. 409c, to explain ἀστραπή ( ὅτι τὰ ὦπα ἀναστρέφει).
ἀναστρωφάω, Frequentat. of ἀναστρέφω, τόξον ἐνώμα πάντῃ ἀναστρωφῶν

children.definition: turning it constantly, Od. 21.394:— Med., wander about, S. Fr. 945; ἀ. ἐν ἀφθόνοισι live in the midst of plenty, E. Fr. 1063.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., retire, desist from, ὀχῆς Arat. 1069.
Nonn. D. 1.181, Hsch.
aor. inf. ἀναστῦψαι S. Fr. 421.
reassessment of war-tax levied on property, Poll. 6.179, Suid.
reassess war-tax, Hyp. Fr. 151.
hiss shrilly, Orph. A. 995 (tm.).
lewd woman, Hippon. 110.

pull up, δοκόν Procop. Goth. 4.11; anotherʼs clothes, D.L. 2.110; expose to view, τὴν ἀκρασίαν Clearch. 14:— Med., pull up oneʼs clothes, expose oneʼs person, Hdt. 2.60, Thphr. Char. 11.2, D.S. 1.85, etc.; ἀνασυράμεναι τοὺς χιτωνίσκους Plu. Mul.virt. 2.248b: pf. part. Pass. as Adj., ἀνασεσυρμένος obscene, Anacr. ap. Phot. p. 123 R.; lacking in decency, Thphr. Char. 6.2.
Pass. also, of Alexanderʼs hair, to be curly, Ael. VH 12.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., plunder, ravage, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.330d, cf. Hsch.
struggle violently, Hsch.
rise from a fall or illness, recover, συμπτώματος ἀνασφῆλαι Pl. Ax. 364c; ἐκ τῆς νόσου Nic.Dam. p.98D., cf. Babr. 75.9; νόσου καὶ πόνων Id. 78.3, cf. D.Chr. 34.5; ἐκ κακῶν Luc. Abd. 32: abs., J. l.c.
recovery, Vett.Val. 285.20.
tighten with wedges, Apollod. Poliorc. 159.6.
bind tight up, ἵππον χαλινῷ Nonn. D. 42.51: aor. 1 part. -σφίξας IG 12(2).11 ( Mytilene).

definition: ἀνασχεθέειν, ἀνασχεθεῖν, inf. of the poet. aor. 2 of ἀνέχω.

children.definition: holding up, lifting up, προβοσκίδος, of an elephant, Plu. Sollert. 2.972b.
holding in suspense, τῶν δεινῶν Id. Num. 13.
ἀ. ἡλίου rising of the sun, Arist. Mu. 393b2 (pl.).
enduring, patient, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.31a.

endurable, Thgn. 119: mostly with negat., ουʼ γὰρ ἔτʼ ἀνσχετὰ ἔργα τετεύχαται Od. 2.63; πεσεῖν . . πτώματʼ οὐκ ἀ. A. Pr. 919; θρέμματʼ ούκ ἀ. Id. Th. 182; so with a question expecting a negative answer, S. Ph. 987: οὐκ ἀ. [ἐστι], c. acc. et inf., Hdt. 1.207, cf. 3.81, 8.142; ζῆν γὰρ κακῶς κλύουσαν οὐκ ἀ. S. Tr. 721, cf. OC 1652; οὐκ ἀ. ποιεῖσθαί τι Hdt. 7.163: abs., οὐκέτι ἀ. ἐποιοῦντο Th. 1.118.

data.quote: ουʼ γὰρ ἔτʼ ἀνσχετὰ ἔργα τετεύχαται
ζῆν γὰρ κακῶς κλύουσαν οὐκ ἀ.

children.definition: rip up, τοῦ λαγοῦ τὴν γαστέρα Hdt. 1.123, cf. 124, 3.35; τὰς κυούσας Arist. EN 1148b20; δερμα ὀνύχεσσι Theoc. 25.277, cf. IG 4.952.32 (Epid.); plough up, νῶτον γᾶς Pi. P. 4.228 (tm.):— Pass., τρίβος -όμενος track opened up, Plu. Symp. 2.161f.
Pl. R. 362a; cf. ἀνασκινδυλεύω.
ripping open, Gal. 14.675.

definition: ἀνασῴζω, fut. -ώσω: pf. ἀνασέσωικεν IG 12(5).1061.9 ( Ceos, iii B.C.): aor. ἀνέσωισε ib. 1004.5 ( Ios, iv/iii B.C.), cf. OGI 56.11:—

children.definition: recover what is lost, rescue, ἀπὸ φόνου ἔρρυτο κἀνέσωσέ μʼ S. OT 1351 (lyr.); ἀ. φίλον ἀλλοιωφέντα Arist. EN 1165b22:—more freq. in Med., ἀνασῴζεσθαί τινα φόνου rescue from death, S. El. 1133; ἀνασωσάμενός μοι δὸς . . Σάμον Hdt. 3.140:—but Hdt. commonly uses the Med. in the proper sense, ἀ. τὴν ἀρχήν recover it for oneself, 1.82, 106, etc.; in 3.65 he joins Act. and Med., μὴ ἀνασωσαμένοισι δὲ τὴν ἀρχὴν μηδʼ ἐπιχειρήσασι ἀνασῴζειν :— Pass., to be restored, recover, Pl. Phlb. 32e; return safe, εἰς Κατάνην Lys. 20.24; ἀνασωθῆναι ἐς τὰς πατρίδας, of exiles, X. HG 4.8.28; ἐκ φυγῆς Plb. 18.27.2, al.
preserve in mind, remember, Hdt. 6.65.
heap up, in Pass., Plb. 8.33.5.
preservation, Tz. ad Lyc. 1297.
reduce to sobriety, in Pass., Hsch. s.v. ἄμπνυτο.
Nic. Th. 695.
assessors, title of financial board at Miletus, OGI 213 (ca. 300 B.C.), SIG 577.19, etc.
Call. Jov. 30, IG 14.1015, APl. 16.101:— Med., ἀνὰ χεῖρα τανύσσατο A.R. 1.344.
financial estimate, assessment, SIG 577.21.
stir up the mud, Arist. HA 620b16:— Pass., οὖρα ἀνατεταραγμένα thick urine, Hp. Aph. 4.70, cf. Epid. 1.4.4 [1.26.δʹ].

children.label: II
children.definition: rouse to frenzy, S. Tr. 218; confound, Pl. Phd. 88c:— Pass., ἀνατεταραγμένος πορεύεσθαι march in disorder, X. An. 1.7.20.
extension, εἰς ὕψος Plb. 5.44.3, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: height, J. BJ 6.9.1; ἀ. ὀρῶν Phlp. in Mete. 37.10.
stretching out, Hp. Art. 11; ἀκοντίων Onos. 17: metaph., threats of violence, Plb. 4.4.7, Fr. 108 (pl.); μετὰ ἀ. καὶ ἀπειλῆς Epict. Fr. 25, cf. D.S. 38.8.
intensity, inflexibility, τοῦ φρονήματος Plu. Mar. 6; intensity of passion, Phld. Lib. p.29O.: abs., courage, steadfastness, prob in D.Chr. 34.40.
endurance of hunger, fasting, Sor. 1.49, Plu. Adul. 2.62a.
ἀ. τῆς βοῆς straining, Sch. E. Or. 149; κατʼ ἀνάτασιν of the acute accent, D.T. 620.1.
straining, effort, Phld. Rh. 1.31 S., al.; ἡ πρὸς τὸ ἓν διαγνώσεως ἀ. Dam. Pr. 27, cf. Procl. Inst. 21, al.: c. gen., τιμῆς Procop.Gaz. Pan. 496.4.

data.quote: ἡ πρὸς τὸ ἓν διαγνώσεως ἀ.

definition: ἀνατάσσω, Att. ἀνα-τάττω, aor. 2 Pass. ἀνετάγην,

children.definition: countermand expenditure, D.C. 78.18 ( Pass.):— Med., go regularly through again, rehearse, Plu. Sollert. 2.968c; set in order, διήγησιν Ev.Luc. 1.1.
threatening, Plb. 5.43.5, D.S. 5.31. Adv. -κῶς Plb. 4.4.7.
lift up, χεῖρας ἀ., in swearing, Pi. O. 7.65; also in prayer, Id. I. 6(5).41; εὐξόμεθʼ . . ἀνατείνοντες τὼ χεῖρʼ Ar. Av. 623; as token of assent in voting, X. An. 5.6.33, etc.

stretch forth, so as to threaten, τὴν μάχαιραν ἀνατεταμένος X. Cyr. 4.1.3:— Med. (with aor. 1 Pass.), οὐδὲ Πολυδεύκεος βία χεῖρας ἀντείναιτʼ ἂν ἐναντίον αὐτῷ Simon. 8; οὐδὲν ἂν ὑμῖν εἶχε ἀνατείνασθαι φοβερόν hold out any alarming threat, D. 19.153: abs., threaten, Plb. 5.55.1: c. dat., 4.82.8: c. fut. inf., 4.18.10.

data.quote: οὐδὲ Πολυδεύκεος βία χεῖρας ἀντείναιτʼ ἂν ἐναντίον αὐτῷ

children.definition: hold up, offer as a prize, Pi. N. 8.25 ( Pass.).
present a document to a magistrate, BGU 613.3 (ii A.D.).
lift up, exalt, κῦδός τινος Pi. N. 8.34; ἀνατείνασθαι ἀρχήν strain or augment its force, Plu. Cleom. 10.
lift up, κάρα Pi. N. 1.43; ἑαυτόν Ael. NA 3.21; ἀ. τὰς ὀφρῦς pucker, Luc. Tim. 54.
strain to a high pitch, Arist. Pr. 920b20 ( Pass.).
excite, τινά Plu. Adul. 2.60c:— Pass., Phld. Lib. p.44O.; of the soul, etc., ἐς ἀμέθεκτον αἰτίαν Procl. Inst. 100, cf. 23.

children.label: II
children.definition: spread out, expand, e.g. a line of battle, τὰ κέρατα X. Cyr. 7.1.6, cf. ib. 23; ἀετὸς ἐπὶ δόρατος ἀνατεταμένος spread eagle, ib. 4; ἀ. ἱστία πρὸς ζυγόν Pi. N. 5.51:— Pass., to be distended upwards, Ti.Locr. 102a; extend, εἰς ὕψος Plb. 9.21.10.

children.label: III
children.definition: hold out, persevere, esp. in abstinence from food, Sor. 1.56, Arr. Epict. 2.17.9.

children.label: IV
children.definition: reach up, stretch up, πέδιλα ἐς γόνυ ἀνατείνοντα Hdt. 7.67.

extend, stretch out, ὄρος . . ἀ. ἐς τὴν Οἴτην Hdt. 7.176, cf. 8.107, Arist. HA 524b19, Epicur. Nat. 11.5, Inscr.Prien. 37.160, 42.69: metaph. in Pass., πρὸς ἄφρονας ταῦτʼ ἀ. these things only reach or affect foolish people, Phld. Herc. 1251.12.
rebuild, τείχη X. HG 4.4.18:—in Med., build up, τὸ ταπεινότατον J. BJ 5.5.1.
rebuilding of walls, X. HG 4.8.9.

definition: ἀνατέλλω, poet. ἀντ-, aor. ἀνέτειλα: pf. part. ἀνατεταλκός Plb. 9.15.10:—

children.definition: make to rise up, τοῖσιν δʼ (sc. ἵπποις) ἀμβροσίην ἀνέτειλε νέμεσθαι Il. 5.777; Αἴγυπτος . . Δήμητρος ἀντέλλει στάχυν A. Fr. 300, cf. LXX Ge. 3.18; ὕδωρ ἀ. make water gush forth, Pi. I. 6(5).75; τὸν ἥλιον Ev.Matt. 5.45:—so in Pass., φλὸξ ἀνατελλομένα a flame mounting up, Pi. I. 4(3).83.
bring forth, give birth to ἄντειλας Διόνυσον ib. ib. 7(6).5; ἰούλους A.R. 2.44: of events, μυρίʼ ἀπʼ αἰσχρῶν ἀνατέλλοντα S. Ph. 1139.

children.label: II
children.definition: rise, appear above the horizon, of any heavenly body, as sun and moon, Hdt. 2.142, S. OC 1246, Ar. Nu. 754; πρὸς ἠῶ τε καὶ ἥλιον ἀνατέλλοντα Hdt. 1.204, 4.40; also of constellations, A.R. 3.959; ἠὼς ἀντ. Id. 2.1007; dist. from ἐπιτέλλω (q.v.), Ptol. Alm. 8.4; cf. ἀνατολή.

data.quote: πρὸς ἠῶ τε καὶ ἥλιον ἀνατέλλοντα

children.label: b
children.definition: Theoc. 13.25.
take its rise, ἐκ ταύτης [γῆς λίμνης] Hdt. 4.52, cf. Ael. NA 14.16, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: originate, ἐξ Ἰούδα ἀνατέταλκεν ὁ κύριος Ep.Hebr. 7.14.
grow, of hair, ταρφὺς ἀντέλλουσα θρίξ A. Th. 535; of teeth, Arist. HA 501b29; spring up, of plants, Thphr. HP 3.1.6, al.; cf. ἀνατολή II.
rise, A.R. 1.501; but, appear on the horizon, ib. 601.
rise up, ἀνέτειλε σωτήρ prob. in Epigr.Gr. 978 ( Philae).
cut up, cut open, νεκρόν Hdt. 2.87, cf. Luc. Prom. 21.
dissect, Hp. Ep. 17, Arist. Spir. 478a21.
open up, clear, ὁδούς, αὔλακας, Ph. 1.16, 20; ὁδὸν καινήν OGI 701 ( Egypt).

children.label: II
children.definition: cut off, κλήματα Aeschin. 3.166; γεισηπόδισμα IG 2(2).463.63.

definition: ἀνατεταμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀνατείνω,

children.definition: stretched or strained to the utmost Sch. Ar. Ra. 1282.
melt: metaph., relax, τὸ σῶμα ἡδοναῖς Plu. Sanit. 2.136b:— Pass., of snow, thaw, Plb. 2.16.9.
melting, thawing, Plb. 9.43.5.
without harm, with impunity, A. Eu. 59, S. Ant. 485, E. Med. 1357, Pl. Lg. 871e, prob. in Th. 8.67, cf. Is. Fr. 2, D.S. 20.58, etc. (Spelling ἀνατεί attested by Hdn. Epim. 256.)

lay upon, once in Hom., ἐλεγχείην ἀναθήσει μοι Il. 22.100; ἀ. ἄχθος lay on as a burden, Ar. Eq. 1056 (hex.), cf. X. An. 3.1.30; κινδύνους ἰδιώταις ἀ. Hyp. Eux. 9: in good sense, ἀ. κῦδός τινι Pi. O. 5.8.

children.label: b
children.definition: Med., put on board ship, IG 5(1).1421 ( Cyparissia).

refer, attribute, a thing to a person, μεγάλα οἱ χρήματα ἀ. Hdt. 2.135; οὐ γὰρ ἄν οἱ πυραμίδα ἀνέθεσαν ποιήσασθαι would not have attributed to her the erection of the pyramid, ib. 134; φοίβῳ τήνδʼ ἀναθήσω πρᾶξιν E. El. 1296; εἰμή, ὅταν . . εὖ πράξητε, ἐμοὶ ἀναθήσετε will give me the credit of it, Th. 2.64; οὐ τῷ συμβούλῳ τὴν τοῦ κατορθοῦν ἀνέθηκε δύναμιν D. 18.290; ἀ. τινὶ τὴν αἰτίαν τινός Isoc. 1.37, Aeschin. 2.10; also, compare, τινὰ εἴς τι Eun. Hist. p.261 D.

data.quote: οὐ τῷ συμβούλῳ τὴν τοῦ κατορθοῦν ἀνέθηκε δύναμιν

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀ. τινὶ ἅπαντα πράγματα lay them upon him, entrust them to him, Ar. Nu. 1453, Th. 8.82.

children.label: II
children.definition: set up as a votive gift, dedicate, τινί τι Hes. Op. 658, Pi. O. 3.30, Hdt. 2.159, 7.54, Ar. Pl. 1089, etc.; Ῥήνειαν ἀνέθηκε τῷ Ἀπόλλωνι Th. 1.13; ἀνάθημα ἀνατιθέναι Hdt. 1.53, 2.182; ἀ. τι ἐς Δελφούς Id. 1.92, 2.135, 182, Pl. Phdr. 235d, etc.; less freq. ἐν Δελφοῖς Theopomp.Com. 1 D., Plu. Sol. 25; dedicate a book, Id. Sull. 6; ἀ. τινά set up a statue of . ., SIG 420 ( Delos, iii B.C.); incorrectly of burial, OGI 602 ( Jaffa):— Pass., ἀνατεθῆναι Ar. Eq. 849; cf. ἀνάκειμαι.
set up, erect, [ στήλην] παρὰ βωμόν, νεών, Plb. 5.93.10, Plu. Publ. 14: metaph., dedicate, μακραγορίαν λύρᾳ Pi. P. 8.29; ἀ. τὰς ἀκοὰς τοῖς ἀκροάμασι give them up to, Plb. 23.5.9.
set up and leave in a place, ἀ. τινὰ ἐπὶ κρημνόν Ar. Pl. 69; ἀ. ζῶντα (on a cross) Plb. 1.86.6.

children.label: III
children.definition: put back, τί γὰρ παρʼ ἦμαρ ἡμέρα τέρπειν ἔχει, προσθεῖσα κἀναθεῖσα τοῦ γε κατθανεῖν; pushing us forward or moving us back on the verge of death, S. Aj. 476; cf. B.ΙΙ.2.

children.label: B
children.definition: Med., put upon for oneself, ἀναθέσθαι τὰ σκεύη ἐπὶ τὰ ὑποζύγια X. An. 2.2.4; pack on oneʼs cart, Lys. 7.19; τοῖς ὤμοις ἀ. τινά put on oneʼs shoulders, Plu. Sollert. 2.983b; freq. like Act., ἀ. τινὰ ἐφʼ ἵππον Id. Art. 11, etc.

data.quote: ἀναθέσθαι τὰ σκεύη ἐπὶ τὰ ὑποζύγια

children.definition: impart, communicate something oneʼs own, τινί τι Act.Ap. 25.14, Ep.Gal. 2.2, Plu. Amat.narr. 2.772d.
remit, refer, ἀ. περί τινος εἰς σύγκλητον refer the consideration of it to the Senate, Plb. 21.46.11, cf. App. Sam. 4.

children.label: II
children.definition: place differently, change about, e.g. the men on a draught-board, ἀνὰ πάντα τιθεσθαι v.l. in Orac. ap. Hdt. 8.77.

take back a move at πεττοί, Pl. Hipparch. 229e: hence metaph., retract oneʼs opinion, X. Mem. 1.2.44, cf. 2.4.4; freq. in Pl., ἀνατίθεσθαι ὅ τι δοκεῖ Pl. Grg. 462a, cf. Prt. 354e. Chrm. 164d; οὐκ ἀνατίθεμαι μὴ οὐ . . retract and say this is not so, Id. Phd. 87a; οὐκ ἀ. μὴ οὐ καλὼς λέγεσθαι Id. Men. 89d; ἀνατιθέμενος τὸ διημαρτημένον Luc. Pseudol. 29.

data.quote: οὐκ ἀ. μὴ οὐ καλὼς λέγεσθαι

children.definition: bring forth again, Ael. NA 1.17, Hsch.
raise in price, Hdt. 9.33; ἀ. ἑαυτόν D.C. 38.5:— Med., Poll. 3.125.
shaking violently, LXX Na. 2.10(11).
shake up and down, brandish, θύρσον E. Ba. 80 (lyr., tm.): also of the wind shaking about a sail, Id. Or. 341 (tm.), cf. Gal. 14.638.
brandish, τόξα Musae. 17 (tm.), cf. Opp. H. 2.90.
bore through, bore, Dsc. 1.66 ( Pass.), Trypho Fr. 112 V. ( Pass.); part. ἀνατιτράς, -άντος, Gal. UP 16.11, etc., Orib. 46.11.10.
sufferance, Suid.

definition: ἀνατλῆναι, inf. of ἀνέτλην, aor. with no pres.: fut. ἀνατλήσομαι: also aor. 1 ἀνέτλησα Orac. ap. Lact. Inst. 4:—

children.definition: bear up against, endure, κήδεʼ ἀνέτλης Od. 14.47; ὀϊζύος ἣν ἀνέτλημεν 3.104; φάρμακʼ ἀνέτλη, i.e. resisted the strength of the magic drink, 10.327; πολύθρηνον αἰῶνα . . ἀνατλᾶσα A. Ag. 716; πατέρα . . οὐκ ἀνέτλατε S. OC 239, etc.; πόλλʼ ἀνατλάς Ar. Pax 1035; τὴν εἱμαρμένην Pl. Tht. 169c; τὰ προσήκοντα πάθη Id. Grg. 525a: c. part., ἀνέτλην μογέουσα IG 14.1960.
aor. 2 part. Pass. ἀνατμηγείς Marc.Sid. 85.
fit for cutting up, Sm. Ps. 54(55).22.
evaporate, Democr. ap. Ath. Epit. lib. ii 89 (vol.i p.281 Schw.).
roll from side to side, esp. of sailors in a storm: metaph., Arr. Epict. 3.12.7; διατοιχέω is preferred by Phryn. 139, Poll. 1.114.
compound interest, Cic. Att. 5.21.11, CIL 10.3334.30 ( Puteoli, iii A. D.).
eastwards, LXX Nu. 10.5 (dub.).

rising above the horizon, of any heavenly body, e.g. the sun, freq. in pl., ἀντολαὶ ἠελίοιο Od. 12.4, E. Ph. 504:—also in sg., ἀπʼ ἀνατολᾶς ἁλίου ἄχρι δύσεως IG 4.606; δύσεώς τε καὶ ἀνατολῆς ἡλίου καὶ τῶν ἄλλων ἄστρων Pl. Plt. 269a, cf. Lg. 807e; dist. from ἐπιτολή (q.v.), Gem. 13.3.

data.quote: δύσεώς τε καὶ ἀνατολῆς ἡλίου καὶ τῶν ἄλλων ἄστρων

children.definition: A. Pr. 457, Ag. 7; περὶ Ὠρίωνος ἀνατολήν Arist. Mete. 361b23; ἀπὸ Πλειάδος ἀ. Id. HA 599b11.

the quarter of sunrise, east, opp. δύσις, freq. in pl., ἀπὸ ἡλίου ἀνατολέων Hdt. 4.8; ἡλίου πρὸς ἀντολάς A. Pr. 707; without ἡλίου, πρὸς ἀνατολάς Thphr. HP 9.15.2, Mon.Anc.Gr. 14.12; πρὸς τὰς ἀ. Plb. 2.14.4; ἀπὸ ἀνατολῶν LXX Nu. 23.7, Ev.Matt. 2.1, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: ascendant, i.e. the point where the eastern horizon cuts the zodiac, Ptol. Tetr. 20.

children.label: c
children.definition: 150 distant from sun, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).204, Paul.Al. G. 3.
sources of a river, Plb. 2.17.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: growing, of the teeth, Arist. HA 501b28; of the white at the root of the nails, Poll. 2.146: pl., ἀγρὸς ἀνατολὰς καὶ βλάστας ἔχει Ph. 1.68, cf. LXX Je. 23.5, al.
eastern, ἡμισφαίριον Str. 2.3.2; στοά J. AJ 20.9.7, al.; θάλασσα Epicur. Fr. 346b: Comp., Str. 2.1.27, Marin. Procl. 36: Sup., Marcian. Peripl. 1.6, al.
ἀνατολικοί, οἱ, = Orientales, title of a numerus, PFlor. 278V1 (iii A.D.).
ἀ. χρόνος time occupied in rising, Gem. 7.18, Ptol. Alm. 2.11; ἀ. φάσεις Ptol. Tetr. 99; but ἀ. σελήνη waxing moon, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.77, Ptol. Tetr. 116.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἀνατολικόν, τό, = κλύμενον, of a flower opening at sunrise, Ps.- Dsc. 4.13.
= foreg., ἄρουρα Nonn. D. 25.98.
regain oneʼs courage, Plu. Luc. 31, Ant. 50; f.l. in E. Alc. 277.
dissection, αἱ ἀ., title of a treatise freq. cited by Arist., as HA 509b22, al., cf. Thphr. HP 1.1.4; ἡ τἀνθρωπίνου σκήνους ἀ. Longin. 32.5, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.246 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. καὶ διαιρέσεις Arist. APo. 98a2.
relating to anatomy, ἀ. ἐγχείρησις, title of work by Galen; skilled in anatomy, ἄνδρες Gal. 4.555. Adv. -κῶς Id. 18(2).927.
stretching upwards, Vitr. 10.10.6.
unharmed, B. Fr. 19 (cj.); Λοξίου κότῳ A. Ag. 1211; κακῶν ἄνατος harmed by no ills, S. OC 786, where the Laur.Ms. ἄναιτος.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not harming, harmless, A. Supp. 356, 359, 410.
immune from punishment, Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1920.76 ( Crete, vi/v B.C.). Adv. -τως with impunity, IG 9(1).333 ( Locr.). (Contr. fr. ἀνάατος, q.v.)
one must overthrow, refute, Luc. Herm. 49, Gal. 4.620.
one must go back, return, Orib. Fr. 142.

turning upside down, upsetting, ἐπιτήδευμα . . πόλεως ὥσπερ νεὼς ἀ. Pl. R. 389d; στομάχου Dsc. 2.70; of the pulse (dub. sens.), Gal. 8.928, cf. 644; οἱ ἀ. διάλογοι Platoʼs refutative dialogues, as ‘Euthydemus’ and ‘Gorgias’, Thrasyll. ap. D.L. 3.59, cf. Hermog. Meth. 10.

definition: ἀνατρέπω, poet. ἀντρ-, Aeol. aor. ὀνέτροπε Alc. Supp. 25.7: pf. -τέτροφα S. Tr. 1009, And. 1.131, later -τέτρᾰφα Din. 1.30 codd., v.l. in D. 18.296, Aeschin. 1.190, 3.158: aor. 2 Med. ἀνετράπετο in pass. sense, Il. 6.64, 14.447 (only here in Hom.), Pl. Cra. 395d, Theoc. 8.90: aor. 2 Pass., Alex. 76.3, etc.:—

children.definition: overturn, upset, Act., Archil. 56.3, Alc. l.c.; τράπεζαν D. 19.198, cf. Sch.ad eund. 24.136; in Hom. ἀνετράπετο, = ὕπτιος ἔπεσεν, Il. 6.64; ἀνατετραμμένος Ar. Ra. 543; freq. of ships, Pl. Lg. 906e, Arist. Rh. 1398b7, etc.; ἂν ἀνατραπῆ γὰρ πλοῖον Alex. l.c.; τὴν σωφροσύνην, τὸν βίον ἅπαντα And. 1.131, cf. Plu. Pomp. 46.

children.label: b
children.definition: upset, στόμαχον Gal. 12.911: so abs., create nausea, Aristaenet. 1.12.

overthrow, ruin, πρόρριζον ἀνατρέψαι τινά Hdt. 1.32, cf. 8.62; μὴ . . δαίμων . . ἀντρέψῃ ποδὶ ὄλβον A. Pers. 163; λακπάτητον ἀ. χαράν S. Ant. 1275; πλοῦτον And. 1.131; πόλιν Ar. V. 671; πολιτείαν, οἰκίαν, Pl. Lg. 709a, R. 471b; τὰ τῶν Ἑλλήνων D. 18.143:— Pass., ἤρυξε πόλιν μἀνατραπῆναι A. Th. 1082; ὁ βίος ἀνατετραμμένος ἂν εἴη Pl. Grg. 481c, etc.
upset in argument, refute, Ar. Nu. 901; ἀ. πρόβλημα Alex.Aphr. in Top. 514.28.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be upset, disheartened, ἀνετράπετο φρένα λύπᾳ Theoc. 8.90; ταῖς ψυχαῖς ἀ. Plb. 21.25.8.
to be checked in, diverted from, ὁρμήν J. BJ 2.15.6; τὴν φιλαργυρίαν 2.14.6.
to be turned back, εἰς χώραν Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.68.
to be made null and void, Just. Nov. 2.2 Intr.

children.label: III
children.definition: stir up, arouse, ἀνατέτροφας ὅ τι καὶ μύσῃ S. Tr. 1009:— Pass., of the sea in a storm, Arist. HA 600a4, etc.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Act., slip, trip up, Plu. QConv. 2.631c; of a ship, capsize, D.Chr. 34.32.

bring up, cherish, educate, A. Eu. 523, Ev.Luc. 4.16, al.; ἀ. τὸ φρόνημα raise the spirit, X. Cyr. 5.2.34:— Med., ἀναθρέψασθαι υἱόν have him educated, Hdn. 1.2.1; ἀ. λειμὼν κάλλεα Nic. Fr. 74.58:— Pass., grow up, ἀνατραφῆναι ἐν . . Plu. Cam. 34, etc.; τῇ Ἑλλάδι φωνῇ Ael. NA 11.25; ἀνέτραφες in AP 5.156 ( Mel.) = ἀνετράφης.
feed up, opp. ἰσχναίνω, Hp. Art. 33, 50: metaph., ἀ. μονῳδίαις Ar. Ra. 944:— Pass., ἀνατρέφεσθαι ἐκ νόσου convalesce, Hp. VM 14; of fish after milting, Arist. HA 608a2.

definition: ἀνατρέχω, fut. -δραμοῦμαι Luc. Ind. 4, poet. 3 sg. -δράμεται AP 9.575 ( Phil.): aor. -έδραμον (v. infr.); aor. subj. Med. ἀναδράμηται Hp. Ep. 19 ( Hermes 53.69):—

children.definition: run back, ὁ μὲν αὖθις ἀνέδραμε Il. 16.813, cf. 11.354; ἀνά τʼ ἔδραμʼ ὀπίσσω 5.599; return, of the sea, Plu. Aet. phys. 2.915a; εἰς τὰς ἐξ ἀρχῆς τάξεις Plb. 2.67.6; εἰς τὴν ἑαυτοῦ φύσιν Plu. Pel. 31; εἰς τὴν προϋπάρχουσαν φιλίαν D.S. 20.59; of property, revert, ἐπί τινα Just. Nov. 7.4; in writing, recur to a point, ἐπί τι Plb. 5.40.4: abs., ἀ. τοῖς χρόνοις 1.12.6, al.
retrace, traverse, κῦδος ἀνέδραμον ὕμνῳ Pi. O. 8.54, cf. Semon. 10; undo, ἁμαρτιαν Men. 15D.; ἀ. τὴν τῆς φύσεως ἐλάττωσιν make amends for, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.2c, cf. Luc. Ind. 4.
revert, ἐπὶ τοὺς λόγους, τὴν ὕλην, Plot. 5.8.1; return to source, of light, 4.5.7; run back to (logically), ἐπὶ τὴν κοινοτάτην αἰτίαν Phld. D. 1.16, cf. Plot. 6.1.30.
have recourse to, ἐπὶ . . Luc. Abd. 11, al., Eun. Hist. p.251 D.

children.label: II
children.definition: jump up and run, start up, of men, ἀναδραμὼν ἔθεε Hdt. 3.36; ἐκ τῆς κοίτης, ἐκ τοῦ θρόνου, Id. 7.15, 212; πρὸς τὰ μετέωρα Th. 3.89, cf. X. HG 4.4.4.

ἐγκεφαλος δὲ . . ἀνέδραμεν ἐξ ὠτειλῆς the brains spurted up from the wound, Il. 17.297; σμώδιγγες . . ἀνέδραμον weals started up under the blow, 23.717; slip up, Gal. 18(1).829; run or spread over, τὸ πάθος ἀ. ἐπὶ τὴν χεῖρα Plu. Sollert. 2.978c; ἔρευθος ἀ. Call. Lav.Pall. 27.

data.quote: τὸ πάθος ἀ. ἐπὶ τὴν χεῖρα

children.definition: run up, shoot up, of plants, ὁ δʼ ἀνέδραμεν ἔρνεϊ ἶσος Il. 18.56, cf. Hdt. 8.55: hence, of cities and peoples, shoot up, rise quickly, ἀνά τʼ ἔδραμον καὶ εὐθενήθησαν Hdt. 1.66, cf. 7.156; ἀ. εἰς ἀξίωμα Plu. Publ. 21; ἀ. τοῖς βίοις, ταῖς ἐλπίσι, D.S. 5.12, 18.20; ἀ. ἡ πολυτέλεια increased, Plu. Mar. 34.
λίσση δʼ ἀναδέδρομε πέτρη the rock ran sheer up, Od. 5.412.
soar aloft, of digression to a nobler theme, ἀνέδραμε πρὸς τὴν ἐν οὐρανῷ λύραν Anon. in SE 40.23.

data.quote: ἀνέδραμε πρὸς τὴν ἐν οὐρανῷ λύραν

children.definition: turning upside down, Arist. Mete. 368a32.
refutation, Phld. Sign. 11.
perforation, Ph. Bel. 57.16; trepanning, Plu. Cat.Ma. 9, Leonid. ap. Aët. 15.12.
hole bored, Plu. Sollert. 2.968b.
bored through, ἐμβάδες Suid.
shake as with a trident, Amphis 14.8.
reckoned at 300 a head, Michel 731.20 ( Ilium).
education, τὰ τῆς ἀ., opp. τὰ τοῦ βίου, Ps.- Ptol. Centil. 224.
rub, chafe, τὸν ὦμον Hp. Art. 9:— Med., Id. Vict. 3.83; massage oneself, Aristid. Or. 47(23).18, cf. 50, al.:— Pass., sens. obsc., Ar. Ach. 1149.
rub clean, κύνας X. Cyn. 6.26.
Med., ἐλαίῳ ὕδωρ συμμείξας ἀ. rub oneself down, Arist. Pr. 881a5.
Pass., to be worn away, Hdt. 3.113.
chirp aloud, of cranes, Q.S. 13.107 (al. -τρύζω).
repeat a third time, Syr. in Metaph. 61.8 ( Pass.).
one must chafe, Archig. ap. Orib. 44.26.9.
rubbed up: ἀ. ἱμάτια cloths with rough, raised pile, like plush or velvet, Dsc. 3.33.
have oneʼs hair grow again, Suid.
with hair bristling backwards, Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.13.
grow fresh hair, Cleopatra ap. Gal. 12.405.
chafing, friction, Hp. Art. 9, Gal. 6.92.
overturner, destroyer, τοῦ οἴκου Antipho 2.2.2; τῆς νεότητος Plu. Lib.educ. 2.5b; subverter, τῶν ἐν ἀνθρώποις νομιζομένων D.Chr. 37.32.
capsizing, [ τοῦ πλοίου] Arist. Metaph. 1013b14.
overthrow, ruin, ἀνατροπαὶ δωμάτων, οἴκων, A. Eu. 355, Pl. Prt. 325c; ἀ. βίων Clearch. 10.
pouring out, of drink, LXX Hg. 2.15.
upsetting, στομάχου Sor. 1.27, Asclep.Jun. ap. Gal. 13.140; ἀ. ναυτιώδεις Plu. Virt.mor. 2.442f.
refutation, Str. 2.1.22, Hermog. Prog. 5.
annulment, Just. Nov. 2.2 Intr.; undoing, ἐπʼ -ῇ τῆς νοήσεως τοῦ θεοῦ Phld. D. 3.7.
raising of body, Cass.Fel. 82.
turn back, AB 312.
nurturer, Ps.-Callisth. 1.13.
education, Aphth. Prog. 8; rearing, nurture, D.H. Rh. 5.3, Plu. Cons.ux. 2.608c, Arr. Cyn. 29, Artem. 1.16, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: feeding, diet, ἡ ἐκ ζῴων ἀ. Porph. Abst. 3.17.

children.label: III
children.definition: cultivation, Gp. 4.12.11, 9.14.5.
Ph.Byz. Mir. 1.4.
running backwards, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.22.8.
glean grapes off again, τοὺς ἀμπελῶνας Ph. 2.390.
alien to the Attic dialect, Phryn. ap. St.Byz. s.v. Ἀθῆναι.
unroll, βιβλία Luc. Ind. 16: metaph., ἀ. τοὺς λόγους πρὸς ἑαυτόν Id. Nigr. 7.
describe, represent, Philostr. VA 1.19, cf. Her. 2.19 ( Pass.):— Med., form an image of a thing, imagine, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.329b, 331d; represent in writing, εἰς ἐπιστολάς Philostr. VA 1.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: remodel, transform, τὴν ἀνθρωπίνην περὶ τοῦ δαιμονίου δόξαν D.Chr. 12.26, cf. Antim. 81.

data.quote: τὴν ἀνθρωπίνην περὶ τοῦ δαιμονίου δόξαν

children.definition: τύπτω, τὴν κεφαλήν J. AJ 17.7.1.
mental image, Stoic. 1.214.
Hsch.
representing, Simp. in Epict. p.20D.
stir up, confound, Ar. Eq. 310.
rayless, sunless, Ἅιδης A. Pr. 1028.
uplift the voice, PMag.Par. 1.2532.
speechless, Epicr. 11.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: = sq., Hsch.
not to be spoken, unutterable: hence, horrible, ἀναυδάτῳ μένει A. Th. 897 (lyr.); ἄφατον ἀναύδητον λόγον E. Ion 783.
unspoken, impossible, οὐδὲν ἀναύδατον φατίσαιμʼ ἄν S. Aj. 715 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: speechless, Id. Tr. 968 (cj.).
speechlessness, Hp. Coac. 353, Mul. 2.126; lethargy, Antigen. ap. Cael.Aur. AP 2.10.

speechless, Od. 5.456, 10.378, Hes. Th. 797, etc.; silent, ἄ. ἄγγελος, of dust, A. Th. 82 (lyr.), etc.:—properly, unable to articulate, whereas ἄφωνος is voiceless, Hp. Epid. 3.17.γʹ, but of fishes, A. Pers. 577; without speaking, S. OC 1274, 1404, Plu. Pomp. 74, etc. Adv. -δως Hp. Prorrh. 1.90, J. AJ 16.11.4.
preventing speech, silencing, χαλινῶν ἄ. μένος A. Ag. 238 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: unspeakable, horrible, ἔργον S. Aj. 947.
without passage-money, Suid.
without the flute, κῶμος -ότατος a procession unaccompanied by flutes, i.e. joyless, E. Ph. 791; ἔρωτες Plu. Pyth. 2.406a: neut. pl. as Adv., ἄναυλα ὀρχεῖσθαι Babr. 9.9; θύειν Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.277f.
unmusical, μέλη βοῶν ἄναυλα (as Bgk. for ἄναυδα) S. Fr. 699.

children.label: II
children.definition: unskilled in flute-playing, Luc. Halc. 7.
weary of its stall, χοῖρος dub. in Herod. 8.7.
not brought to haven, Lyc. 745.
without sea-fight, ὄλεθρος ἀ. loss of a fleet without striking a blow, Lys. ap. D.H. Lys. 14.
indictment of a trierarch for keeping his ship out of action, ἀ. ὀφλεῖν And. 1.74.
increase, in Pass., PBaden 39iii16 (ii A.D.).
not increasing, Thphr. CP 4.6.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: not waxing or growing, Hp. Art. 53, Mochl. 24, al., Arist. HA 569a30, Cael. 270a13.
omission of the augment, Greg.Cor. 180.
Arist. Cael. 270a25, Sor. 1.47 ( Comp.), Aq. Je. 22.30; μορφαὶ ἀ. πυρός dub.l. in Theodect. 17.
without augment, Eust. 19.29. Adv. -τως Greg.Cor. 180.
defect in growth, Hp. Art. 52 (v.l. ἀναυξήσιος); written ἀναύξ-εια in Ath.Med. ap. Orib. inc. 21.1.
Plu. Sollert. 2.981f.

definition: ἄναυος, ον, etym. of Att. ἄνεως, A.D. Adv. 145.4, cf. Eust. 387.44.

children.definition: without air, windless, still, Hsch.

definition: Ἄναυρος, ὁ, river in Thessaly, Hes. Sc. 477, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄναυρος, ὁ, mountain-torrent, Mosch. 2.31, Nic. Al. 235, Lyc. 1424, IG 14.1089, etc. (Orig. pr. n., cf. Ἀχελῷος of any river.)

definition: ἄναυς, gen. ἄνᾱος, ὁ, ἡ, only A. Pers. 680 in nom. pl., νᾶες ἄναες

children.definition: that are ships no more.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄν-αυτα : παραχρῆμα ( Tarent.), Id. (cf. πάραυτα).
shout aloud, Opp. C. 4.301: c. acc., κρυπτὸν ἀνηύτησεν ἔπος Nonn. D. 10.288, cf. Coluth. 85.
not to be cultivated by the lessor in person, PTeb. 378.29 (iii A.D.).
without neck or throat, Emp. 57.
aor. ἀνήυσα, Dor. ἀνάϋσα Theoc. 4.37, A.R. 4.75.

definition: ἀναφαία ἡ θερμοπότις παρὰ Κρησίν, Ath. 11.783f.
ἀναφαίνω, poet. ἀμφ-: fut. -φᾰνῶ, but -φᾱνῶ E. Ba. 528 codd. ( -φαίνω Herm.): aor. ἀνέφηνα, Hellenistic -έφᾱνα: pf. -πέφηνα late, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 3:—

children.definition: cause to give light, make to blaze up, ξύλα, δαΐδας Od. 18.310.
bring to light, produce, ὄφιας Hdt. 4.105.

children.label: b
children.definition: show forth, make known, display, θεοπροπίας, ἀρετήν, ἐπεσβολίας, Il. 1.87, 20.411, Od. 4.159; πραπίδων καρπόν Pi. Fr. 211; κἀνέφηνεν οὐ δεδειγμένα S. Fr. 432.7; ἀ. θυσίας E. IT 466; ὀργάν Id. Ba. 538; ἄστρα X. Mem. 4.3.4; ἡμέρᾳ καὶ ἡλίῳ . . χάριν οἶδα ὅτι μοι Κλεινίαν ἀ. Id. Smp. 4.12; rarely of sound, βοὰν ἀμφ. send forth a loud cry, A. Supp. 829; ἀ. μελέων νόμους Ar. Av. 745:—in Med., νίκαν ἀνεφάνατο Pi. I. 4(3).71.

data.quote: ἡμέρᾳ καὶ ἡλίῳ . . χάριν οἶδα ὅτι μοι Κλεινίαν ἀ.

children.definition: proclaim, declare, βασιλέα ἀ. τινά Id. P. 4.62; νικάσαις ἀνέφανε Κυράναν ib. 9.73, cf. N. 9.12: c. part., τοὺς πολίτας ἀγαθοὺς ὄντας ἀ. Pl. Criti. 108c: c. inf., ἀναφαίνω σε τόδε . . ὀνομάζειν I proclaim that they call thee by this name, E. Ba. 528:— Med., in Dor. form ἀμφ-, adopt as oneʼs son, Leg.Gort. 10.34, al.

children.label: b
children.definition: appoint, institute, ὃς τελετὰς ἀνέφηνε καὶ ὄργια IG 3.713, cf. Marm.Par. 28; νῆσον ἀ. τινὶ οἰκεῖν Philostr. Her. 19.16.
ἀναφάναντες τὴν Κύπρον having sighted . ., Act. Ap. 21.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., fut. ἀναφᾰνήσομαι Ar. Eq. 950, Pl. Prm. 132a, al.; but also -φανοῦμαι Id. Plt. 289c: pf. ἀναπέφασμαι, but -πέφηνα Hdt. (v. infr.), etc.: aor. ἀνεφᾰνην Ar. V. 124:— to be shown forth, appear plainly, ἀναφαίνεται ἀστήρ Il. 11.62; ἀ. αἰπὺς ὄλεθρος ib. 174; τῇ δεκάτῃ . . ἀνεφαίνετο πατρὶς ἄρουρα Od. 10.29; τὸ Δέλτα ἐστὶ νεωστὶ ἀναπεφηνός Hdt. 2.15, cf. S. OC 1222 (lyr.), etc.; ἀ. ὁ βλάπτων A. Ch. 328.

children.label: b
children.definition: reappear, Hdt. 4.195; of rivers which flow underground, Id. 6.76, 7.30; simply, spring up, ib. 198.

ἀναφανῆναι μούναρχος to be declared king, Id. 3.82; στρατηγὸς ἀ. Pl. Ion 541e; κλέπτης τις ὁ δίκαιος . . ἀναπέφανται proved to be . ., Id. R. 334a, cf. Smp. 185a; ἀ. λογογράφος ἐκ τριηράρχου from a sea-captain to come out a romancer, Aeschin. 3.173:—also c. part., ἀναπέφανται ὢν ἀγαθός Pl. R. 350c; ἀναφαίνεσθαι ἔχων, σεσωσμένοι, to be seen or found to have, to be plainly in safety, etc., Id. Sph. 233c, X. Cyr. 3.2.15, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act. intr. in later Greek, ἀνέφαινεν ἕσπερος Musae. 111 (v.l.), cf. Hld. 5.22:— ἀναφῆναι is prob.f.l. for ἀναφανῆναι in Hdt. 1.165.

not to be taken away, Men. Mon. 2, D.H. 8.74, D.Chr. 31.22; χάρις POxy. 273.15 (i A.D.); ὠφέλεια Just. Nov. 68 Pr.; inseparable, opp. accidental, Stoic. 2.214 (? Diog.Bab.); not diminished by subtraction, Theol.Ar. 30. Adv. -ως PFlor. 47a4 (iii A.D.), Just. Nov. 2.3 Intr.
forehead-bald, PPetr. 3p.9, Procl. Par.Ptol. 203, BGU 998, al.

definition: ἀναφαλαντιαῖος, = foreg., dub. in Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.112.8.
ἀναφαλαντίας, ου, ὁ, = foreg., Luc. Tim. 47, al., Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(2).58.27, etc.:—also ἀναφαλ-ανθίας, Phryn. PS p.124B. (cod.).

children.definition: forehead-baldness, Arist. HA 518a28.
forehead-bald, LXX Le. 13.41, freq. in Pap., PPar. 5.1.5 (ii B.C.), etc.:— ἀναφάλ-ανθος, PPetr. 1p.54 (iii B.C.), etc.
forehead-baldness, LXX Le. 13.42.
visibly, openly, before the eyes of all, opp. κρύβδην, Od. 3.221, 11.455: as neut. Adj., A.R. 4.84.

definition: ἀναφανδόν, Adv. = foreg., Il. 16.178, Hdt. 2.35, 46, Pl. Prt. 348e, etc.: poet. ἀμφανδόν Pi. P. 9.41.

children.definition: appearance, Anon. in Ptol. Tetr. 5.
Hsch.

definition: ἀναφέρω, poet. ἀμφ-, fut. ἀνοίσω: aor. ἀνήνεγκα, Ion. ἀνήνεικα, also inf. ἀνοῖσαι Hdt. 1.157:

children.label: I
children.definition: bring, carry up, [Κέρβερον] ἐξ Ἀΐδαο Od. 11.625; ἐκ τῆς ἰλύος ψῆγμα ἀ. χρυσοῦ Hdt. 4.195, cf. 3.102 (as v.l. for -φορέω) ; ἀ. τινὰ εἰς Ὄλυμπον, εἰς θεούς, X. Smp. 8.30 ( Pass.), Plu. Rom. 28, etc.; in histor. writers, carry up the country, esp. into Central Asia, Hdt. 6.30; raise up, εἰς τὸ ἄνω Hp. Art. 37; ἀ. πόδα lift it, E. Ph. 1410:— Med., carry up to a place of safety, take with one, Hdt. 3.148; remove oneʼs goods, 8.32, 36, etc.

data.quote: ἐκ τῆς ἰλύος ψῆγμα ἀ. χρυσοῦ

children.label: b
children.definition: carry up to the Acropolis, put by, of treasure, And. 3.7, X. Vect. 5.12, Aeschin. 2.174, etc.

bring up, pour forth, of tears, ἑτοιμότερα γέλωτος ἀ. λίβη A. Ch. 447; αἵματος πλῆθος ἀ. spit up, Plu. Cleom. 15; ἀ. φωνάς, στεναγμούς, Id. Def.orac. 2.433c, Alex. 52:— Med., ἀνενείκασθαι, abs., fetch up a deep-drawn breath, heave a deep sigh, μνησάμενος δʼ ἁδινῶς ἀνενείκατο Il. 19.314; ἀνενεικάμενόν τε καὶ ἀναστενάξαντα Hdt. 1.86 (where others, having recovered himself, come to himself, v. infr. II.7): in Alex. Poets, utter, ἀνενείκατο μῦθον, φωνήν, A.R. 3.463, 635.
uphold, take upon one, ἄχθος A. Ch. 841; κινδύνους Th. 3.38; διαβολάς, πόλεμον, etc., Plb. 1.36.3, 4.45.9, etc.; πολλῶν ἀ. ἁμαρτίας LXX Is. 53.12, Ep.Hebr. 9.28.
offer in sacrifice, ib. 7.27, 13.15, etc.: abs., make expiation or compensation, GDI 3537, al. ( Cnidus).
raise up, yield, ἀρχαῖαι ἀρεταὶ ἀμφέροντʼ ἀνδρῶν σθένος Pi. N. 11.38.
lead up, of a road, ἁμαξιτὸς εἰς τὸν Πειραιᾶ ἀ. X. HG 2.4.10, cf. Plb. 8.29.1, Inscr.Prien. 37.161.

children.label: II
children.definition: bring or carry back, εἰς τοὔπισθεν ἀ. πόδα E. Ph. 1410: freq. in Prose, ἀ. τὰς κώπας recover the oars (after pulling them through the water), Th. 2.84; ἡ εἰρεσία ἀναφέρεται Plu. Demetr. 53, Ant. 26.
bring back tidings, report, παρά τινα Hdt. 1.47; ἔς τινα Id. 1.91, Th. 5.28, etc.; τὰ ἐκ τῆς ἐκκλησίας ἀνενεγκόντες Decr. ap. D. 18.75:— Pass., Hdt. 1.141, al.
bring back from exile, Th. 5.16.
carry back, trace oneʼs family to an ancestor, τὸ Ἡρακλέους γένος εἰς Περσέα ἀναφέρεται Pl. Alc. 1.120e; without γένος, ἀ. εἰς Ἡρακλέα Id. Tht. 175a.

data.quote: τὸ Ἡρακλέους γένος εἰς Περσέα ἀναφέρεται

children.definition: refer a matter to another, βουλεύματα ἐς τὸ κοινόν Hdt. 3.80; ἐς ἀφανὲς τὸν μῦθον ἀ. Id. 2.23; ἁμαρτίαν εἴς τινα ἀ. ascribe E. Or. 76, Ba. 29, etc.; τῆς κηλῖδος εἰς ὑμᾶς -ομένης Antipho 3.3.11; τὴν αἰτίαν εἴς τινα Lys. 22.8; rarely ἀ. τί τινι E. Or. 432, Lys. 12.81; τι ἐπί τινα D. 18.224, Aeschin. 3.215; τι ἐπί τι Pl. Phd. 76d; τι πρός τι Arist. EN 1101b19 ( Pass.), al.; ποῖ δίκην ἀνοίσομεν; to whom shall we refer the judgement? E. Ion 253; τὴν ἀπόδοσιν εἴς τινα D. 34.46:— Pass., to be attributed (of authorship), εἰς Μητρόδωρον Phld. Herc. 1005.8; to be traced to, derived from, ἐπί τι ib. 1251.11.
Pass., refer to, of a statement, πρός τι Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 127.8.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀ. εἴς τινα refer or appeal to another, make reference to him, Hdt. 3.71, Pl. Ap. 20e; ἔς τινα περί τινος Hdt. 1.157, 7.149; ἀ. πρός τι refer to something as to a standard, Hp. VM 9; ἐκεῖσε ἀ. Pl. R. 484c, cf. Phdr. 237d.

children.label: c
children.definition: report, μέτρα καὶ γειτνίας καὶ ἀξίας PTeb. 14.11 (ii B.C.), etc.:— Pass., ib. 10.3 (ii B.C.): abs., make a report, τινί PRyl. 233.8 (ii A.D.), PFay. 129.8 (iii A.D.).

bring back, restore, πόλιν ἐκ πονήρων πραγμάτων Th. 8.97; ἀ. ἑαυτόν Ael. NA 13.12:— Pass., come to oneself, recover, μόγις δὴ τότε ἀνενειχθεὶς εἶπε (v. supr. Ι.2) Hdt. 1.116; ἄφωνος ἐγένετο, ἔπειτα πάλιν ἀνηνέχθη Theopomp.Com. 66:—so,

children.label: b
children.definition: Act., come to oneself, recover, τῷ πόματι ἀνέφερον (sc. ἑαυτούς) Hdt. 3.22, cf. Hp. Aph. 2.43, D. 16.31; ἐκ τραύματος D.H. 4.67; ἐξ ὕπνων Plu. Cam. 23; ἀνέφερέ τις ἐλπὶς ἀμυδρά revived, Id. Alc. 38; ἐκ τοσούτων κυμάτων ἀνενεγκών Eun. Hist. p.227 D.
bring into account, εἰς τὸ κοινόν D. 41.8, cf. 11, Philonid. 1 D.; πρὸς ἣν [ἀρχὴν] αἱ πρόσοδοι ἀναφέρονται Arist. Pol. 1321b32.
pay over, εἰς τὸ βασιλικόν PHib. 50.2, cf. 42.5.
call to mind, consider, Pl. Lg. 829e: also c. gen., App. Pun. 93, 112.
repeat, Pl. Ti. 26a.
recall a likeness, ἀ. πρὸς ἀνδριάντα τὴν ὁμοιότητα τῆς ἰδέας Plu. Brut. 1, cf. Adul. 2.53d.

data.quote: ἀ. πρὸς ἀνδριάντα τὴν ὁμοιότητα τῆς ἰδέας

children.definition: flee up, X. An. 6.4.24, Plu. Crass. 29, al.: c. acc., fly to, Philostr. VA 1.24.
escape, X. HG 6.5.40, cf. 2.3.50: metaph., retreat, εἰς τὴν ἀνείδεον φύσιν Plot. 6.7.28.
to be lost in tracing, Plu. Aem. 25.
given to flight, Str. 15.1.29.
fleeing away, D.C. 75.6.
impalpable, Pl. Phdr. 247c, Epicur. Ep. 1p.6U., Plu. QConv. 2.721c, etc.; ἀρεταί Ph. 1.689. Adv. -φῶς Iamb. Myst. 3.31, 5.4, Procl. in Cra. p.37 P., Dam. Pr. 339.

children.label: II
children.definition: tasteless, insipid, Plu. QConv. 2.650b (al. ἀβαφής).
call out aloud, Ph. 1.74, al., Plu. Thes. 24, Caes. 46, etc.: c. acc., Plb. 18.5.6; λόγιον Ph. 2.177.
utterance, Phld. D. 3.14 (pl.), Ph. 1.661.
mode of utterance, λύπη καὶ φόβος ἰδίας ἀναφθέγξεις ἔχουσιν Ph. 1.618, cf. Diog.Oen.10.

definition: ἀναφθείρομαι, Pass., κατὰ τί δεῦρʼ ἀνεφθάρης;

children.definition: by what ill luck came you hither? Ar. Av. 916, cf. Cratin. 13 D.; cf. φθείρω.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be frustrated, PTeb. 24.32.

definition: ἀναφλᾶ λάχανον φέρει ἄνθος, ὡς ἡ μαλάχη καὶ τὸ ἄνηθον, Hsch.

children.definition: masturbation, Eup. 61.
masturbari, Luc. Peregr. 17: pf. part. Pass. -πεφλασμένος Ar. Lys. 1099
inflame, Plu. Ant. 82, cf. Gal. 18(1).73.
light up, rekindle, E. Tr. 320 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: inflame, ἐπιθυμίαν Ph. 2.48; ἔρωτα Plu. Alc. 17:— Pass., to be inflamed with anger, Pl. Ep. 349a; ἐξ ὑποψίας Conon 23.1; to be inflamed, Ἔρωτος τραῦμα AP 12.80 ( Mel.); to be excited, ὑπʼ ὀργῆς Plu. Praec. 2.798f; ὑπὸ λιμοῦ Ael. NA 15.2; ἀ. τὴν ψυχήν Plu. Dio 4; δίψος ἀναφλέγεται Id. Ant. 47, etc.; διανοίας ὑπὸ φιλοτιμίας ἀναφλεγομένης Jul. Or. 2.83c.
lighting up, Plu. Lys. 12.
Call. Epigr.inc. 2, AP 12.127 ( Mel.).
bubble, boil up, ἀνὰ δʼ ἔφλυε καλὰ ῥέεθρα Il. 21.361: also in Prose, PHolm. 25.26.
frighten away, Ar. V. 670.
blush, redden, Lib. Ep. 225.
go back, Nic. Th. 138.
coming up, rising, ἀ. ποιεῖσθαι rise, Arist. HA 622b7; of vapours or exhalations, Placit. 3.7.4, Theol.Ar. 31, cf. Orib. 9.16.3, etc.
ascent of a sign measured in degrees of the equator, Ptol. Tetr. 134.

children.label: b
children.definition: κέντρον, Vett.Val. 19.18.

children.label: c
children.definition: ascendant, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).100; opp. ἀπόκλιμα, Serapion in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.99, S.E. M. 5.20, etc.

children.label: d
children.definition: rising of a sign, Ach.Tat. Intr.Arat. 39.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀναφέρω) carrying back, reference of a thing to a standard, διὰ τὸ γίνεσθαι ἐπαίνους διʼ ἀναφορᾶς Arist. EN 1101b20; in Law, recourse, ἐκείνοις εἶναι εἰς τοὺς ἔχοντας ἀναφοράν D. 24.13: abs., Thphr. Char. 8.5 (pl.), IG 5(1).1390.111 ( Andania, i B.C.); ἡ ἀ. ἐστι πρός τι Arist. Cat. 5b20, al.; ἀ. ἔχειν πρός or ἐπί τι to be referable to . ., Epicur. Fr. 409, Plb. 4.28.3, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.290e, al.; ἀ. τινος γίγνεται πρός or ἐπί τι, Plb. 1.3.4, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1071a; ἐπʼ ἀναφορᾷ τῇ πρὸς τὸν δῆμον BCH 46.312 ( Teos); ἀ. ἔχειν ἐπί τι, of writings, refer to, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 4.1; τούτων εἰς Κυναίγειρον ποιήσασθαι τὴν ἀναφοράν assign to, give credit for . ., Polem. Call. 23.

data.quote: διὰ τὸ γίνεσθαι ἐπαίνους διʼ ἀναφορᾶς
ἐκείνοις εἶναι εἰς τοὺς ἔχοντας ἀναφοράν
ἐπʼ ἀναφορᾷ τῇ πρὸς τὸν δῆμον

children.definition: way of retreat, ὑπέλιπε ἑαυτῷ ἀναφοράν D. 18.219; νῦν δὲ αὑτοῖς μὲν κατέλιπον τὴν εἰς τὸ ἀφανὲς ἀναφοράν Aeschin. 2.104, cf. Plb. 15.8.13, etc.

data.quote: νῦν δὲ αὑτοῖς μὲν κατέλιπον τὴν εἰς τὸ ἀφανὲς ἀναφοράν

children.definition: means of repairing a fault, defeat, etc., ἀλλʼ ἔστιν ἡμῖν ἀ. τῆς ξυμφορᾶς E. Or. 414; ἀ. ἁμαρτήματος ἔχειν way to atone for . ., Plu. Phoc. 2; ἀ. ἔχειν means of recovery, Id. Fab. 14.

data.quote: ἀλλʼ ἔστιν ἡμῖν ἀ. τῆς ξυμφορᾶς

children.definition: offering, LXX Ps. 50(51).21; ἡ ἀ. τοῦ πνεύματος τοῦ λεκτικοῦ PMag.Par. 2.281.

data.quote: ἡ ἀ. τοῦ πνεύματος τοῦ λεκτικοῦ

children.definition: report, PLond. 1.17.34 (ii B.C.), etc.
petition, PRyl. 119.28 (i A.D.).
payment on account, instalment, OGI 225 ( Milet.), PEleph. 14.26 (iii B.C.), PRev.Laws 16.10 (iii B.C.), etc.
repetition of a word, Longin. 20.1, Demetr. Eloc. 141.
office of ἀναφορεύς, LXX Nu. 4.6, 10.
πέψις, Aret. SD 2.7.

children.label: III
children.definition: ceiling of a wine-press, Gp. 6.1.3.
bearer, bearing-pole, LXX Ex. 25.12(13) sq., al.

definition: ἀναφορητικός, ή, όν, = sq. II, of consumption with empyema, Cael.Aur. TP 2.18.

children.definition: standing in relation: in Gramm., relative. Adv. -κῶς relatively, A.D. Pron. 5.20, al., D.T. 636.12; with a reference, Stob. 2.6.6, Gal. 18(1).504.

children.label: II
children.definition: bringing up blood, phlegm, Dsc. 2.171, cf. Eup. 2.39, Androm. ap. Gal. 13.31.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀναφορικόν, τό, treatise by Hypsicles on the ascension of stars; ἀ. πραγματεῖαι Ptol. Alm. 8.6.
Dim. of ἀναφορά, petition, proposal, etc., BGU 1123.3, POxy. 294.13, etc.
play a prelude, Apollon. Lex. s.v. ἀνεβάλλετο.
Ar. Ra. 8, Ec. 833, Fr. 559, cf. Phryn. PS p.15 B.

definition: ἀναφορύσσω, Ion. for ἀναφυράω, Hp. Mul. 1.53, 2.205, al.

children.definition: relate, describe, Eun. Hist. p.223 D.; Med., to be aware of, οὐλὴν ἀμφράσσαιτο Od. 19.391.
barricade again, block up, τὰς παρόδους dub. l. in Str. 4.3.5, cf. J. AJ 15.7.10:— Pass., LXX Ne. 4.7; λιμένες ἀνεφράγνυντο Them. Or. 7.91d.

children.label: II
children.definition: remove barriers, Hsch.
cover with foam, Phryn. PS p.46B.
bristle up, ἀκάνθαις with . ., Opp. H. 4.599; of hair, Poll. 2.25.
want of power to inspire love, lack of charm, Philostr. VA 8.7, Jul. Mis. 367b.

children.label: II
children.definition: insensibility to love, Gell. 19.9.9.
without Ἀφροδίτη, not enjoying her favours, Plu. Amat. 2.751e, etc.; ἀ. εἰς τὰ ἐρωτικά unlucky in . ., Luc. DDeor. 17[15].2; love-less, μίξεις D.Chr. 7.133.
insensible to love, Plu. Adul. 2.57d, Jul. Mis. 347c.
without charms, Plu. Ant. 4, Gell. 1.5.3, etc.
come back to oneʼs senses, X. An. 4.8.21, D.C. 60.14; ἀναφρονέων· ἀναλογιζόμενος, Hsch.
think over, c. inf., ἀ. γάμον σχεθέμεν meditate how to get, Pi. O. 1.69.
without froth, διαχωρήματα Hp. Hum. 4; αἷμα Aret. SA 2.2.
dry up, Lyd. Ost. 14.
escape, release from, ἀναφυγὰς κακῶν A. Ch. 943.

children.label: II
children.definition: place of retreat, Plu. Aem. 16.

children.label: III
children.definition: withdrawal, retraction, μήτρας Sor. 2.26.
springing up, growth, Sor. 1.87.
guard, prob. in Epic.Alex.Adesp. 9.2.19.
Pl. Lg. 713e.
mix up well, Hp. Mul. 2.157, Thphr. Od. 25; τέφραν μετʼ οἴνου ἀ. IG 14.966.8.
mix up, confound, τινάς τισι Them. Or. 21.260c:— Pass., ἀναμὶξ ἦν πάντα ὁμοίως ἀναπεφυρμένα Hdt. 1.103, cf. Epicur. Fr. 250, Metrod. 1.
defile, μάστιξι καὶ αἵματι ἀναπεφυρμένος Hdt. 3.157, cf. E. Ba. 742.
blow away, κέλυφος Hp. Mul. 1.78; blow up or forth, eject, ἀποσπάσματα ἀ., of volcanoes, Pl. Phd. 113b:— Pass., to be blown upwards, Arist. Mete. 367a16.
μυκτῆρι ἀ. blows upward, Id. HA 497b30; of whales, Id. PA 669a7; of Tritons, Philostr. Im. 1.25.
spray, sprinkle, οἴνῳ καὶ ἐλαίῳ Hippiatr. 10.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be puffed up, arrogant, X. Cyr. 7.2.23, HG 7.1.24.

children.label: III
children.definition: blow the flute, Ath. 8.351e; κύκνοι -ῶντες ἡδύ Philostr. Im. 1.11.
upward blast, eruption of wind or fire, as in volcanoes, Arist. Mete. 36- a15, Mu. 395a8, cf. Plb. 34.11.17, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: powder for inflation, Hippiatr. 98.
upward blast, of volcanoes, Arist. Mu. 395b21, Plb. 34.11.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: prelude in flute-playing, Hsch. s.v. γρόνθων, Eust. 1406.50.

children.label: III
children.definition: blowing a powder into the nostrils, Hippiatr. 98.
blown up, into, or upon, Eust. 1139.58.
fetch a deep-drawn breath. blow, of a dolphin, Hes. Sc. 211; ἀ. ἆσθμα A.R. 2.431.
growing again, κεράτων Ael. NA 12.18.
draw water: aor. ἀνήφῠσα Nonn. D. 43.31.
plant or sow again, Arist. Mir. 838b29.

definition: ἀναφύω, aor. Pass. ἀνεφύην LXX 1 Ki. 5.6, part. -φυείς Chor. in Rev.Phil. 1.75:—

children.definition: produce again, ὅμοια κέρατα Arist. HA 611b1; πτιλὰ νεαρά Ael. NA 12.4; generally, let grow, πώγωνα Theoc. 10.40; foster, ὄφιν A.R. 2.1209; πλῆθος συκοφαντῶν, ἐπιθυμίας, Plu. Arist. 26, Arat. 49, etc.
produce vegetation, Arist. Fr. 252.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with aor. 2 -έφυν and pf. -πέφυκα, grow up, Pherecyd. 22 (a) J., Hdt. 4.58, Pl. Plt. 272a, etc.; ἢν γὰρ ἀποθάνῃ εἷς τις πονηρός, δύʼ ἀνέφυσαν ῥήτορες Pl.Com. 186; ἀναφύονταί τινι διαβολαί, δίκαι, Plu. Thes. 17, Per. 37.

data.quote: ἢν γὰρ ἀποθάνῃ εἷς τις πονηρός, δύʼ ἀνέφυσαν ῥήτορες

children.definition: grow again, of the hair, Hdt. 5.35.
recover, make a fresh start, Aeschin. 2.177.

children.label: III
children.definition: pres. -φύει, Phlp. in de An. 195.12.

call aloud, shout, Plb. 3.33.4, LXX 1 Ch. 15.28, al., Ev.Luc. 1.42; exercise the voice, Aret. CD 1.3: esp. practise the voice by declaiming, Plu. Sanit. 2.130c; τὰ πρός τι ἀναπεφωνημένα declamations upon . ., ib. Aud.poet. 30e.
proclaim, βασιλέα Id. Demetr. 18: c. dat., decree, τοῦ ἀναπεφωνημένου Νουμηνίῳ στεφάνου PFay. 14.2.
ἀ. τὴν ἐλευθερίαν claim liberty, Artem. 1.58, cf. Plu. Cic. 27.
utterance, Arist. Mu. 400a18, Plu. Cor. 32; of any utterance, c. acc., Epicur. Ep. 1p.24U., cf. p.27 U.
invoke, in Pass., Dam. Pr. 125 (quater).
crying aloud, Anon. in Rh. 190.22.
acclamation, salutation, Plu. Pomp. 13, etc.
exclamation, Id. Mar. 19.
interjection, Heph. Poëm. 5.3.
vocal exercise, Sor. 1.49, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1071c, Aret. CD 2.7, 13.

children.label: II
children.definition: ejaculation, Plu. Brut. 24; utterance, τὰς πρώτας τῶν ὀνομάτων ἀ. Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.70; τὴν τῆς τέχνης ἀ. appellation, Phld. Rh. 1.75 S.

children.label: III
children.definition: αἱ ἀ., title of work by Epicurus, Id. Tr. p.89W.
nomenclator, Lyd. Mag. 3.8.
as an exclamation, Eust. 1044.53.
make to recoil, force back, found only in poet. aor. 1, οὐδʼ ἀνέχασσαν prob. in Pi. N. 10.69.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., ἀναχάζομαι, Ep. aor. ἀνεχασσάμην:— draw back, freq. in Il. of warriors, ἀλλ’ ἀναχασσάμενος λίθον εἵλετο 7.264, cf. 15.728, 16.819, 17.47, etc.; ἀναχασσάμενος νῆχον πάλιν giving way to the wave, Od. 7.280: c. gen., ἀ. ἠπείροιο draw back from . ., A.R. 4.1241; ἐπὶ πόδα ἀναχάζεσθαι retire slowly, of soldiers, X. Cyr. 7.1.34:— Act. in sense of Pass., Id. An. 4.1.16.
throw the mane back, rear up, ἀ. φόβῳ E. Rh. 786; κόμην ἀ. Hld. 2.36: metaph. of men, become restive, S. Fr. 179, Plu. Demetr. 34; θάλαττα ἀναχαιτίζουσα a turbulent sea, Philostr. Im. 2.17.

throw a rider, φυλάσσων μὴ ἀναχαιτίσειέ νιν, of a branch, E. Ba. 1072: metaph., overthrow, upset, ἔσφηλε κἀνεχαίτισεν Id. Hipp. 1232, cf. Tim. Pers. 18; ἀνεχαίτισε καὶ διέλυσε D. 2.9; ἀνακεχαίτικεν [ἡμᾶς], of wine, Anaxandr. 3; βίος -ισμένος Epicur. Sent.Vat. 57.
ἀ. τῶν πραγμάτων shake off the yoke of, retire from business, Plu. Ant. 21; ἀ. ἐκ . . 2.611f (cj.).

children.label: b
children.definition: lose, be disappointed of, ἑνὸς δὲ . . οὐκ ἀνεχαιτίσθην τῆς φιλίας one [sage] did not disappoint me, Harp.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).136.9 (s.v.l.).

children.label: II
children.definition: hold back by the hair: hence generally, check, τοῦ δρόμου τὸ ῥόθιον Luc. Lex. 15, cf. Procop. Goth. 4.18; restrain, ἐπιδρομάς Id. Aed. 2.11; πόλεμον Memn. 51; ἀ. [τὸ θυμικὸν] τῆς ἀλόγου ὁρμῆς Alex.Aphr. in Top. 372.17.
restraint, Jo.Sic. in Rh. 6.235 W.; τῆς τάσεως τῆς φωνῆς Anon. in Rh. 197.20.

definition: ἀναχαίτισμα, ατος, τό, = foreg., dub.l. in Plu. Cons.ux. 2.611f:—also ἀναχαιτ-ισμός, ὁ, = foreg., Lyd. Mag. 2.15,3.52.

children.definition: relaxation, πνεύματος Placit. 5.24.4, cf. Stoic. 2.215.
relaxing, ὑστέρας Dsc. 1.128.
relax, in Pass., Placit. 5.26.1, Plb. 6.23.11, cf. Gal. 19.537, Aspasia ap. Aët. 16.22.
ease, [νῆα] ἀγχαλάσας A.R. 2.585.
Hsch., Suid.
forge anew, τὰς πύλας Ps.-Callisth. 3.29.
scraping up, Apollod. Poliorc. 47.27.
= foreg., τῆς λεπίδος Plu. Sollert. 2.979c.
scrape up, Plu. Aet. phys. 2.913e; ἀὴρ ἀναχαράσσει ἰόν air causes the roughness of rust, Pyth. ib. 396a, cf. Cohib. 454c.

definition: ἀναχάσκω, only pres. and impf., Ar. Av. 502, Fr. 68, Luc. VH 2.1; poet. ἄγχασκε Pherecr. 196:—other tenses from pres. *ἀναχαίνω, fut. -χᾰνοῦμαι Hp. Superf. 29: aor. 2 ἀνέχᾰνον: pf. ἀνακέχηνα:—

children.definition: open the mouth, gape wide, ἀναχανὼν μέγα Ar. Eq. 641; στόμα ἀνακεχηνός Hp. Nat.Mul. 45.
Pass., to be puffed up, Arist. VV 1251b18.
delay, hinder, D.C. 38.13.
cough up, Hp. ap. Sch. Nic. Al. 81; expl. as = ἀναπνεῖ, Erot.

pour forth, ποταμούς Ph. 1.50; cause to overflow, θάλασσαν Opp. H. 2.33:— Pass., to be poured out, Anacr. 42; of floods, (Max.Tyr. 8.7; to be spread over a wide space, Arist. Pr. 944a27, Mu. 393a20, Arr. An. 6.18.5: metaph., of a rumour, Plu. Aem. 24.
relax, ἡ χάρις ἀναχεῖ τὴν ψυχήν Ph. 1.104; ἡ γνῶσις ἀναχεῖται εἰς ἀγνωσίαν is dissipated, dissolved, Dam. Pr. 29.
Med., aor. ἀναχέασθαι anoint oneself, Gal. Thras. 46.
clothe with a mantle, Nonn. D. 11.232.
warm up, Hp. Nat.Mul. 56, Arist. Pr. 889a8:— Pass., ib. 930b18.
warm up: metaph., refurbish, cj. in Phlp. in de An. 455.29 (codd. ἂν χλίζεσθαι).
get the first down, Ar. Ach. 791.
eruption, Αἴτνης Longin. 35.4; ἀναχοαί· πόροι, Hsch.
begin a choral dance, Ar. Th. 994: and c. acc. cogn., ἀ. θίασον, ὄργια, E. Ph. 1756, Ba. 482, al.
celebrate in the chorus, Βάκχιον ib. 1153.
οὐκ ἄν με . . ἀνεχόρευʼ Ἐρινύσι would not have scared me away by a band of Furies, Id. Or. 582.

children.label: II
children.definition: dance for joy, ἀνεχόρευσεν αἰθήρ Id. Ion 1079.

definition: ἀναχόω, ἀναχώννυμι, Luc. Lex. 2 (in dat. pl. of part. ἀναχοῦσι).

children.definition: use up, and so, make away with, destroy, v.l. in Th. 3.81, cf. D.C. 51.8; οἱ ἑαυτοὺς -χρώμενοι 58.16.
use, IG 5(1).1390.60 ( Andania, i B.C.).
cough up, D.L. 2.75:— Act. in Suid., Zonar.
coughing up, Hp. Prorrh. 1.6, Aret. SA 2.2, etc.
anoint, Dsc. Eup. 1.35.
to be an anachronism, Sch. E. Hipp. 231, Ph. 854, Eust. 1404.29:— Act. c. part., to be late in doing, ἀ. πέμποντες ἐπιστόλια PTeb. 413.14 (ii/iii A.D.).
anachronism, Sch. A. Pr. 846.
exchange of the quantity of two syllables, Eust. 1704.8.
regild, Ostr. 156, al.
colour anew, discolour, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.930f:— Pass., v.l. in Thphr. Sud. 12: metaph., to be defiled with, πολλαῖς γυναιξίν Eust. 122.26.
discolouring; taint, infection, Plu. Adul. 2.53c.
Dsc. 4.9 (dub., cf. ἀνάχυσις III).
expanse, ἀ. αἰθέριον Nicom. Harm. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Str. Chr. 7.45.
without chaff or husks, Ar. Fr. 56.
expansion, effusion, χολῆς Aret. SD 1.15; ἰκτεριώδης Sor. 1.48, cf. Ruf. Fr. 79.9; πύου Erasistr. ap. Gal. 8.318; τῶν εἰδῶν εἰς τὸ ὄν Simp. in Ph. 503.32: metaph., ἀ. ψυχῆς exhilaration, Ph. 2.187.

children.label: b
children.definition: exhalation, τοῦ ὠκεανοῦ (causing fogs) Prisc. p.341 D.
ἡ τῆς ἀσωτίας ἀ. excess of profligacy, 1 Ep.Pet. 4.4; τοῦ ἀλόγου πάθους Ph. 1.695; of enthusiasm, Metrod. Herc. 831.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: expanse of water, e.g. estuary, Str. 3.1.9: pl., ἀ. θαλάττης inundations, Max.Tyr. 38.3; ἀνάχυσιν λαμβανούσης τῆς θαλάσσης Ocell. 3.4.
dike, dam, Aristeas 301, Harp. s.v. ἄνδηρα; cf. ἀνάχωσμα.
throw up a mound, Eust. 652.30.
the throwing up a mound, Sch. A. Pers. 646, BGU 199, etc.
melting down, εἰκόνων Ephes. 2No.23.
smelt over again, Str. 9.1.23, cf. PHolm. 2.8, PLeid.X. 6.

heap up into a mound, κόνιν AP 7.537 ( Phan.):—in Pass., v.l. Th. 2.102 (for ἂν κεχῶσθαι) ; ἀ. ὁδόν raise a road by throwing down rubbish, D. 55.28, cf. PPetr. 2p.43 ( Pass., iii B.C.), 3p.111; τάφους Luc. Tox. 43.
raising of an embankment, PSI 5.488.13 (iii B.C.).
go back, πόλινδε ἂψ ἀναχωρήσουσιν Il. 10.210, cf. Od. 17.461.

children.label: b
children.definition: walk backwards, of oxen feeding, Hdt. 4.183.

Il., mostly, retire, withdraw from battle, ἀλλά σʼ ἔγωγʼ ἀναχωρήσαντα κελεύω ἐς πληθὺν ἰέναι Il. 17.30; τόφρʼ ἀναχωρείτω 11.189, cf. 4.305, 20.335, etc.: in Prose, μάχης οὔσης εἰς τοὐπίσω ἀ. Lys. 14.6; φυγῇ ἀ. Pl. Smp. 221a; generally, retire, withdraw, μεγάροιο μυχόνδε Od. 22.270; ὀπίσω ἀ. Hdt. 5.94, etc.; ἐς τοὔπισθεν Ar. Pl. 1208; ἀνεκεχωρήκεσαν they had retired or returned, Th. 8.15, cf. IG 9(1).334 ( Locr.): with Preps. denoting motion to or from, ἐς τὴν ἀκρόπολιν Hdt. 3.143; ἐπʼ οἴκου Th. 1.30; ὑπὸ Βοιωτῶν ἐς Ἀθήνας were forced by them to retire to . ., Hdt. 5.61; ἀπό Pl. Smp. l.c.

data.quote: ἀλλά σʼ ἔγωγʼ ἀναχωρήσαντα κελεύω ἐς πληθὺν ἰέναι

children.label: II
children.definition: come back or revert to the rightful heir, ἡ βασιληΐη ἀνεχώρησε ἐς τὸν παῖδα Hdt. 7.4; ἡ ποινὴ ἀ. εἰς ἡμᾶς Antipho 2.1.3, cf. Leg.Gort. 11.10.

data.quote: ἡ βασιληΐη ἀνεχώρησε ἐς τὸν παῖδα

children.label: III
children.definition: withdraw, retire, ἐξ αἰσθήσεων Pl. Phd. 83a; ἀ. ἐκ τῶν πραγμάτων retire from public life, from the world, Plb. 29.25.5, cf. Cic. Att. 9.4.2, Ev.Matt. 2.14, al.: abs., withdraw, retire, Pl. Smp. 175a, cf. Ar. Nu. 524; ἀνακεχωρηκυῖα χώρα inland spot, Thphr. HP 9.7.4; ἀ. ἀπὸ θαλάσσης Plb. 2.11.16; ἀνακεχωρηκός ῥῆμα, ὄνομα obsolete, D.H. Rh. 10.7; recondite, ἱστορία Phld. Rh. 1.157S.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Procop. Arc. 10.
strike, refuse to work, PTeb. 26.18, 41.4, al.; ἀνακεχωρηκότα σώματα ib. 5.6.
withdrawal, reflux, θαλάσσης Arist. Mu. 396a18.
retiring, retreat, Hdt. 9.22, Th. 1.12, al.; ἀ. ποιεῖσθαι, of a river, D.S. 1.10; of waves, ἐπιδρομαὶ καὶ -σεις Arist. Mu. 400a27; τοῦ ποταμοῦ PPetr. 2p.45 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: place or means of retreat, Th. 1.90, D. 19.41.

children.label: III
children.definition: return, Pl. Phlb. 32b.

children.label: IV
children.definition: absence, τὰ ὄντα ἐν -ήσει BGU 447.6 (ii A.D.), cf. PTeb. 353.6 (ii A.D.); retirement, μετὰ φίλων -ιν εὔσχολον Phld. Oec. p.64J.
one must withdraw, Pl. Cri. 51b.
one who has retired from the world, anchoret, Just. Nov. 5.3 (pl.), Rev.Épigr. 1.159 ( Egypt, vi A.D.).
disposed to retire; τὸ ἀ. Arr. Epict. 2.1.10.
make to go back or retire, X. Cyr. 7.1.41, An. 5.2.10; ἀγχωρίξαντες ( Dor.) τὸν ὅρον having drawn it back, Tab.Heracl. 1.56,59.
silted mound, Sch. Ar. Eq. 527.
touch up, work up, Phryn. PS p.12B., cf. Hsch.
tear up, open, Lyc. 343.
wipe up, σταγόνας ἐρίῳ Ctes. Fr. 57.28; δάκρυον Dsc. 4.64.
clean out, φρέαρ PLond. 1.131r631:— Pass., aor. ἀνεψήσθην BGU 530.17 (i A.D.).
cleaning out, φρέατος PLond. 3.1177.329 (ii A.D.).

definition: ἀναψησμός, ὁ, = foreg., λάκκου ib. PLond. 1.131r621 (i A.D.).

children.definition: retry, in Law, Just. Nov. 82.11.1:— Pass., ib. 113.1 Intr.
close search, τροφῆς Eust. 254.31; re-examination, retrial, Cod.Just. 7.62.35, cf. 12.37.19, Just. Nov. 82.12, al.
put to the vote again, Th. 6.14; propose to repeal, SIG 194 ( Amphipolis), cf. D.C. 39.39:— Med., vote anew, Pherecr. 47.

children.label: II
children.definition: reckon backwards, εἰς τοὐπίσω Porph. Plot. 2.
lighting up, kindling, D.H. 2.66; of stars, ἄ. καί σβέσις Epicur. Ep. 2p.39U.
make a noise, Hsch. s.v. ἀναρραθαγῆσαι.
refresher, πόνων from labours, E. Fr. 146.
cooling, Posidon. 72; exposure, ἑλκεος Hp. Fract. 25.
drying up, Str. 10.2.19.
relief, respite, LXX Ex. 8.15; κακῶν Jul. ad Them. 258c (5); καιροὶ -εως Act.Ap. 3.20.
coolness, Pl. Lg. 919a.
relief, respite, Id. Smp. 176a, PLond. 1.42.19 (ii B.C.); κακῶν from misery, E. Supp. 615; πόνων Id. Ion 1604.
ventilation, Pl. Ti. 84d, Arist. Fr. 219.

cool, refresh, ἀήτας Ὠκεανὸς ἀνίησιν ἀναψύχειν ἀνθρώπους Od. 4.568; ἀνέψυχον φίλον ἦτορ were reviving their spirit, Il. 13.84; ἕλκος ἀναψύχοντα 5.795; ἀ. φίλα γούνατα Hes. Op. 608; ἀ. βάτιν cool the feet in water, E. IA 421:— Pass., to be revived, refreshed, ἀνέψυχθεν φίλον ἦτορ Il. 10.575; of the body, Pl. Ti. 78e, cf. 70d; ὥστʼ ἀνεψύχης [ῠ] Amips. 13.
ναῦς ἀ. let the ships rest and get dry, Hdt. 7.59, X. HG 1.5.10; ἀ. τὸν ἱδρῶτα let it dry off, Plu. Sull. 29; ἀ. τὰς αὐλαίας dry them, Id. Them. 30:— Pass., to be dried up, Str. 10.2.19.
ἀ. πόνων τινά give him relief from toil, E. Hel. 1094; πολέων . . μεριμνέων Call. Hec. Fr. 260.7 Pf. [updated ref.]; ἀ. κακότητος ψυχάς Orph. Fr. 230: abs., 2 Ep.Ti. 1.16.
expose to air, κατὰ τὸ ἕλκος ἐῶσιν ἀνεψῦχθαι Hp. Fract. 25; cf. ἀναψύχειν· γυμνοῦν, Erot.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act. is also used intr., become cool, recover, revive, Diph. 81, AP 12.132 ( Mel.), Opp. H. 5.623; εὗρεν . . δρόμων ἀναψύχουσαν [τὴν ἔλαφον] Babr. 95.57; take relaxation, POxy. 1296.7 (iii A.D.).
gladiator, Lyd. Mag. 1.46.
SIG 141.11 ( Issa).

definition: ἁνδάνω [δᾰ], impf. ἥνδανον, Ep. ἑήνδανον, in Ion. Prose ἑάνδανον Hdt. 9.5 and 19 (in 7.172, 8.29, codd. give ἥνδανον): fut. ἁδήσω Id. 5.39: pf. ἅδηκα Hippon. 100, Locr. ϝεϝάδηκα (v. infr. II); ἕᾱδα A.R. 1.867; part. ἑαδώς Il. 9.173: aor. ἑᾰδον Hdt. 4.201, 6.106, cf. SIG 57.40; Ep. εὔᾰδον (i.e. ἔϝαδον) Il. 14.340, Od. 16.28; ἅδον [ᾰ] Il. 13.748; 3 sg. subj. ἅδῃ Hdt. 1.133, opt. ἅδοι Od. 20.327, inf. ἁδεῖν Il. 3.173, S. Ant. 89: Later, aor. 1 ἧσα Plot. 2.3.7:—

children.definition: please, delight, gratify, mostly Ion. and poet., used like ἥδομαι, except as to construction: mostly c. dat. pers., Od. 2.114, Pi. P. 1.29, Hdt. 5.39: also c. dupl. dat., Ἀγαμέμνονι ἥνδανε θυμῷ Il. 1.24, cf. Od. 16.28; εἴ σφωϊν κραδίη ἅδοι 20.327; Πηνελοπείῃ ἥνδανε μύθοισι pleased her with words, 16.398:—in ἁδόντα δʼ εἴη με τοῖς ἀγαθοῖς ὁμιλεῖν the dat. belongs both to the part. and to the inf., Pi. P. 2.96: abs., τοῖσι δὲ πᾶσιν ἑαδότα μῦθον ἔειπε Il. 9.173, Od. 18.422: c.acc., v. dub. in Thgn. 26, E. Or. 1607, both prob. corrupt readings.

data.quote: τοῖσι δὲ πᾶσιν ἑαδότα μῦθον ἔειπε

children.label: II
children.definition: Hdt. ἁνδάνει expresses the opinion of a body of people, οὔ σφι ἥνδανε ταῦτα 7.172, cf. 9.5; τοῖσι τὰ ἀμείνω ἑάνδανε 9.19: c. inf., τοῖσι μὲν ἕαδε βοηθέειν Ἀθηναίοισι 6.106, cf. 4.145, 153, 201; so ἐπεί νύ τοι εὔαδεν οὕτως (sc. ποιεῖν) Il. 17.647, cf. Od. 2.114:— τὰ ϝεϝαδηκότα quae placuerunt, IG 9(1).334 ( Locr.).

data.quote: ἐπεί νύ τοι εὔαδεν οὕτως (sc. ποιεῖν)

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., ἢν ἁνδάνηται Hp. Mul. 2.150; cf. τιμὴ δαίμοσιν ἁνδάνεται AP 10.7 ( Arch.). (Cf. Skt. svádati, Lat. suādeo, suāvis, O.E. swēte, etc.)

definition: ἀνδειράδες, αἱ, = ἄνδηρα, AB 394, cf. Hsch.
ἄνδεμα, ἀνδεσμός, ἀνδέχομαι, ἀνδέω, ἄνδημα, poet. for ἀναδ-.
ἄνδεργμα ὁ ἐπὶ τῆς τραγικῆς σκηνῆς παραγόμενος παράκοτος, Hsch.

children.definition: workman employed on dikes, PRyl. 157.15 (ii A.D.), PFlor. 369.9 (ii A.D.).

raised bank by the side of a river or ditch, dike, Mosch. 4.102: mostly in pl., ἄνδηρα, τά, Hyp. Fr. 113, Lyc. 629; Πακτωλοῦ χρυσέοισιν ἐπʼ ἀνδήροισι Call. Fr. 45 P., cf. Fr.anon. 110; τετμῆσθαι καθάπερ ἀνδήροις καὶ ὀχετοῖς Plu. QConv. 2.650c, cf. Luc. Lex. 2.
border, edge, of the sea, dub. in B. 1.54 (p.439J.); ἄ. θαλάσσης Opp. H. 4.319.
border for plants or flowers, Thphr. CP 3.15.4, Theoc. 5.93, AP 12.197 ( Strat.), Nic. Th. 576.

definition: ἀνδίκα ὁ βόλος ( ἀνδικλόβολος cod.), δίκη ἡ ἐξ ὑπαρχῆς δικαζομένη παρὰ Ταραντίνοις (i.e. ἀνδίκα

children.definition: Hsch.

definition: ἀνδίκτης, ου, ὁ, for ἀναδίκτης ( ἀναδικεῖν),

children.definition: catch of a mousetrap, Call. Fr. 233.

definition: ἄνδινος περίπατος, Hsch. ( ἀνδινός· περὶ παντός cod.).

children.definition: asunder, in twain, ἡ δʼ [κεφαλὴ] ἄνδιχα πᾶσα κεάσθη Il. 16.412; ἄνδιχα πάντα δάσασθαι 18.511; opp. ἀμμίγδην, Nic. Th. 912; far away, A.R. 4.31.
apart from, A.R. 1.908, 2.927; ἀλλήλων AP 5.4 (Stat. Flacc.):—hence ἀνδιχάζω, to be divided in opinion, of judges, IG 9(1).333 ( Locr.).
ἐν ἀνδοκείᾳ Ζωτικοῦ guaranteed by Zoticus, IG 14.423 ii 19: pl., ib. 422 iii ( Tauromenium).
officer in charge of ἀνδοκεῖαι, IG 14.2417.1.

definition: ἀνδραγαθέω, pf. ἠνδραγάθηκα D.S. 11.25: aor. -ησα Plb. 6.39.2: ( ἀνήρ, ἀγαθός):—

children.definition: ἀνδραγαθίζομαι, behave in a manly, upright manner, Id. 1.45.3, al., SIG 785.14 ( Chios), BGU 1207.11 (i B.C.), Onos. 34.2:— Pass., ἠνδραγαθημένα, opp. ἡμαρτημένα, Plu. Fab. 20.
brave, manly deed, Str. 1.2.8, Plu. Sert. 10, IG 14.951, Jul. Caes. 329c, etc.

definition: ἀνδραγάθησις, εως, ἡ, = sq., LXX 1 Ma. 5.56.

children.definition: bravery, manly virtue, Hdt. 1.99, 136, al., Th. 2.42; the character of an upright man, Ar. Pl. 191, Phryn.Com. 1; ἀνδραγαθίας ἑνεκα στεφχνοῦσθαι Hyp. Lyc. 6.
act uprightly, εἴ τις ἀπραγμοσύνη -ίζεται if any one thinks to sit at home and play the honest man, Th. 2.63; ἐκ τοῦ ἀκινδύνου ἀ. Id. 3.40, cf. Arist. VV 1250b4.
befitting a good man, Hp. Art. 78 ( Comp.).
spoils of a slain enemy, Il. 14.509.
throttler of men: executioner, Eust. 1833.54, 1858.57: ἄνδραχοι· δήμιος Hsch.
husbandʼs brother, brother-in-law, Suid.:—fem. ἀνδρ-αδέλφη, ἡ, husbandʼs sister, Eust. 392.2.
man by man, Od. 13.14, Cratin. 19, cf. Plu. Symp. 2.151e; ἀ. καθήμενος apart, A. Ag. 1595, cf. Hsch. ( -κάς perh. cognate with Skt. -śás in dviśás ‘two by two’, etc.)
a manʼs portion, Nic. Th. 643.

definition: ἀνδραποδήτοι οἱ σὺν ἀνδραπόδοις ἀποδημοῦντες, Hsch.

ἀνδραποδίζω, pres. Act. first in Alciphr. 3.40: Att. fut. -ῐῶ X. HG 2.2.20: aor. ἠνδραπόδισα Hdt., Th.:— Med., fut. ἀνδραποδιεῦμαι in pass. sense, Hdt. 6.17:— Pass., fut. ἀνδραποδισθήσομαι X. HG 2.2.14: aor. ἠνδραποδίσθην Lys. 2.57: pf. ἠνδραπόδισμαι Isoc. 17.14, part. ἀνδραποδισμένος Hdt. 6.119: ( ἀνδράποδον):—

children.definition: enslave, esp. of conquerors, sell the free men of a conquered place into slavery, Hdt. 1.151, Th. 1.98; παῖδας καὶ γυναῖκας Id. 3.36; πόλιν 6.62:— Pass., to be sold into slavery, Hdt. 6.106, 119, 8.29, X. HG 1.6.14, etc.; πόλις ὑπὸ τῶν βαρβάρων ἠνδραποδίσθη Lys. l.c.:— Med. also in act. sense, Hdt. 1.76, al., Th. 4.48, And. 3.22, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: kidnap, Pl. Grg. 508e, X. Mem. 4.2.14, Smp. 4.36.

children.label: III
children.definition: -ίζοντες ἀπὸ τοῦ φρονεῖν τοὺς νέους Alciphr. 3.40.

definition: ἀνδραπόδιον, τό, Dim. of ἀνδράποδον, Hyp. Fr. 227, Diph. 80, POxy. 1102.15 (ii A.D.).
ἀνδραπόδισις, εως, ἡ, = sq., X. Ap. 25.

children.definition: selling into slavery, enslaving, Th. 2.68, Isoc. 4.100, etc.; πατρίδος D. 1.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: kidnapping, whether of free men or other peopleʼs slaves, ὑπόδικος -ισμοῦ liable to action for kidnapping, Pl. Lg. 879a, 955a.
fitted for enslaving, Tz.ad Lyc. 784.

slave-dealer or kidnapper, Ar. Eq. 1030, Pl. 521, Lys. 10.10, etc., cf. Poll. 3.78; coupled with ἱερόσυλοι, τοιχωρύχοι, etc., Pl. R. 344b: metaph., ἀ. ἑαυτοῦ one who sells his own independence, X. Mem. 1.2.6.
ἡ-κή (sc. τέχνη) man-stealing, kidnapping, Pl. Sph. 222c. Adv., Sup. -ιστικώτατα Eup. 396.
slave-dealer, Is. Fr. 53 S., Luc. Ind. 24, Gal. UP 1.9.
slave-stealer, Men. 23 D.

one taken in war and sold as a slave, whether originally slave or free, captive, Hdt. 3.125, 129, 5.31, etc.: orig. dist. from δοῦλος, ὅσοι δὲ ἦσαν ξεῖνοί τε καὶ δοῦλοι . . ἐν ἀνδραπόδων λόγῳ ποιεύμενος εἶχε Id. 3.125; τὰ ἀ. πάντα, καὶ δοῦλα καὶ ἐλεύθερα Th. 8.28; τὰ ἀ. τὰ δοῦλα πάντα ἀπέδοτο X. HG 1.6.15.

data.quote: δοῦλος, ὅσοι δὲ ἦσαν ξεῖνοί τε καὶ δοῦλοι . . ἐν ἀνδραπόδων λόγῳ ποιεύμενος εἶχε
τὰ ἀ. πάντα, καὶ δοῦλα καὶ ἐλεύθερα
τὰ ἀ. τὰ δοῦλα πάντα ἀπέδοτο

children.label: II
children.definition: low fellow, ‘creature’, Pl. Grg. 483b, Thg. 130b, X. Mem. 4.2.39, D.Chr. 31.109; of a female slave, Pherecr. 16 D.

children.label: III
children.definition: Arr. Epict. 1.4.14, al.— Hom., Il. 7.475, has Ep. dat.pl. ἀνδραπόδεσσι (as if from ἀνδράπους), where Aristarch. proposed to read ἀνδραπόδοισι; but it is almost certain that the word was post-Homeric, and the line was rejected on that account by Zenod. and Ar.Byz. (Orig. pl.; formed on the analogy of τετράποδα, cf. τετραπόδων πάντων καὶ ἀνδραπόδων Foed.Delph.Pell. 1. B 7. Sg. in X. Ath. 1.18, etc.)

slavish, servile, abject, opp. ἐλευθέριος, Arist. EN 1128a21; ἀρετή Pl. Phd. 69b; ἄγροικος καὶ ἀνελεύθερος . . ἀ. τε Id. Lg. 880a, cf. X. Mem. 4.2.22; θηριώδης καὶ ἀ. Pl. R. 430b, cf. Arist. EN 1118a25; τεχνιτεῖαι Epicur. Ep. 2p.40U.; ἀ. θρίξ short coarse hair like that of slaves, hence metaph., ἔτι τὴν ἀ. τρίχα ἔχοντες ἐν τῆ ψυχῆ Pl. Alc. 1.120b. Adv. -δῶς Id. Smp. 215e.

data.quote: ἔτι τὴν ἀ. τρίχα ἔχοντες ἐν τῆ ψυχῆ

children.definition: servility, Arist. Pol. 1336b12, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.7b.
slave-dealer, Ar. Fr. 312.
tax on sale of slaves, SIG 4.8 ( Cyzicus).
Dim. of ἀνήρ, manikin, pitiful fellow, Ar. Ach. 517.
Sol. ap. Phot. p.126R

definition: ἀνδραφυκτεῖν φεύγειν, ἤ ἐπὶ φόνῳ διώκειν, Hsch.

children.definition: loading a man, as much as a man can carry, χερμάδια Od. 10.121; βώλακες A.R. 3.1334; γόγγροι Eudox. ap. Ath. 7.288c.
Att. form for ἀνδράχνη (1), Hellad. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.533B., S. Fr. 823, but in this passage, as in Thphr. HP 1.5.2, 1.9.3, = Arbutus Andrachne.

children.label: II
children.definition: warming-pan or brazier, Eust. 1571.25, Poet. ap. Suid. ἄνδραχλος, ἡ, = ἀνδράχνη, EM 102.36, v.l. in Thphr. HP 4.15.2.
purslane, Portulaca oleracea, Thphr. CP 1.10.4, al., Dsc. 2.124, Luc. Trag. 151, prob.l. in Pl. Com. 44; ἀ. κηπαία Dsc. 4.168.
ἀ. ἀγρία, = πεπλίς, Dsc. 4.168; but = Sedum stellatum, stonecrop, ib. 90; also= τηλέφιον, Ps.- Dsc. 2.186, Gal. 19.146.
ἀ. θαλασσία, = πεπλίς, Ps.- Dsc. 4.168.

definition: ἀνδρεία, ἡ, Ion. ἀνδρηίη ( Hdt. 7.99), generally written ἀνδρία in the Mss., in agreement with the opinion of A.D. Adv. 136.8, refuted by Orus ap. EM 461.53:— ἀνδρεία is required by the metre in Ar. Nu. 510, and may always stand in the few poet. passages where it occurs ( Simon. 58, A. Th. 52, S. El. 983, E. Tr. 674): ἀνδρία is required in E. HF 475 μέγα φρονῶν ἐπʼ ἀνδρίᾳ (s.v.l., εὐανδρίᾳ Elmsley): ἀνδρεία is also confirmed by the Ion. form ἀνδρηίη:—

children.definition: manliness, manly spirit, opp. δειλία, Il.cc., cf. Arist. Rh. 1366b11, EN 1115a6; also of women, S. El. 983, Arist. Pol. 1260a22; ἀνδρεία ἡ περὶ τὰς ναυτιλίας Str. 3.1.8:—in pl., brave deeds, Pl. Lg. 922a; ironically, αἱ διὰ τῶν λόγων ἀνδρεῖαι D. Prooem. 45.

children.label: II
children.definition: hardihood, insolence, D.Chr. 12.13.

children.label: III
children.definition: Antipho Soph. 67a.

children.label: IV
children.definition: membrum virile, Artem. 1.45.

children.label: V
children.definition: skill, LXX Ec. 4.4.
image of a man, App. BC 2.147, APl. 16.221 ( Theaet.).

children.label: II
children.definition: flesh-coloured pigment, Pl. R. 501b, Cra. 424e, X. Oec. 10.5, Arist. GA 725a26, Thphr. Lap. 51.
like a man, εἴδωλα D.H. 1.38; διατύπωσις Plu. Alex. 72.
Suid.

definition: ἀνδρεῖος, α, ον, Ion. ἀνδρ-ήιος, η, ον (codd. of Hdt. have the common form in the Comp. and Sup. ἀνδρειότερος, -ότατος, 1.79, 123), Delph. ἀνδρέος GDI 1724, al.:—

children.definition: of or for a man, στέγη dub. in A. Fr. 124; θαἰμάτια Ar. Ec. 75; opp. γυναικεῖος, Id. Th. 154, Archipp. 6D., Pl. R. 451c, X. Mem. 2.7.5; πέπλοι Theoc. 28.10 (where ἀνδρέϊοι) ; αὐλός (v. αὐλός) Hdt. 1.17; ἀ. ἀγορά the menʼs market, CIG 3657 ( Cyzicus); ἀνδρεῖος (sc. σύλλογος) Test.Epict. 1.22, 2.29; ἀνδρεῖα ἠμπίσχετο vestem virilem, D.L. 3.46; ἀ. ἱμάτιον, = toga virilis, Plu. Brut. 14.

children.label: II
children.definition: manly, masculine, courageous, ῥώμη Hdt. 7.153, etc.; even of women, Arist. Pol. 1277b22, Po. 1454a23; and in bad sense, stubborn, ἀναίσχυντος καὶ ἀ. τὰ τοιαῦτα Luc. Ind. 3: neut., τὸ ἀνδρεῖον, = ἀνδρεία, Th. 2.39; καὶ τοῦτʼ ἐμοὶ τἀνδρεῖον ἡ προμηθία E. Supp. 510; ἔβησαν εἰς τἀνδρεῖον Id. Andr. 683. Adv. -ως Ar. Pax 498, al.: Sup. -ότατα Pl. Plt. 262a.

data.quote: καὶ τοῦτʼ ἐμοὶ τἀνδρεῖον ἡ προμηθία

children.definition: Arist. HA 488b17, cf. Pl. La. 196d, 196e.
strong, vigorous, λαφυγμός Eup. 148; θήρατρον Ael. VH 1.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀνδρεῖα, τά, the public meals of the Cretans, also the older name for the Spartan φειδίτια or φιλίτια (q.v.), Alcm. 22, Arist. Pol. 1272a3, Plu. Lyc. 12, Str. 10.4.18 (v.l. ἄνδρια:—also ἀνδρήιον, τό, Cretan for the public hall, GDI 4992 a ii 9, cf. 5040.38, al.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἀνδρεῖον, τό, = σίνηπι ἄγριον, Ps.-Dsc. 2.154.
X. An. 6.5.14, Ti.Locr. 103d.
fill with courage, τὰ σπλάγχνα LXX 4 Ma. 15.23:— Pass., become a man, Procl. Par.Ptol. 89.
man-slaying, epith. of Ἐνυάλιος, Il. 2.651, etc.; but the metre requires ἀδρι-φόντης, cf. ἀνδρότης.
manly effort, Metrod. Herc. 831.12.

definition: ἀνδρειών, ῶνος, ὁ, poet. for ἀνδρεών, ἀνδρών, AP 9.322 ( Leon.).
ἀνδρεράστια, v.l. for sq. in Poll. 3.70, cf. Phryn. PS p.34B.

children.definition: woman that is fond of men, Ar. Th. 392 ( ἀνδρεάστρια cod. R).
banish from house and home, ἐκ γῆς τῆσδε A. Ag. 1419, cf. Eu. 221; ἐκ πόλεώς τε καὶ δόμων Ag. 1586, cf. S. OT 100, Pl. R. 565e, etc.:— Pass., D.C. 47.19.
he that drives one from his home, dub.l. in A. Th. 637, cf. Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄνδρια, τά, v. ἀνδρεῖος III.

definition: ἀνδριαντάριον, τό, Dim. of ἀνδριάς, POxy. 1459.58 (iii A.D.), Sch. Luc. Lex. 3.
ἀνδριαντίδιον, τό, = foreg., SIG 2588.167, al.( Delos).
ἀνδριάντιον, τό, = foreg., IG 11.161 B119 ( Delos, iii B.C.), GDI 5063 ( Itanos).

children.definition: statuette, IG 2(2).47.5,20 (iv B.C.), 11.161 B17,60 ( Delos, iii B.C.), GDI 5702 ( Samos); puppet, Plu. Thes. 20.
carver of statues, Tz.ad Lyc. 615.
like a statue, Aethlius 1.
niche for a statue, CIG 2749.1 ( Aphrodisias).
modeller of statues, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).213 ( Rhetor.), Eust. 206.37.
art of modelling, S.E. M. 11.188.
make statues, X. Mem. 3.1.2.
the sculptorʼs art, statuary, Pl. Grg. 450c, X. Mem. 1.4.3.
