definition: ἀνδριαντοποιϊκή (sc. τέχνη), ἡ, = foreg., Arist. Ph. 195a6, Metaph. 1013b6 (v.l. -ποιητική, which is found in Id. PA 640a30, Ocell. 2.3).

children.definition: sculptor, Pi. N. 5.1, Pl. R. 540c, etc.; statuary in bronze (cf. ἀνδριάς), opp. λιθουργός, Arist. EN 1041a11.
sculpture, Tz. H. 8.348.

definition: ἀνδριάς, ὁ, gen. άντος ( Att. ᾶντος, acc. to Hdn.Gr. 1.51): ( ἀνήρ):—

children.definition: image of a man, statue, Pi. P. 5.40, Hdt. 1.183, 2.91, Ar. Pax 1183, Th. 1.134, etc.; ἀνδριάντας καὶ ἄλλα ζῷα λίθινά τε καὶ ξύλινα Pl. R. 515a; ἀνδριάντας γράφειν paint statues, ib. 420c; esp. of portrait-statues, ἀ. εἰκονικός Plu. Lys. 1; ἀ. ὁλοσώματος IG 12(7).240 ( Amorgos); ἀ. ἔφιππος SIG 730.26 ( Olbia); of female figures, Ath. 10.425f, etc.; of men, opp. ἀγάλματα of the gods, Gorg. Hel. 18, Plb. 21.29.9; rarely of gods, GDI 5421 ( Delos): prov., λάλος, οὐκ ἀ. Luc. Vit.Auct. 3; ἀπαθὴς ὡς ἀ. Arr. Epict. 3.2.4; ἀνδριάντος γυμνότερος D.Chr. 34.3: ironically, τὸν καλὸν ἀ., a motherʼs term of endearment, D. 18.129; μακρὸν ἀ. παίζειν, a kind of game, Thphr. Char. 27.12.

data.quote: ἀνδριάντας καὶ ἄλλα ζῷα λίθινά τε καὶ ξύλινα

children.definition: make a man of, make manly, τοὺς γεωργοῦντας X. Oec. 5.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass. or Med., come to manhood, Ar. Fr. 744, Hyp. Fr. 228, Luc. Anach. 15.
play the man, X. An. 4.3.34, Pl. Tht. 151d, Arist. EN 1115b4, LXX Jo. 1.6, al., 1 Ep.Cor. 16.13; dress like a man, Philostr. Im. 1.2.
D.C. 79.5; of a eunuch, ἀ. ἐπὶ γυναῖκα Philostr. VA 1.37, cf. Ep. 54, Ach.Tat. 4.1.

masculine, manly, Pl. R. 474e, etc.; [ δίαιτα] σώφρων καὶ ἀ. Id. Ep. 359a; νοσήματα Hp. Mul. 1.62; ἀ. ἱδρώς the sweat of manly toil, Ar. Ach. 693; σφηκὸς ἀνδρικώτερον Id. V. 1090, cf. 1077; ἐσθής D.C. 45.2; τὸ τῆς χρόας ἀ. Arist. Fr. 542: Comp., Anaxandr. 1 D. c. inf., πίνειν καὶ φαγεῖν μὲν ἀνδρικοί like men to eat and drink, Eub. 12. Adv. -κῶς like a man, Ar. Eq. 599, V. 153, al.: Comp. -ώτερον Id. Pax 515: Sup. -ώτατα Id. Eq. 81; opp. ἀνάνδρως, Pl. Tht. 177b.
large, Eub. 56.

children.label: II
children.definition: composed of men, χορός X. HG 6.4.16, Lys. 21.1.

definition: Ἀνδρίνεια, τά, festival at Phigalea (prob. from the founderʼs name), IG 5(2).422 (ii/i B.C.).

children.definition: Dim. of ἀνήρ, manikin, Ar. Pax 51; pitiful fellow, E. ap.Phot.p.127 R., Theoc. 5.40, cf. Eup. 316.

definition: ἀνδρίς, ίδος, ἡ, fem. of ἀνήρ,

children.definition: woman, Sm. Ge. 2.23.
genuine, straightforward dealing, in pl. (opp. εἰρωνεύματα), Max.Tyr. 38.4.
one must play the man, Pl. Phd. 90e.
like a man, like men, Ar. Ec. 149, cf. Crates Com. 3D., Theoc. 18.23; with a male voice, εἰπεῖν τι D.Chr. 33.38.
foot-path or sidewalk, IGRom. 1.980.
foot-path, ὀδὸς ἀ. GDI 5690 ( Erythrae), cf. Hsch.
= paedicator, Hsch. s.v. παιδοπίπας.
living like a man, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. θρύπτεται.
man-devouring, AP 7.206 ( Damoch.), Q.S. 6.247.
of manly counsel, man-minded, like ἀνδρόφρων, A. Ag. 11, cf. Phryn. PS p.31B.: opp. γυναικόβουλος.
man-eating, cannibal, γνάθος E. Cyc. 93; χαρμοναί Id. HF 384; ἡδοναί Fr. 537.
Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.175.

definition: ἀνδρογένεια, ἡ, (γένος), κατʼ ἀνδρογενείην of descent by

children.definition: the manʼs side, Hp. Ep. 27; πρεσβύτατος κατʼ ἀ. SIG 1044.20 (Halic.), cf. 1106.25 ( Cos).
giant-man, Call. Cer. 35.
begetting men, ἡμέρα ἀ. a day favourable for begetting (or for the birth of) male children, Hes. Op. 783, 788.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., common to men and women, λουτρὰ ἀ. baths used by both at once, AP 9.783.
Theol.Ar. 32.
man-woman, hermaphrodite, Pl. Smp. 189e.
womanish man, effeminate person, Hp. Vict. 1.28, Hdt. 4.67, Aeschin. 2.127, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.219f, cf. LXX Pr. 18.8; ἀνδρογύνων ἄθυρμα Eup. 3D.
= pathicus, cinaedus, AP 6.254 ( Myrin.), cf. Lib. Decl. 12.42.

children.label: b
children.definition: Sapphic, ἀ. ἔρωτες Luc. Am. 28, cf. Artem. 2.12.
man-slaying, murderous, A. Ch. 860, cf. Fr. 132.
man-taming, φόβος, ῥιπὰ οἴνου, Pi. N. 3.39, Fr. 166; man-slaying, of Eriphyle, Id. N. 9.16 (ubi al. ἀνδροδάμαν τʼ pro- δάμαντʼ).

children.label: II
children.definition: arsenical pyrites, Ps.-Democr.Alch. p.45B.
Eust. 1573.29, Hsch.
subduing men, ἀνίη Epigr.Gr. 1034.32 ( Callipolis).
man-goddess, i.e. Athena. AP 15.22 ( Simm.).
from a man, ἀ. ἐκκέχυθʼ ἵππος, of a Centaur, APl. 16.115.
Philostr. VS 1.8.
murderous, φθοραί A. Ag. 814.
slave-dealer, Gal. 6.530, Orib. 14.48.1.
lewd woman, wanton, Pherecr. 17D.
Hsch.: ἀνδροκ-άδες· πόα τις, Id.
weakening men, of the climacterical year, i.e. the 63rd, Firm. 4.20.3:—also ἀνδρο-κλάστης, ου, ὁ, prob. in Critodem. ap. Vett.Val. 237.7.
man-wearying, λοιγός, μόχθοι, A. Supp. 678, Eu. 248; man-slaying, πέλεκυς Id. Ch. 889; ἀνδροκμῆτας προσφέρων ἀγωνίας E. Supp. 525.
wrought by menʼs hands, τύμβος Il. 11.371.
rogue, Hsch., Suid.
sleep with a man, BGU 1058.30 (i B.C.), Aët. 1.142.
AB 394, Hsch.
a Man-Corinth, in allusion to the lewdness of the men of Heraclea and the women of Corinth, Stratonic. ap. Ath. 8.351c.

slaughter of men in battle, mostly in pl., παύσασθαι . . Ἄρην ἀνδροκτασιάων Il. 5.909; μάχας τʼ ἀνδροκτασίας τε 7.237, etc.: personified, Hes. Th. 228: in sg., ἀνδροκτασίης ὕπο λυγρῆς by reason of sad homicide, Il. 23.86, cf. Hes. Oxy. 1359.1.17, A. Th. 693 (lyr.).
Vett.Val. 237.7.
